original: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid @147a * //üîΩdo ; / sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid @147a * // do ; / sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //üîΩphyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi // phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
translated: Suffering is not the only thing that does not exist in four ways.

original: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //
translated: External things also do not exist in four ways.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzugs la sogs pa phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: External things such as form also do not exist in four ways, as has been explained.

original: de la re zhig gzugs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig gzugs kyi dbang du byas nas bshad par bya ste /
translated: Here, first of all, we will consider form.

original: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te /
analyzed: gzugs ni bdag nyid kyis ma byas te /
translated: Form is not self-made,

original: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir tshul sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa la byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir tshul sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is untenable that an existent or a nonexistent can be made, as has been explained in the previous method.

original: yang na brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na brten nas byung ba'i phyir dper na myu gu bzhin no //
translated: Or, because it arises dependently, like a sprout.

original: 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis kyang ma byas pa ste ;
analyzed: 'byung ba gzhan du gyur pa dag gis kyang ma byas pa ste ;
translated: It is not made by the elements,

original: de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gzhan nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is untenable that they are different.

original: de ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /
translated: How is that unacceptable?

original: 'byung ba chen po dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag ni gzugs las gzhan du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: The great elements are not different from form,

original: phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: phyi rol pa yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs kyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are external, like the intrinsic nature of form itself.

original: yang na rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yang na rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir te /
translated: Or, because substantial existence is refuted,

original: med pa la gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa la gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because difference is untenable for what does not exist.

original: gnyi gas kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: gnyi gas kyang ma byas te /
translated: They are not produced by both,

original: re res byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re res byed pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because production by each is untenable.

original: rgyu med pa las kyang byung ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa las kyang byung ba yang ma yin te /
translated: They do not arise without a cause,

original: rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med par smra ba bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the assertion of causelessness is refuted.

original: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra la sogs pa dag la yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: Sound and so on should be stated in the same way.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid du brjod pas sdug bsngal ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is that since the meaning of the reason stated by the opponent in the first chapter is unestablished, suffering is shown to be essenceless.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa /üîΩgzugs ni bde ba'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa / gzugs ni bde ba'am /
translated: Therefore, SuvikrƒÅntavikrƒÅmin,üîΩform is neither happiness nor

original: sdug bsngal ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin no //
translated: suffering.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa yang bde ba'am /
translated: Likewise, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are neither happiness nor

original: sdug bsngal ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin no //
translated: suffering.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa bde ba'am /
translated: Form, feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness that are neither happiness norüîΩsuffering are the perfection of wisdom.

original: sdug bsngal ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa rnam grangs nges kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ma yin pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa rnam grangs nges kyang khyod kyis 'di ltar shes par bya ste /
translated: And likewise, BrahmƒÅ, you should understand this through the following explanation:

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ni 'phags pa rnams kyi bden pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The noble truths of suffering, origination, cessation, and path are not the truths of the noble ones.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ma skyes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi lam mo zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos @147b kyi theg par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam ma skyes pa ni 'phags pa rnams kyi lam mo zhes bya ba dang / nyan thos @147b kyi theg par yang bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: Thus, the non-arising of suffering, origin, cessation, and path is the path of the noble ones, and the Lord also taught this in the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle.

original: kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal bdag gis byas sam /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma sdug bsngal bdag gis byas sam /
translated: ‚ÄúO Gautama, is suffering self-made?

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Venerable, it is not.

original: gzhan gyis byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas sam /
translated: Is it made by another?

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Venerable, it is not.

original: gnyi gas byas sam /
analyzed: gnyi gas byas sam /
translated: Is it made by both?

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no //üîΩbdag gis kyang ma byas /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no // bdag gis kyang ma byas /
translated: Venerable, it is not.

original: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas pas byas sam /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang ma byas pas byas sam /
translated: Is it made by neither?

original: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: Venerable, it is not.‚Äù

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter of the Root Commentary on the Middle Way called Wisdom Lamp, called ‚ÄúExamination of Suffering.‚Äù

original: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: // / dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu pa /
translated: CHAPTER THIRTEEN

original: da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: da ni sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dang / rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in response to the objections, the thirteenth chapter is begun in order to teach the meaning of the power of the lack of entityness of conditioned phenomena from the perspective of the power of autonomous inference.

original: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
analyzed: chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
translated: ‚ÄúAny phenomenon that is deceptive is false.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i skye bo bdag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'drid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa de la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni log pa'i shes pas dmigs par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / byis pa'i skye bo bdag la sogs pa'i tshul gyis 'drid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, ‚Äúfalse‚Äù means that which is observed by mistaken consciousness and that which deceives childish beings by the mode of self and so on.

original: slu ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig gi yin la /
analyzed: slu ba zhes bya ba ni dran pa la sogs pa don dam pa'i yul can dag rab tu slu ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // de la brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig gi yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúDeceptive‚Äù means that memory, etc., which have ultimate objects, are causes of deception.üîΩ‚ÄúFalse‚Äù is a word of instruction;

original: slu ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig gi yin no //
analyzed: slu ba zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig gi yin no //
translated: ‚Äúdeceptive‚Äù is a word of explanation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni mdo sde las so //
translated: The Blessed One said this means in the s≈´tras.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni nye bar bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúthis‚Äù refers to the meaning of the teaching.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las ji skad gsungs she na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las ji skad gsungs she na /
translated: What did the Blessed One say in the s≈´tras?

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa las kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: In the ≈örƒÅvaka Vehicle, for example, he said:

original: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so //
analyzed: 'dus byas gang yin pa de ni brdzun pa slu ba'i chos so //
translated: Whatever is compounded is false and deceptive.

original: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Bhik·π£us, it is like this:

original: mi bslu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go //
analyzed: mi bslu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go //
translated: The nondeceptive phenomenon, nirvƒÅ·πáa, is the supreme truth.

original: 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin /
analyzed: 'dus byas de ni slu ba'i chos kyang yin /
translated: That compounded phenomenon is a deceptive phenomenon.

original: de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: de ni rab tu 'jig pa'i chos kyang yin no zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: It is also a phenomenon that completely perishes.

original: theg pa chen po las kyang rab 'byor ci tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po las kyang rab 'byor ci tsam du 'dus byas pa de tsam du brdzun la /
translated: The Mahayana also says, ‚ÄúSubhuti, whatever is compounded is false.

original: ji tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ji tsam du 'dus ma byas pa de tsam du mi brdzun no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Whatever is uncompounded is not false.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung dag yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i lung dag yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because there are scriptures accepted by both sides,

original: 'dus byas thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: all compounded things are false

original: 'dis ni 'du byed kyi chos ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan to //üîΩde @148a * //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'du byed kyi chos ni slu ba'i chos nyid yin par bstan to // de @148a * //
translated: This shows that compounded things are false by nature.

original: na de dag brdzun pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: na de dag brdzun pa yin // zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore they are false

original: de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin na //
analyzed: de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin na //
translated: This means that they are essenceless. This is a concluding statement.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin te /
translated: Here the syllogism is: Ultimately, internal things are empty of essence

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are false things,

original: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, the body of a woman conjured up by a magician.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say that

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag ni yan lag gsum smra ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas pa dag ni yan lag gsum smra ba yin pas de'i phyir nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba'i tshig dag mi rigs so //
translated: Thus, the Buddhists maintain that there are three members of a syllogism, and therefore the statement of the application and the statement of the conclusion are not reasonable.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good,

original: 'di ltar nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan nyid du mi 'dod mod kyi de dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu ba dag yan lag gzhan nyid du mi 'dod mod kyi de dag sbyar bar mi bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: because although the statement of the application and the statement of the conclusion are not maintained to be separate members, it is not the case that they are not to be applied.

original: gzhan du na gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang la chos mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe yod pa la sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Otherwise, in the case of a limited example that has a property in common, sound is impermanent

original: byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is produced.

original: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: byas pa ni mi rtag par mthong ste /
translated: That which is produced is seen to be impermanent,

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, like a pot.üîΩSound is also like that, so because it is produced, it is impermanent.

original: sgra yang de bzhin pas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe ba yod pa sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra yang de bzhin pas de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gang la chos mi mthun pa'i dpe nyi tshe ba yod pa sgra ni mi rtag ste byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And similarly, in the case of a limited example that has a property that is not common, sound is impermanent because it is produced.

original: ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste /
analyzed: ma byas pa ni rtag par mthong ste /
translated: That which is not produced is seen to be permanent,

original: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: for example, like space.

original: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te byas pa yin pas /
analyzed: sgra ni de ltar ma byas pa ma yin te byas pa yin pas /
translated: Sound is not unproduced, but is produced.üîΩSince it is produced in that way, it is impermanent.

original: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa don gyi tshig dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ltar byas pa'i phyir mi rtag go zhes bya ba dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa don gyi tshig dag la dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don ji ltar gsal bar 'gyur /
translated: How is the meaning of the thesis in such statements clarified?

original: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni de dag mi dgos te don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig dag la ni de dag mi dgos te don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In statements of application, those are not necessary because they are meaningless.

original: yan lag lngar smra ba dag na re /
analyzed: yan lag lngar smra ba dag na re /
translated: Those who advocate five members say:

original: yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do /
analyzed: yan lag gsum nyid du mi rigs te bsgrub par bya ba chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni dpe la de med pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa nyid do /
translated: It is illogical to have only three members because if the reason is stated only in relation to the property of the thesis, then it is not common to the example because it does not exist there.

original: dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //üîΩspyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med de /
analyzed: dpe'i chos 'ba' zhig la gtan tshigs brjod na ni gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do // spyi'i chos la gtan tshigs brjod na ni rjes su 'gro ba bstan pa don med de /
translated: If the reason is stated only in relation to the property of the example, then the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe'i chos la yang spyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the reason is stated in relation to the general property, then it is meaningless to teach the forward pervasion because it is taught in relation to the property of the example.

original: dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du ston na ni bsgrub par bya ba la yang de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos so //
analyzed: dpe la gtan tshigs kyi rjes su 'gro ba yod pa nyid du ston na ni bsgrub par bya ba la yang de dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i tshig gzhan brjod dgos so //
translated: If you show that the example has the property of the reason, then you must state another sentence that shows the relation to the probandum.

original: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par 'grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa'i mjug thogs su smos pas bsgrub par bya ba dang 'brel par 'grub bo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the relation to the probandum is established by stating it after the thesis,

original: de lta na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: de lta na sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: then it would be established that ‚ÄúSound is impermanent

original: mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur @148b ro ;
analyzed: mig gis gzung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yang 'grub par 'gyur @148b ro ;
translated: because it is perceived by the eye.‚Äù

original: / grags pa de dang de 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na ni khyed kyi dpe la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: / grags pa de dang de 'brel par 'grub pa nyid du rtog na ni khyed kyi dpe la yang de bzhin du 'gyur te /
translated: If you imagine that the relation to that which is renowned is established, then your example would be just like that.

original: de ltar bum pa la sogs pa byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi sgra ni byas pa nyid du mi rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar bum pa la sogs pa byas pa nyid du rtogs par 'gyur gyi sgra ni byas pa nyid du mi rtogs so //
translated: In that case, a pot, etc., would be understood to be produced, but sound would not be understood to be produced.

original: nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu bdag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar sbyar ba dang / mjug bsdu bdag yan lag gzhan ma yin te /
translated: The application and the conclusion are not different parts,

original: don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: don la khyad par med pa'i phyir dper na gtan tshigs nyid bzhin no zhe na /
translated: because there is no difference in meaning, just like the reason itself.

original: de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: The meaning of the reason is not established,

original: nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: nye bar sbyar bas bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma brjod kyang gcig tu byed pa'i phyir dang / gtan tshigs grub na yang smos pas mjug bsdu ba brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: because even though the thesis and the reason are not stated, they are made into one by the application, and because when the reason is established, the conclusion is stated by the application.

original: de la 'dir gtan tshigs spyir grags pa nyid brjod pas gtan tshigs nyid phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par 'grub bo //
analyzed: de la 'dir gtan tshigs spyir grags pa nyid brjod pas gtan tshigs nyid phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi ga dang 'brel par 'grub bo //
translated: Here, by stating the generally known reason, the reason itself is established as related to both the similar and dissimilar positions.

original: dpe bstan pa ni /
analyzed: dpe bstan pa ni /
translated: The example is taught

original: mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: in order to understand the specific similar position,

original: phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dam bcas pa bstan pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: phyogs bye brag tu rtogs par bya ba'i phyir dam bcas pa bstan pa bzhin pas /
translated: because the specific position is to be understood, just like the thesis is taught.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don nyid nye bar sbyar bas brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don nyid nye bar sbyar bas brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is stated by the application.

original: gtan tshigs smos na yang dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don tha ma dad pa'i phyir don de nyid mjug sdud pas byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs smos na yang dam bcas pa'i yan lag gi don tha ma dad pa'i phyir don de nyid mjug sdud pas byed pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: If you say that the reason is not established, that is not so, because the meaning of the final part of the thesis is established by the conclusion.

original: yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub na yan lag bzhi 'am lnga sbyor ba don med pas de ni lan ma yin no //
analyzed: yan lag gsum gyis bsgrub par bya ba grub na yan lag bzhi 'am lnga sbyor ba don med pas de ni lan ma yin no //
translated: If the probandum is established by the three parts, it is pointless to add a fourth or fifth part, so that is not the reply.

original: grangs la sogs pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa'i yan lag gi mtshan nyid ni dpyad par mi bya ste /
translated: The definition of the number of parts and so on should not be analyzed,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lead to absurd consequences.üîΩHere, the words of the author of the treatise are mostly used in three ways: by the definition of a similar property, by the definition of a dissimilar property, and by the definition of a reason.

original: 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: 'di na bstan bcos byed pa'i tshig dag ni phal cher chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / chos mi mthun pa'i mtshan nyid dang / gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum gyis tha snyad byed de phyogs kyi chos nyid dang mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba dang /
translated: The property of the subject is the pervasion of the similar property

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pas te /
translated: and the absence in the dissimilar property.

original: de'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs tsam zhig bstan to //
translated: Therefore, I have taught only a portion of it.

original: zhar la bshad pa'i gtam gyis chos gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
analyzed: zhar la bshad pa'i gtam gyis chos gi skabs nyid dpyad par bya'o //
translated: The discussion of the Dharma should be analyzed in the context of the discussion of the ancillary topics.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa la kha cig na re ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni med pa'i don yin la /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa bstan pa la kha cig na re ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ni med pa'i don yin la /
translated: In this way, in the demonstration of the inference that reveals the lack of entityness, someone says: ‚ÄúThe emptiness of entityness is the meaning of nonexistence.

original: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i zhes bya ba yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos yin pa'i zhes bya ba yang med pa'i phyir don de nyid yin pas /
translated: The statement, ‚Äòbecause of being a deceptive phenomenon,‚Äô also has the meaning of nonexistence.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid kyi skyon yod pas 'dod pa'i don mi 'grub bo zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, since it is only a portion of the meaning of the thesis, the probative argument, the reason, is incomplete, and so the intended meaning is not established.‚Äù

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: @149a * // gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: @149a * // gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
translated: If it is a deceptive phenomenon,

original: de brdzun 'di la ci zhig slu //
analyzed: de brdzun 'di la ci zhig slu //
translated: what is deceptive about it?

original: gal te dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don med pa nyid yin na de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gal te dam bcas pa'i gtan tshigs de'i don med pa nyid yin na de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur //
translated: If the probative argument of the thesis is the meaning of nonexistence, what is deceptive about it?

original: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: cung zad kyang slu bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nothing at all is deceptive about it.

original: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin pas 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin pas 'dus byas brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa'i tshig nyid kyang med do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because it does not exist, like the horn of a rabbit, even the words ‚Äúthe statement ‚Äòconditioned phenomena are false‚Äô do not exist‚Äù are intended to mean that.

original: de lta bas na brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa'i don ni med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na brdzun pa dang / slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa'i don ni med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the statement ‚Äúfalse and deceptive phenomena‚Äù is not nonexistence.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: de gnyis kyi don ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang log par snang ba yin pas /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi don ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid dang log par snang ba yin pas /
translated: The meaning of those two is the emptiness of the imagined nature and the appearance of error.

original: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: dam bcas pa'i don gyi phyogs gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not just one part of the meaning of the thesis.

original: log par snang ba la yang phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i phyir des na gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
analyzed: log par snang ba la yang phyogs gnyi ga la grags pa'i phyir des na gtan tshigs ma tshang ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
translated: Moreover, since the appearance of error is renowned to both parties, the reason is not incomplete, and thus the intended meaning is established.

original: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan yang bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa /
translated: Moreover, the BhagavƒÅn said this:üîΩI teach emptiness

original: stong nyid yongs su ston pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid yongs su ston pa yin //
translated: And also origination from conditions.

original: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs phyung bas slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das nyon mongs pa dang / shes bya'i sgrib pa rtsa ba dang bcas pa ma lus pa drungs phyung bas slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin te /
translated: The Transcendent Lord taught the term ‚Äúdeceptive phenomena‚Äù in order to thoroughly teach emptiness, since it is the complete and total eradication of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience together with their roots.

original: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa ni de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na smra ba pos phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pas de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa ni de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir dper na smra ba pos phyogs 'di du ba dang bcas pa yin no zhes smras pas de me dang bcas pa nyid yin par ston pa bzhin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúdeceptive phenomena‚Äù is used because they do not occur if that does not exist, just as when a speaker says, ‚ÄúThis place is smoky,‚Äù he thereby indicates that it is fiery.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa /
translated: ‚ÄúThe term ‚Äòfalse‚Äô is used,

original: de ni yod mod kyi /
analyzed: de ni yod mod kyi /
translated: but that is not the case,

original: 'on kyang med pa'i phyir don kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang med pa'i phyir don kyang ma yin la /
translated: because it is not an object,

original: chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa yongs su ston par byed pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not a teaching of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas ni /
translated: Thus, the Transcendent Lord‚Äôs statement, ‚ÄòFalse‚Äô

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //üîΩgzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de // gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: teaches that things do not intrinsically exist,

original: zhes bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bstan te /
translated: because they are seen to change into something else.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because it appears as if it were something else.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pas dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: The Lord has said that it is false, and thus he has taught that the realitylessness of things is their non-abiding reality.

original: 'di ltar brtags par rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags par rigs te /
translated: It is reasonable to investigate this as follows:

original: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med dngos med de //
translated: There is no realitylessness in things,

original: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: but how is it that they are said to be realityless?

original: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: They have intrinsic reality.

original: khyod kyi lugs ltar na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: khyod kyi lugs ltar na dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'gyur bas de ni mi rigs te /
translated: But according to your system, things would be realityless, and that is unreasonable.

original: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
translated: Because things are empty.

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi ba nyid dang @149b bral ba de'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi ba nyid dang @149b bral ba de'i phyir stong pa nyid ces bya ba'i dngos po med pa ni ma yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: Because things are devoid of self and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù therefore, it is not the case that there is a non-entity called ‚Äúemptiness.‚Äù Therefore,

original: dngos po yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: one should understand that things exist.

original: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na //
analyzed: ci ste de ltar mi 'dod na //
translated: But if you do not accept this,

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If they have no intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: Whose transformation is it?

original: de yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ni /
analyzed: de yang mthong bas de'i phyir dngos po rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pa ni /
translated: Since it is seen, therefore the transformation of things exists.

original: bsgrub pa'i chos yin pas rjes su dpag par nus te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i chos yin pas rjes su dpag par nus te /
translated: Since it is the property to be established, it can be inferred.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod de gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Ultimately, things have intrinsic reality because they transform.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist does not transform.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the son of a barren woman.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod do //
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba yod pas de'i phyir don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod do //
translated: Since internal things transform, therefore ultimately things have intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yin na //
translated: If it is intrinsic reality,

original: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //üîΩngo bo nyid yin pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur // ngo bo nyid yin pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi rigs te /
translated: How could it transform?üîΩIt is illogical that intrinsic reality transforms.

original: ngo bo nyid ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni nyams par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because intrinsic reality does not deteriorate.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mthong ste de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid na mi 'byung bas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba ni mthong ste de yang ngo bo nyid med pa nyid na mi 'byung bas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: But it is seen to change, and since that is not possible if it is essenceless, the meaning of the reason is contradictory.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin no //
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba'i don ni log par snang ba'i don yin mod kyi dngos po med pa'i don ma yin no //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúdeceptive phenomena‚Äù is that they appear falsely, but it does not mean that they are nonexistent.

original: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa des ni dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ces bya ba bdag med pa nyid bstan te /
translated: The statement ‚Äúfalse‚Äù teaches that things are essenceless, that is, that they are without self,

original: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni bdag gi tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the term ‚Äúessence‚Äù is a synonym for ‚Äúself.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: Because change is seen.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that change is seen.

original: de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir bdag med pa nyid ston pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúfalse‚Äù teaches selflessness, because it does not occur if there is no selflessness.

original: stong pa nyid ston pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ston pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it does not teach emptiness.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes shing 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mi drungs ma phyung ba dag la ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi rnam par snang la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i lam ma skyes shing 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mi drungs ma phyung ba dag la ni nang dang phyi rol gyi dngos po rnams bdag dang bdag gi rnam par snang la /
translated: Thus, for those in whom the noble path has not arisen and the view of the transitory collection has not been eradicated, things appear as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù whether internal or external.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par skyes pa rnams la ni de ltar yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yang dag par skyes pa rnams la ni de ltar yul gyi dngos por mi 'gyur bas /
translated: But for those in whom the noble path has arisen, things do not appear as objects.

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir log par snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir log par snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because of the appearance of the false ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs so //üîΩde la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang bdag gi med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //üîΩci ste ngo bo nyid @150a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs so // de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag dang bdag gi med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no // ci ste ngo bo nyid @150a * //
translated: the Lord said that they are false.üîΩIf you prove that things that lack intrinsic reality do not have the self and being of a self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas, then you are proving what is already established.üîΩBut if you prove that they lack intrinsic reality,

original: stong pa nyid ces par sgrub na ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces par sgrub na ni /
translated: then you are proving what is not established.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid ces bya ba dngos po med pa'i mtshan nyid med pas des na gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ba' zhig la yod pa'i phyir don 'gal ba nyid
translated: Since the emptiness of intrinsic reality is not the characteristic of a non-entity, therefore the reason exists only in the discordant side, so the meaning is contradictory.

original: do // 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: do // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: khyed ngo bo nyid med pa dag ri bong gi rva bzhin du /
analyzed: khyed ngo bo nyid med pa dag ri bong gi rva bzhin du /
translated: You who are without intrinsic reality, like the horn of a rabbit,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags nas kun du skrag par gyur pa ni dper na byis pa dag mtshan mo rang gi grib ma la /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du sgro btags nas kun du skrag par gyur pa ni dper na byis pa dag mtshan mo rang gi grib ma la /
translated: are imagined to be without intrinsic reality, and so you are completely terrified. For example, like children who, at night, imagine their own shadows

original: 'dre nyid du sgro btags nas skrag pa'i skad 'byin pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'dre nyid du sgro btags nas skrag pa'i skad 'byin pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: to be demons and cry out in fear.

original: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te ngo bo nyid med pa dag mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis bdag med do zhes bya bar sgrub na ni /
translated: If you who are without intrinsic reality are established as ‚Äúselfless‚Äù because of the self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas,

original: grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag brjod mod kyi /
analyzed: grub pa la sgrub pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag brjod mod kyi /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúyou are establishing what is already established.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang nyon cig / gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi de dag las gzhan na yang med la rang nyid kyang ma yin pas de dag la bdag med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba de brdzun pa zhes gsungs
analyzed: 'on kyang nyon cig / gal te mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gi de dag las gzhan na yang med la rang nyid kyang ma yin pas de dag la bdag med pa'i dngos po bdag med pa nyid ces bya ba de brdzun pa zhes gsungs
translated: If you say that since the self imputed by the tƒ´rthikas does not exist apart from those and is not itself those, the nonexistence of a self in those is called selflessness, and that is taught to be false,

original: pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer na de ltar gyur kyang sla ste /
analyzed: pa nyid kyis bstan par bya ba yin no zhes zer na de ltar gyur kyang sla ste /
translated: then that is easy to explain.

original: gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyar bas /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs sbyar bas /
translated: If you apply a reason to teach that things are empty of intrinsic reality,

original: gang zag bdag med pa nyid kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ston par byed na yang dper na mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs sbyar bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i
analyzed: gang zag bdag med pa nyid kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ston par byed na yang dper na mi rtag pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir byas pa nyid ces bya ba'i gtan tshigs sbyar bas sdug bsngal la sogs pa dag kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i
translated: and you also teach selflessness in persons because it does not occur if that is not present, then it would be like applying the reason called ‚Äúbecause it is produced‚Äù to teach impermanence, and suffering and so on would also be taught because they do not occur if that is not present.

original: phyir ston par byed pa dang 'dra la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ston par byed pa nyid yin pas kho bo cag la ci gnod /
analyzed: phyir ston par byed pa dang 'dra la ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid kyang ston par byed pa nyid yin pas kho bo cag la ci gnod /
translated: But since the emptiness of intrinsic reality is also the one who teaches, what harm is there for us?

original: slu ba'i chos nyid kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos nyid kyang de med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: And the very nature of deception is that it does not occur if that does not exist.

original: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang 'gal ba ltar snang ba yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i bud med kyi lus bzhin no zhes bya ba de yang 'gal ba ltar snang ba yin no //
translated: So that which appears to be contradictory, like the body of a woman emanated by a magician, is also like that.

original: 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de /üîΩlta ba po'i yang dag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus na shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na thag pa la lta ba pos thag pa'am /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid med de / lta ba po'i yang dag pa dang / log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i dus na shes bya'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na thag pa la lta ba pos thag pa'am /
translated: Compounded phenomena do not have transformation into another.üîΩWhen the correct and incorrect consciousnesses of the viewer arise, the nature of the object of knowledge is not completely abandoned, for example, when the viewer sees a rope or a snake, the nature of the rope is not completely abandoned.

original: sprul du mthong ba na thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa bzhin pas bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: sprul du mthong ba na thag pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa bzhin pas bdag dang bdag gir snang ba'i 'du byed rnams la gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Therefore, compounded phenomena that appear as ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine‚Äù do not transform into another.

original: 'on kyang rab rib can rnams la dbang po nyams pas 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin du yang dag @150b pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi blo skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba nye bar gdags par ni yod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang rab rib can rnams la dbang po nyams pas 'khrul pa'i blo skye ba bzhin du yang dag @150b pa ma yin pa'i bdag dang bdag gi blo skye ba'i phyir 'khrul pa zhes bya ba nye bar gdags par ni yod de /
translated: However, just as a consciousness that is mistaken with respect to the object, such as the appearance of floaters, arises for those with impaired vision, the consciousness of a self and being mine arises for those with the impairment of ignorance. Therefore, it is designated as a mistake.

original: 'dus byas ni brdzun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'dus byas ni brdzun pa nyid yin te /
translated: Compounded phenomena are false

original: shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa brdzun pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they are objects of false consciousness.

original: dper na mngon sum gyi shes pa'i yul gyi don la mngon sum zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum gyi shes pa'i yul gyi don la mngon sum zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, an object that is the object of direct perception is called direct perception.

original: gang dag gis brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de /üîΩde nyid las ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: gang dag gis brdzun pa zhes bya ba ni dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa nyid yin no zhes smras pa de dag gi phyir 'di bshad de / de nyid las ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: For those who say that what is called false is the emptiness that is the nature of the nonenduring state of things, this is explained.üîΩIt does not transform into something else.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
translated: It does not exist in something else.

original: dngos po gang rang bzhin gang gis gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba med la gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gang rang bzhin gang gis gzung ba'i yul du 'gyur ba de nyid la ni rga shi'i mtshan nyid du gzhan du 'gyur ba med la gzhan nyid la yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: That very thing which is the object to be grasped by a certain intrinsic nature does not change into another, which is the characteristic of aging and death. Nor does it exist in another.

original: de dag ni dam bca' ba gnyis nye bar gzhag pa yin no //üîΩgang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
analyzed: de dag ni dam bca' ba gnyis nye bar gzhag pa yin no // gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
translated: These are the two theses.üîΩBecause a youth does not age,

original: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o //
analyzed: gang phyir rgas pa'ang mi rga'o //
translated: and because an old man does not age,

original: zhes bya ba dag ni go rims bzhin du chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis yin no //üîΩ'dir sbyor ba'i tshig dag ni re zhig bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa nyid de sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dag ni go rims bzhin du chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig gnyis yin no // 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig dag ni re zhig bdag nyid de nyid kyis gnas pa la ni gzhan du 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa nyid de sngon gyi rang bzhin yongs su ma spangs pa'i phyir dper na gzhon nu rgan po nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: These are the two statements of the example of similarity, respectively.üîΩHere, the statements of the syllogism are as follows: It is not tenable that that very self abides in that very intrinsic nature and changes into another, because the prior intrinsic nature is not relinquished, just as a youth does not become an old man.

original: sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba rgan po'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de ;
analyzed: sngon gyi mtshan nyid las mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba rgan po'i bdag nyid du gnas pa la yang gzhan du 'gyur ba med de ;
translated: Nor does that which abides in the intrinsic nature of an old man, whose intrinsic nature is different from the prior intrinsic nature, change into another.

original: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir dper na rgas pa bzhin pas rgol ba rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba'i gnas skabs thob pa'i phyir dper na rgas pa bzhin pas rgol ba rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
translated: Because it has attained a different state, like an old person. Therefore, your own inference is undermined.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'o ma la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'o ma la sogs pa ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pa dag kyang zho la sogs pa'i dngos por 'gyur ba'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid do //
translated: Because milk and so on, without abandoning its own nature, becomes the entity of yogurt and so on, the reason is not established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgang gi dngos po zho yin /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang gi dngos po zho yin /
translated: Here we say:üîΩWhat is the entity of yogurt?

original: gal te 'o ma'i zho zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma'i zho zhe na /
translated: If it is milk,

original: de lta na yang 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pas sgra tsam gyis kyang zho'i dngos por brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'o mas 'o ma'i ngo bo nyid yongs su ma spangs pas sgra tsam gyis kyang zho'i dngos por brtag par mi nus te /
translated: then also milk, without abandoning its own nature, is not able to be conceived as the entity of yogurt by mere words.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa la yang /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam par rtog pa la yang /
translated: Because in that case, even in conception,

original: gal te de nyid gzhan gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan gyur na //
translated: if that itself transforms,

original: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
translated: then milk itself would become yogurt.

original: 'o ma ro dang mthun dang smin pa dang / mthu stobs yongs su spangs pa zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma ro dang mthun dang smin pa dang / mthu stobs yongs su spangs pa zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Milk, without abandoning its concordant taste, ripening, and potency, would not become the entity of yogurt.

original: brags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brags pa'i gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be damaged by the damage of the other.

original: gal te de bzhin te 'o ma zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin te 'o ma zho'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is so, that milk does not become the entity of curd,

original: 'o ma las gzhan gang gis ni //
analyzed: 'o ma las gzhan gang gis ni //
translated: then by what other than milk

original: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur //
translated: would the entity of curd come to be?

original: @151a * // mi 'gyur ba nyid de zho 'am de las gzhan pa dag der mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: @151a * // mi 'gyur ba nyid de zho 'am de las gzhan pa dag der mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: It would not come to be, because curd or something other than that would not come to be.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'o ma dang de las gzhan pa dag dngos po gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'o ma dang de las gzhan pa dag dngos po gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it is not tenable that milk or something other than that is another entity, the reason is not indeterminate.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: 'o ma zho'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan du 'gyur bas 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
analyzed: 'o ma zho'i mtshan nyid kyi chos gzhan du 'gyur bas 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin no zhes ni mi smra'i /
translated: We do not say that milk becomes the entity of curd because the attribute characterized by the mark of curd transforms into something else.

original: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshogs pa'i dbang gis 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur ro //
translated: However, milk becomes the entity of curd through the power of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: 'dir yang 'o mas 'o ma'i dngos po spangs nas zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram ma spangs par 'gyur grang /
analyzed: 'dir yang 'o mas 'o ma'i dngos po spangs nas zho'i dngos por 'gyur ram ma spangs par 'gyur grang /
translated: Here, does milk become the entity of curd by abandoning its own entity or by not abandoning it?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the consequence of that?

original: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni zho'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na ni zho'i dngos por 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If you assert the former, then it is not the entity of yogurt.

original: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
analyzed: ci ste brtag pa phyi ma ltar 'dod na ni dgag pa mi mthun pa'i skyon du 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert the latter, then the fault of the contradiction of the negation would ensue.

original: gal te 'o ma yin na ni ji ltar zho yin ci ste zho yin na ni ji ltar 'o ma yin /
analyzed: gal te 'o ma yin na ni ji ltar zho yin ci ste zho yin na ni ji ltar 'o ma yin /
translated: If it is milk, then how could it be yogurt? If it is yogurt, then how could it be milk?

original: 'o ma zho yin no zhes smra na ni grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro //üîΩ'dis gang dag 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'o ma zho yin no zhes smra na ni grags pa'i gnod par yang 'gyur ro // 'dis gang dag 'o ma'i dngos po zho yin par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: If you say that milk is yogurt, then it would contradict what is well known.üîΩThis also responds to those who say that they do not assert that the entity of milk is yogurt,

original: 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur bar 'dod do zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o ma zho'i dngos por 'gyur bar 'dod do zhes zer ba de dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
translated: but they assert that milk becomes the entity of yogurt.

original: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma grub pas pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar dpyad na don dam par dngos po rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ma grub pas pha rol pos dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir gtan tshigs smras pa'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, when analyzed in this way, since the transformation of things into something else is not established in the ultimate, the meaning of the reason that the opponent states in order to demonstrate that things exist essentially is not established,

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: or it has a meaning that is contradictory.

original: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ston pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa yang dngos po rnams nges par mi gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid ston pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The statement that things are deceptive phenomena does not show that the nature of things is not definitely existent.

original: don dam par 'ga' yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par 'ga' yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is impossible for anything to change into something else ultimately.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams stong pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Things are not empty ultimately,

original: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir dper na log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang dag par shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir dper na log pa'i shes pa'i gnyen po yang dag par shes pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: because their antidote exists, just as, for example, correct consciousness, the antidote to incorrect consciousness, exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni gnyen po med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist has no antidote,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: just like a sky flower.

original: stong pa nyid ma yin pa la ni gnyen po stong pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ma yin pa la ni gnyen po stong pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus stong pa nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: Since the antidote, emptiness, exists for that which is not empty, therefore, by the power of the stated reason, that which is not empty exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf something nonempty existed,

original: stong pa 'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa 'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: then something empty would exist.

original: 'di la gal te don dam par phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis @151b mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni de la ltos pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la gal te don dam par phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched la sogs pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gyis @151b mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni de la ltos pa'am /
translated: Here, if the aggregates, elements, media, etc. were not empty of inherent existence ultimately, then, in dependence on that,

original: mi stong pa de bstsal bas stong pa zhes brjod pas 'byung ba'i phyir stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi stong pa de yang mi 'thad par bstan cing ston par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar don dam par /
analyzed: mi stong pa de bstsal bas stong pa zhes brjod pas 'byung ba'i phyir stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na mi stong pa de yang mi 'thad par bstan cing ston par 'gyur bas de'i phyir de ltar don dam par /
translated: since emptiness is said to be the elimination of non-emptiness, emptiness would exist a little bit. But since it has been shown and will be shown that non-emptiness is not tenable, therefore, ultimately,

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Not the slightest non-empty thing exists.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩstong pa nyid du 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur // stong pa nyid du 'thad pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: How could emptiness exist?üîΩThe intended meaning is that since emptiness is not tenable, emptiness does not exist.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi stong pa dang / stong pa cu zad kyang med do zhes gnyi ga bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mi stong pa dang / stong pa cu zad kyang med do zhes gnyi ga bsdu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that both non-emptiness and emptiness do not exist.

original: yang na stong pa dang / mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gzhi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na stong pa dang / mi stong pa zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa de dag ni gzhi la brten pas tha snyad pa yin te /
translated: Or else, the conceptualization of emptiness and non-emptiness is conventional, because it is based on a substratum.

original: dper na gtsug lag khang sku gzugs kyis mi stong la /
analyzed: dper na gtsug lag khang sku gzugs kyis mi stong la /
translated: For example, a temple is not empty of images,

original: dge slong dag gis stong pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag gis stong pa yod pa nyid do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: but is empty of monks.

original: don dam par ni /
analyzed: don dam par ni /
translated: But in the ultimate sense,

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //üîΩgnyen por brtags pa gang yin pa'i //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na // gnyen por brtags pa gang yin pa'i //
translated: there is nothing whatsoever that is not empty.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: How can emptiness exist,üîΩwhich is imagined as the antidote?

original: gang gi phyir 'dzin pa tsam spangs pa nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dzin pa tsam spangs pa nyid stong pa nyid do zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that emptiness is just the abandonment of the mere grasping.

original: de'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause the antidote exists,‚Äù is unestablished.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa lhur len pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa goms par byed pa la la 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pa dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid dgag pa lhur len pa'i thos pa dang bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa las byung ba'i shes pa goms par byed pa la la 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Or else, some yogis and yoginis who are intent on refuting the essence of all things and who are cultivating the knowledge that arises from hearing, contemplating, and meditating may think,üîΩ‚ÄúIf things are empty of the nature of the imputed, then although the nature of the imputed does not exist in those things, their emptiness is not fabricated and is independent.‚Äù

original: gal te kun brtags pa nyid kyi bdag nyid stong pa'i phyir dngos po de dag la kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid med du zin kyang de dag gi stong pa nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na yin no snyam na de yang legs par zin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te kun brtags pa nyid kyi bdag nyid stong pa'i phyir dngos po de dag la kun brtags pa'i bdag nyid med du zin kyang de dag gi stong pa nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir dang / ltos pa med pa'i phyir de kho na yin no snyam na de yang legs par zin pa ma yin te /
translated: That is also not well grasped.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni stong pa nyid yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ni stong pa nyid yin pa /
translated: Because the essencelessness of all things is emptiness.üîΩSince that is not substantially existent, it is not tenable to cling to it as an essence.

original: de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi rigs pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni rdzas su yod pa ma yin pas de la ngo bo nyid du mngon par zhen pa mi rigs pas de dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to refute that, it says:

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If there were something that is not empty,

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: Emptiness would also slightly exist.

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is stated.

original: stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa rtog pa can nam rtog pa can ma yin pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po cung zad cig yod par gyur na de la ltos pas sam /üîΩblo'i bye brag gis stong pa nyid kyis shes pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'am cung zad cig yod par @152a * //
analyzed: stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa rtog pa can nam rtog pa can ma yin pa'i spyod yul gyi dngos po cung zad cig yod par gyur na de la ltos pas sam / blo'i bye brag gis stong pa nyid kyis shes pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'am cung zad cig yod par @152a * //
translated: If a nonempty consciousness, the object of conceptual or nonconceptual consciousness, slightly existed, then due to relying on that,

original: 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'gyur grang na /
translated: or due to the distinction of awareness, emptiness would be the object of consciousness, and the reality of things would slightly exist.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: But if nothing is nonempty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could emptiness exist?

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What exists?

original: gang yod pa de ni stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dpe 'di las rjes su dpag par bya ste /üîΩstong pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
analyzed: gang yod pa de ni stong pa nyid yin pas de'i phyir dpe 'di las rjes su dpag par bya ste / stong pa nyid kyi shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'am /
translated: That which exists is emptiness. Therefore, this example should be inferred.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul dngos po'i bdag nyid gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa ma yin te /
translated: The object of a conceptual or nonconceptual consciousness of emptiness is not real.

original: shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dper na stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul bzhin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa'i spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dper na stong pa ma yin pa'i shes pa'i spyod yul bzhin pas dngos po'i de kho na stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could the reality of things, emptiness, exist, since it is the domain of cognition, like, for example, the domain of a cognition that is not empty?

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang / ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / ma byas pa dang / ltos pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
translated: The example is not established because it is undermined by inference, and because it does not have an essence that is not made and does not depend on anything else.

original: dpe ma grub bo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dpe ma grub bo zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is the thought.

original: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Again, if nothing is empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩji ltar stong pa nyid ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes bsregs pa'i phyir mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur // ji ltar stong pa nyid ma yin par rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba stong pa nyid mthong ba'i mes bsregs pa'i phyir mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: how could emptiness exist?üîΩJust as nothing at all is not empty because the net of conceptual thoughts that it is not empty is burned by the fire of seeing emptiness,

original: stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang de nyid kyis bsregs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te //
analyzed: stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba yang de nyid kyis bsregs pa'i phyir stong pa nyid du rnam par rtog pa yang ji lta ba bzhin ma yin te //
translated: in the same way, the net of conceptual thoughts that it is empty is burned by that fire of seeing emptiness, and therefore the conceptual thought that it is empty is not accurate.

original: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos por rnam par rtog pa bzhin bas stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir dngos por rnam par rtog pa bzhin bas stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could emptiness exist, since it is a conceptual thought, like the conceptual thought of an entity?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul to zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis de ltar 'khrul to zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is that it is a mistake to think that way because of conceptual thought.

original: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
analyzed: yang na / mi stong cung zad yod min na //
translated: Or, if nothing is empty,

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur //üîΩgnyis su spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las sgyu mar byas pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur // gnyis su spyod pa la ni dngos po'i ngo bo nyid kyi yul can gyi blo'i bye brag las sgyu mar byas pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis stong ngo //
translated: how could emptiness exist?üîΩFor one who engages in duality, the conceptual thought occurs that ‚ÄúThis illusion, which is created by the power of the mind, is empty of the nature of a horse, etc.,

original: yang dag pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa 'di ni rta la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyis mi stong ngo zhes bya bar rnam par rtog pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but this reality is not empty of the nature of a horse, etc.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba de rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa de'i tshe na de la don dam par shes bya'i de kho na thams cad 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rnal 'byor ba de rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes rab kyi spyod pa la gnas shing gnyis su med pa la spyod pa de'i tshe na de la don dam par shes bya'i de kho na thams cad 'di lta ste /
translated: When the yogi abides in the practice of nonconceptual wisdom and engages in nonduality, at that time, the ultimate reality of all objects of knowledge appears to him, like space, as having a single characteristic, as being without characteristics, and as being nonapparent.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med par snang ba med pa'i tshul gyis snang bar 'gyur bas mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med par snang ba med pa'i tshul gyis snang bar 'gyur bas mi stong pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin /
translated: Thus, nothing whatsoever is nonempty.

original: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: stong pa'ang yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: How could emptiness exist?üîΩBecause there is no difference in the mind, the conception of mutual dependence is not tenable.

original: blo'i bye brag med pas phan tshun ltos par rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs @152b so ;
analyzed: blo'i bye brag med pas phan tshun ltos par rtogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs @152b so ;
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: / de'i phyir rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: / de'i phyir rnam par bshad pa'i brnag pa snga ma tha dad pa dag gis gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the previous assertion of the explanation is not established by the reason.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / don 'gal ba nyid du gyur kyang sla ste /
translated: Even if the meaning of the reason is not established, or if the meaning is contradictory, it is still easy.

original: yang kho bo cag gi snying ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pas khyab pa yin la /
analyzed: yang kho bo cag gi snying ni stong pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir sgrub pa smra bar 'dod pas khyab pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, we assert that the heart of our argument is the desire to state a proof for the refutation of emptiness.

original: de yang khyed nyid kyis bkag pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
analyzed: de yang khyed nyid kyis bkag pas 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
translated: But since you have refuted that, the point you assert is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: stong pa nyid shes pas dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: stong pa nyid shes pas dngos po rnams stong pa nyid du byed pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The understanding of emptiness does not make things empty.

original: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po rnams kyi de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid /
translated: It is that things are not of the nature of emptiness.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa nyid du gsal bar byed de /
translated: It is that which makes it clear that they are not of the nature of emptiness.

original: dper na mar me'i snang bas khang khyim na bum pa med pa nyid du gsal bar byed kyi /
analyzed: dper na mar me'i snang bas khang khyim na bum pa med pa nyid du gsal bar byed kyi /
translated: For example, the light of a lamp makes it clear that there is no pot in the house, but it does not make it nonexistent.

original: med par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin pas de med na de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: med par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin pas de med na de yod par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir de ni ma brtags par smra ba yin no //
