translated: Since it is not nonexistent, it is not nonexistent. Therefore this is a statement made without analysis.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du smra ba dag ni /
translated: Those who advocate emptinessüîΩare those who, wishing to refute the words of others, rely on the advocacy of emptiness, but who, not understanding the texts, prove that emptiness does not exist.

original: pha rol po'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la brten cing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir de dag gis khas blangs pa
analyzed: pha rol po'i tshig sun dbyung bar 'dod pas stong pa nyid du smra ba la brten cing de yang gzhung mi gzugs par sems pa na stong pa nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no zhes log par sgrub par byed pas de'i phyir de dag gis khas blangs pa
translated: Therefore, their position

original: la gnod par 'gyur te /üîΩlung las / gang dag stong nyid rab shes pa //
analyzed: la gnod par 'gyur te / lung las / gang dag stong nyid rab shes pa //
translated: is undermined.üîΩA scripture says:üîΩThose who understand emptiness well

original: de dag chos nyid rnam par mthong //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'du ba dag ni ma rtogs pa'i //
analyzed: de dag chos nyid rnam par mthong // zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / 'du ba dag ni ma rtogs pa'i //
translated: see reality.üîΩAnd:

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin te //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin te //
translated: Things do not exist without being dependently arisen.

original: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // dngos nyid med par ngas smras so //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyir stong dang ma skyes dang // dngos nyid med par ngas smras so // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore I have said that they are empty, unarisen, and essenceless.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te lung las /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te lung las /
translated: This is not correct, because a scripture says:

original: chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs gzings lta bur shes pa rnams kyis chos rnams kyang spang bar bya na /
translated: Those who understand that the categories of phenomena are like a raft should abandon even the Dharma,üîΩhow much more so non-Dharma.

original: chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa rnams lta ci smos zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du gzugs stong zhes bya bar mi brtag mi stong zhes bya bar yang mi brtag go zhes gsungs pas /
translated: And similarly, form should not be imagined as empty or not empty.

original: stong pa nyid du lta ba 'dzin pa gzhan bstsal ba la dgos pas yongs su bzung ba yang don dpyad zin na /
analyzed: stong pa nyid du lta ba 'dzin pa gzhan bstsal ba la dgos pas yongs su bzung ba yang don dpyad zin na /
translated: Since the purpose of the above is to eliminate the view of emptiness as something to be grasped, if the object of negation is already analyzed,

original: yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / stong pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir de yongs su spang ba la skyon med do //
analyzed: yongs su spang bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / stong pa ma yin par rnam par rtog pa bzhin du rnam par rtog pa de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i shes pa'i gegs yin pas spang bar 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de la mngon par zhen pa yang skyon chen por 'gyur ba'i phyir de yongs su spang ba la skyon med do //
translated: then there is no fault in eliminating the view of emptiness, since it is to be abandoned, and since that view is an impediment to nonconceptual consciousness, just like the conception of emptiness as not empty.

original: 'di ltar lha dang mi'i bla ma @153a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar lha dang mi'i bla ma @153a * //
translated: Since the Buddha, the teacher of gods and humans,

original: rnams kyis srog chags lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyi dug gis sems khyab par gyur pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i nad rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams la thugs rje ba na /
analyzed: rnams kyis srog chags lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyi dug gis sems khyab par gyur pa sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i nad rgyun mi 'chad pa rnams la thugs rje ba na /
translated: The minds of living beings are pervaded by the poison of the faults of various views, and they are constantly afflicted by the disease of unbearable suffering.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi stong nyid ni //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi stong nyid ni //
translated: The emptiness of the victors

original: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
analyzed: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
translated: is taught to be the deliverance from all views.

original: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon gyi lta ba thams cad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal sna tshogs kyi sa bon gyi lta ba thams cad do //
translated: All views are the seeds of various sufferings.

original: lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: lta ba ni mngon par zhen pa dang 'dzin pa ste /
translated: A view is an adherence and grasping.

original: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rab tu dbye ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its divisions are the view of the perishable collection and so forth.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ni nang stong pa nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: Its antidote is inner emptiness and so forth.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po nye bar ma bsags pa /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba rgya chen po nye bar ma bsags pa /
translated: Those who have not accumulated vast roots of virtue,

original: bsam pa yongs su ma smin pa /
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su ma smin pa /
translated: whose intentions are not fully ripened,

original: chos zab mo la bzod pa ma skyes pa /
analyzed: chos zab mo la bzod pa ma skyes pa /
translated: who have not generated patience with the profound Dharma,

original: lam la mi mkhas pa /
analyzed: lam la mi mkhas pa /
translated: who are unskilled in the path,

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: and those who view emptiness

original: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: are said to be incapable of practice.

original: 'di nyid yod do zhes stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang dag bkru sman btang ba khong du 'khyil ba'i nad pa bzhin du lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyis sems ma rungs par gyur pa rnams la de zhi bar nus pa stong pa nyid kyi sman byin
analyzed: 'di nyid yod do zhes stong pa nyid du 'dzin pa gang dag bkru sman btang ba khong du 'khyil ba'i nad pa bzhin du lta ba sna tshogs kyi skyon gyis sems ma rungs par gyur pa rnams la de zhi bar nus pa stong pa nyid kyi sman byin
translated: The medicine of emptiness, which is able to pacify those faults, is given to them.

original: pa las skyon chen pos 'khrugs par gyur pa nad pa lta bu de dag ni /
analyzed: pa las skyon chen pos 'khrugs par gyur pa nad pa lta bu de dag ni /
translated: But those patients, whose minds are disturbed by great faults,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sman pa mchog lta bus bsgrub tu med par gsungs pas de'i phyir de spangs pa la yang skyon med do //üîΩ'gron po phal pa shing rta bying ba 'byin pa'i rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byin cig ces zer ba sgra'i don mngon par mi shes pa lta bur mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sman pa mchog lta bus bsgrub tu med par gsungs pas de'i phyir de spangs pa la yang skyon med do // 'gron po phal pa shing rta bying ba 'byin pa'i rngan pa ci yang med do zhes bya ba gang yin pa de byin cig ces zer ba sgra'i don mngon par mi shes pa lta bur mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par gyur na mi rung bas kho bo stong
translated: are said to be incurable by the Tathagata, the supreme physician. Therefore, there is no fault in abandoning them.üîΩIt would be as if someone said, Give me the wages of the ordinary traveler who pulls the chariot out of the mud, and when told that there is no such wage, he says, Give me the wages of the one who does not pull it out.

original: pa nyid la dngos po mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
analyzed: pa nyid la dngos po mngon par zhen par mi byed do //
translated: Since it would be improper to be criticized by the wise for not understanding the meaning of the words, we do not cling to emptiness as a thing.

original: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi lan med do //
translated: Therefore, the response that the meaning of the reason is not established is also not tenable.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dag rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos smras pa'i sun 'byin pa'i lan btab pa dag rang dbang du rjes su dpag pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pa'i mthus 'du byed rnams /
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows: The responses to the objections raised by others are taught to be independent inferences that are faultless.

original: rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa las ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Through the power of that, conditioned phenomena are shown to be essenceless in terms of their own natures.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni phyin ci log gi kun nas bslang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa log par brdzun pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa chos thams cad ni phyin ci log gi kun nas bslang ba yang dag pa ma yin pa yod pa ma yin pa log par brdzun pa ste /
translated: Therefore, Subh≈´ti, all phenomena are motivated by error, are not real, do not exist, are false, and are lies.üîΩSubh≈´ti, therefore, those who engage in any phenomena engage in error and engage in what is not real.

original: rab kyi stsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i phyir gang chos 'ga' zhig la spyod pa de ni phyin ci log la spyod pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten ni bden pa la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rab kyi stsal gyis rnam par gnon pa de'i phyir gang chos 'ga' zhig la spyod pa de ni phyin ci log la spyod pa dang / yang dag pa ma yin pa la spyod pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du 'jig rten ni bden pa la mngon par zhen pa yin gyi /
translated: And similarly, the world is attached to the truth.

original: chos 'di ni bden pa yang @153b ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: chos 'di ni bden pa yang @153b ma yin brdzun pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka states:

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: In the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: de kho na brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is called ‚ÄúThe Examination of Reality.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o /
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bstsal bas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par bstsal bas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in the same way, by removing the specific counterarguments against emptiness, the fourteenth chapter is composed by the power of the meaning to be explained, namely, the teaching of intrinsic realitylessness in terms of contact.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say this:

original: khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi tshul dang 'gal te /
analyzed: khyed phung po la sogs pa dag ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du smra ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung gi tshul dang 'gal te /
translated: You proponents of intrinsic realitylessness of the aggregates and so on contradict the way the Bhagavat taught.

original: gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang / rnam par shes pa dang mig gsum phrad pa ni reg pa'o zhes 'byung bas de'i phyir khyed kyis khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is said, ‚ÄúThe contact of the eye, form, and consciousness is contact,‚Äù therefore your assertion is undermined.

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod par shes par bya ste /
translated: You should understand that ultimately things exist inherently,

original: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la brten nas phrad pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because contact is taught in dependence on them.

original: de dag la brten nas 'di na gang med pa de la ni ston pas de la brten nas phrad pa nyid ma bstan te /
analyzed: de dag la brten nas 'di na gang med pa de la ni ston pas de la brten nas phrad pa nyid ma bstan te /
translated: The Teacher did not teach that contact exists in dependence on that which does not exist here.

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the hairs of a tortoise.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dag gis kun du sbyar ro zhes bya ba de yod pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi gsung rab la 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / ma rig pa'i kun du sbyor ba dag gis kun du sbyar ro zhes bya ba de yod pas /
translated: The Blessed One said, ‚ÄúThey are bound by the fetters of attachment, anger, and ignorance.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, by the power of the reason stated above, things exist inherently.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //
translated: The seen, seeing, and the seer,

original: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //üîΩphrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin /
analyzed: gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du // phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin /
translated: between these three, either in pairs or all together.üîΩThere is no mutual contact between the object seen, the seeing, and the seer, either in pairs or all together.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po de dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par 'gyur dang nyon mongs pa //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.üîΩSimilarly, desire, the desirous one,

original: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams dang skye mched kyi //
translated: the object of desire, and the remaining afflictions,

original: ltag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis blta //üîΩde bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags bstan pa las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: ltag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis blta // de bzhin du 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba dang / 'dod chags bstan pa las gzhan pa nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa de dag kyang /
translated: should be viewed in the same way as the three:üîΩthe object seen, the seeing, and the seer.üîΩSimilarly, desire, the desirous one, the object of desire, and the remaining afflictions other than the teaching on desire, such as hatred,

original: zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bzhag nas /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bzhag nas /
translated: should be viewed in the same way as the three: hatred, the hateful one, the object of hatred, and so on, having been posited.

original: gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag par brjod par bya'o //üîΩde la 'dod chags ni lhag @154a * //
analyzed: gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag par brjod par bya'o // de la 'dod chags ni lhag @154a * //
translated: The refutation of mutual contact in terms of two by two and all three should be stated in the same way.

original: par chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: par chags pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Here, ‚Äúattachment‚Äù is the characteristic of excessive attachment.

original: nyon mongs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'o //üîΩskye mched bstan pa la ltos nas ma bstan pa lhag ma nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba de dag la yang mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po dang /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ni sems can rnams kyi rgyud nyon mongs par byed pa'o // skye mched bstan pa la ltos nas ma bstan pa lhag ma nyan pa dang / snom pa dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ces bya ba de dag la yang mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po dang /
translated: ‚ÄúAffliction‚Äù is that which afflicts the mental continuum of sentient beings.üîΩThe remaining faculties that are not taught in the presentation of the faculties, namely, hearing, smelling, taste, touch, and mind, should be understood in the same way.

original: de bzhin du bsnam par bya ba dang / snom pa dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsnam par bya ba dang / snom pa dang / snom pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyi rnam pa gsum gyis phan tshun du phrad par 'gyur ba med par dgag pa yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The refutation of mutual contact in terms of two by two and all three should be stated in the same way for the object of hearing, hearing, and the hearer, and so on, up to the object of touch, touch, and the feeler.

original: de la skye mched kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don to //
analyzed: de la skye mched kyi don ni sems dang sems las byung ba rnams skye ba'i sgo'i don to //
translated: The meaning of sense-sphere is the meaning of door of arising for the mind and mental factors.

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad pa med pa de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gnyis gnyis dang / thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad pa med pa de ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The two, such as the seen and the seer, and such as attachment and the one who is attached, and all of them do not mutually contact each other. This is the thesis.

original: da ni phrad pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir 'thad pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni phrad pa med pa bstan pa'i phyir 'thad pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the lack of contact, the logical proof will be explained.

original: gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad gyur na ;
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad gyur na ;
translated: If the other were to contact the other,

original: / gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
analyzed: / gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
translated: then the seen and so on

original: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: would be other than themselves.

original: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, they would not contact each other.

original: phrad pa ni sbyor ba'i rnam grangs te de yang gzhan yod na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: phrad pa ni sbyor ba'i rnam grangs te de yang gzhan yod na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Contact is a synonym for connection. If the other were to contact the other, then the seen and so on would be other than themselves.

original: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po dang / 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po dang / 'dod chags dang / chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur ba la sogs pa dag la gzhan de yang yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro zhes mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the concluding statement.

original: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas phyogs kyi chos ston te /
analyzed: 'dis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pas phyogs kyi chos ston te /
translated: This teaches the property of the position through the reversal of the discordant side.

original: dper na rtag pa dang / ma byas pa nyid du 'brel pa de yang sgra la med la byas pa nyid ni yod pa lta bu'o /üîΩ'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba 'am /
analyzed: dper na rtag pa dang / ma byas pa nyid du 'brel pa de yang sgra la med la byas pa nyid ni yod pa lta bu'o / 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba 'am /
translated: For example, it is like the relationship between permanence and being unproduced, which do not exist for sound, but being produced does.

original: lta ba dang mi phrad de /
analyzed: lta ba dang mi phrad de /
translated: Here the statement of the syllogism is: Ultimately, the seer does not make contact with the object seen or with seeing,

original: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not other than those.

original: gang zhig gang las gzhan ma yin pa de ni de dang de mi phrad de /
analyzed: gang zhig gang las gzhan ma yin pa de ni de dang de mi phrad de /
translated: That which is not other than something does not make contact with it,

original: dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: like one‚Äôs own nature.

original: gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan dang phrad 'gyur na //
translated: If one thing were to make contact with another,

original: zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: Here,

original: gzhan dag na re /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re /
translated: others say:

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa la phrad pa med de /
translated: There is no contact with attachment and so on,

original: yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are subsequent states that are different objects and different continua.

original: phrad pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phrad pa ni yul tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa dag bar du mchod par 'jug pa nyid yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Contact is the engagement of nondifferent objects and nondifferent causes that are obstructed.

original: de la 'dir kha cig na re blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod @154b chags la sogs pa dag kyang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dir kha cig na re blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag yul tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dod @154b chags la sogs pa dag kyang yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir yul dang rgyud tha dad pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, some say: The reason ‚Äúbecause they are subsequent states that are different objects and different continua‚Äù is not established because the object of seeing and so on is not a different object and attachment and so on do not abide in the object.

original: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin pa 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir de ni legs pa ma yin pa 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: That is not good because it is similar to the nonestablishment of the reason and the nonexistence of the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba'i tshul gyis /
translated: The way in which this is explained later is:

original: blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
translated: Only the object of seeing and so on

original: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //üîΩgang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi // gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //
translated: but alsoüîΩit is not tenable that anything

original: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: is different from anything else.

original: mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po la sogs dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba dang / nyan pa dang / nyan pa po la sogs dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang can dang / zhe sdang bar bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúthe seen, seeing, and the seer‚Äù and so on, and the meaning of ‚Äúanger, the angry, and that which is to be hated‚Äù and so on are the same.

original: de'i phyir de dag la phrad pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la phrad pa med do //
translated: Therefore they do not make contact.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba dang / lta ba po la sogs pa dag gzhan ma yin pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: Since it is not established that the seen, seeing, and the seer and so on are not different, is it not the case that the meaning of the reason is not established?

original: bshad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bshad pa ma yin te /
translated: Response: That is not so.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is it not so?

original: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan //
translated: The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: Without the other, the other would not be other.

original: gzhan ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan //üîΩzhes bya na /
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la ltos nas gzhan //üîΩzhes bya na /
translated: The other is other in dependence on the other.

original: gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan la brten te gzhan zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan med pas de'i phyir gzhan la brten te gzhan zhes bya ba yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say that something is different in dependence on another.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What is it then?

original: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan las brten te gzhan zhes tha snyad gdags pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a mere convention to say that something is different in dependence on another.

original: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //üîΩgang la brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to // gang la brten te gang yin pa //
translated: This shows that the predicate of the probandum is the dependence of the dependent itself, which is qualified.

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: That which is dependent on another is not tenable as different from it.

original: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni dam bca' ba nye bar gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the conclusion.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par blta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par blta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te /
translated: Here the inference is: Seeing does not exist as different from the seen in the ultimate,

original: brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir bsgrub pas sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir bsgrub pas sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la /
translated: Because the special object of expression is dependent and related, it is like the object of seeing itself. Therefore, the reason that proves it is not unestablished.

original: brjod par bya ba khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the reason that the special object of expression is dependent and related is also not unestablished.

original: ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established that it is independent.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
translated: If the other were other than the other,

original: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur //üîΩgal te gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na de lta @155a * //
analyzed: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur // gal te gzhan zhes bya ba ngo bo nyid kyis gzhan las gzhan yin par gyur na de lta @155a * //
translated: it would be tenable without the other.

original: na gzhan med par yang gzhan du rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: na gzhan med par yang gzhan du rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If what is called ‚Äúother‚Äù were essentially other than the other, then it would be tenable that it is other without the other.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i me'i dngos po gzhan la mi ltos par yang tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na tha snyad kyi bden par grags pa'i me'i dngos po gzhan la mi ltos par yang tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: Because it would have the nature of that, just as, for example, the thing fire, renowned as conventional truth, would have the nature of heat without depending on another.

original: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de //
analyzed: gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de //
translated: If the other is not other

original: med na med pas de phyir med //
analyzed: med na med pas de phyir med //
translated: than that, then it would not exist.

original: gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ces bya ba de'o //
translated: This is called ‚Äúotherness.‚Äù

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: lta ba po dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la mi ltos phar gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
analyzed: lta ba po dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag blta bar bya ba dang / mnyan par bya ba la sogs pa la mi ltos phar gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med la /
translated: The seer, the hearer, and so on would be other without depending on the seen, the heard, and so on,

original: chags pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med de /
analyzed: chags pa la sogs pa dag kyang 'dod chags la sogs pa la mi ltos par gzhan nyid du 'gyur ba med de /
translated: and attachment and so on would be other without depending on the desirous one and so on.

original: dper na tha snyad du yang me grang ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba nyid med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tha snyad du yang me grang ba la mi ltos par rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis tsha ba nyid med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even conventionally, fire does not exist as hot by its intrinsic reality without depending on the cold.

original: ci ste lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
analyzed: ci ste lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa la ltos pa med par yang gzhan nyid yin te /
translated: But if the seer were other than the seen and so on without depending on the seen and so on,

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta bzhin no //
translated: because they have different characteristics, like a cow and a horse.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad 'di lta bu yang yod de /
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad 'di lta bu yang yod de /
translated: There is such a difference in characteristics.

original: lta ba po ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam de dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs bzhin no //
analyzed: lta ba po ni yul du snang ba'i rnam par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dam de dang ldan pa'i 'du byed kyi tshogs bzhin no //
translated: The seer is characterized by the consciousness that appears as the object, or by the collection of formations that possess that.

original: lta ba ni yul kha dog gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: lta ba ni yul kha dog gzugs dang ba mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: Seeing is the object, the clear form that is the color of the eye consciousness.

original: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no //üîΩde'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas rtog ge phyi ma dang rang dbang du /
analyzed: gzugs ni gzugs su rung ba'i mtshan nyid kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi bdag nyid yin no // de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus lta ba po ni lta ba la sogs pa dag las gzhan nyid yin pas rtog ge phyi ma dang rang dbang du /
translated: Form is characterized by being suitable as form, and has the nature of color and shape.üîΩTherefore, by the power of the reason stated, the seer is different from seeing and so on. It is refuted by the subsequent reasoning and by the independent inference.

original: rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: rjes su dpag pas gnod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang / rta dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ba lang dang / rta dag gzhan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a cow and a horse are not established as different.

original: 'dis ming tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ming tha dad pa'i phyir dang rgyu dang 'bras bu tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
translated: This also answers the arguments, ‚Äúbecause they have different names‚Äù and ‚Äúbecause they are different causes and effects.‚Äù

original: gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa /üîΩblta bar bya ba la gzhan nyid nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid grub pas brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
analyzed: gzegs zan pa dag gis smras pa / blta bar bya ba la gzhan nyid nges par gnas pa kho na yin pas de'i phyir gzhan nyid grub pas brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do
translated: The followers of Kanada say,üîΩ‚ÄúThe object seen is definitely different from the seer, and therefore difference is established. The meaning of the reason, ‚Äòbecause it is dependent and related to the seer,‚Äô is not established.‚Äù

original: // de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba brjod pa'i chos can gzhan nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: // de lta na yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba brjod pa'i chos can gzhan nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dang / phyogs kyi chos spyir brjod pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Even so, the meaning of the reason is not unestablished, because the property of the subject, called ‚Äòdifference,‚Äô is dependent on the other, and because the property of the subject is stated in general.

original: gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na gnyis pa med par @155b yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan nyid dang ldan pas gzhan nyid du 'dod na gnyis pa med par @155b yang rang las gzhan nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if difference is asserted to be different from itself, then it would be different from itself without a second.

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na me grang ba la sogs pa la ma ltos par yang rang gi bdag nyid kyis tsha ba nyid du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, like fire, without relying on cold, etc., it would be hot by itself.

original: gnyis med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gnyis med pa dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i chos can la gzhan nyid du rtog na yang rtog pa tsam du zad de /
translated: If you imagine that a non-dual thing that does not rely on another thing is different, then that is just imagination.

original: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la ltos pa nyid gzhan nyid kyi blo'i rgyu ma yin la /
translated: Because the reliance on another thing is not the cause of the cognition of difference,

original: gzhan nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni blo de'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: but difference is the cause of that cognition.

original: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang / dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang don med pa nyid dang / dgag pa mi mthun pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If you imagine that difference is endowed with difference and non-difference, then it would be pointless and contradictory.

original: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po brjod par bya ba ma yin pa dus phyis gzhan nyid dang ldan par rtog na yang dngos po ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: If you imagine that a thing is not expressible and later comes to possess difference, then a thing does not possess difference,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is a thing.

original: dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
analyzed: dper na brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de nyid kyi skad cig ma bzhin pas rang gi rjes su dpag pa la gnod do //
translated: For example, it is like the inexpressible itself in the moment it is not. Therefore, your inference is undermined.

original: bye brag pa gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: bye brag pa gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Other Vaiseikas say,

original: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin te zhes dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: ‚ÄúIn reality, seeing is not different from the seen.‚Äù What is the meaning of that thesis?

original: gal te gzhan nyid de la mi 'jug go zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid de la mi 'jug go zhe na ni gtan tshigs ma nges pa nyid de /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúWe do not apply difference to that,‚Äù then the reason is indeterminate,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang /
translated: because it applies to the discordant position,

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it applies to that which possesses dependence.

original: ci ste gzhan nyid rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin gzhan ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan nyid rdzas kyi ngo bo nyid ma yin gzhan ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúDifference is not a substantial entity. Difference is established by establishment of another.

original: gzhan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan nyid ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because difference is its entity.‚Äù

original: de la 'dir brtag pa snga ma la yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir brtag pa snga ma la yang ji skad bstan pa'i tshul gyis gzhan nyid bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: analysis, since otherness is refuted in the way that has been presented,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: since there is no opposite, it is not the case that it is indeterminate.

original: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa la yang don dam par lta ba ni blta bar bya ba las gzhan ma yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the second analysis, in the passage ‚ÄúIn reality, seeing is not differentüîΩfrom the seen,‚Äù since we have shown that the object of the cognition and

original: kho bo cag gis de la gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po la sgrub pa de lta bu med pas grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: kho bo cag gis de la gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra'i spyod yul nyid kyi chos med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir pha rol po la sgrub pa de lta bu med pas grub pa la sgrub pa yang ma yin no //
translated: the expression ‚Äúotherness‚Äù does not exist, we do not commit the fallacy ofüîΩunproven reasons.

original: don dam par gzhan nyid la gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: don dam par gzhan nyid la gzhan nyid kyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: In reality, otherness does not have the nature of otherness, because it is

original: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: spyi dang khyad par dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no //
translated: a universal and an instance, like, for example, form.üîΩAlternatively, in reality, otherness is not the cause of the arising of the

original: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid ni gzhan nyid kyi blo dang sgra skye ba'i rgyu nyid ma yin te /
translated: cognition and the expression ‚Äúotherness,‚Äù

original: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: blo dang sgra khyad par can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na gzugs nyid bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition and the word ‚Äúother,‚Äù like form itself.

original: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid kyi blo ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa'i blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par gzhan nyid kyi blo ni gzhan nyid dang ldan pa'i blta bar bya ba la sogs pa'i yul dngos dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of otherness in the ultimate does not have an object that possesses otherness,

original: gzhan nyid kyi blo yin @156a * //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyi blo yin @156a * //
translated: because it is the cognition of otherness,

original: pa'i phyir dper na gzhan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: pa'i phyir dper na gzhan nyid kyi yul can ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of non-otherness.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: 'di la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de gzhan la yod dam gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan nyid ces bya ba de gzhan la yod dam gzhan ma yin pa la yod grang na /
translated: Here, does this so-called otherness exist in another or in what is not another?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the problem?

original: gal te gzhan la yod do zhe na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la yod do zhe na //
translated: If you say it exists in another,

original: gzhan nyid gzhan la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid gzhan la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: otherness does not exist in another.

original: de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar pha rol po'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'jug pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / gzhan ni gzhan nyid dang bral bar pha rol po'i phyogs la yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be pointless for it to engage, and because the opponent‚Äôs position is established as being free from otherness.

original: ci ste gzhan ma yin pa la yod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste gzhan ma yin pa la yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say it exists in what is not another,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: But,

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod pa min //
translated: it does not exist in what is not different.

original: rang las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang las gzhan nyid yin par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that it is different from itself.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gzhan nyid dang ldan pa ni de dang ldan du zin kyang de'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
translated: it is not tenable that that which possesses difference is of the nature of that even if it does possess that.

original: ba lang dang ldan pa ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang dang ldan pa ba lang dang ldan du zin kyang ba lang nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is not tenable that that which possesses a cow is a cow even if it does possess a cow.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: de dang ldan pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: de dang ldan pas de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Although it is not the case that it is of the nature of that due to possessing that,

original: 'on kyang de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i blo dang sgra'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: nevertheless, it is the cause of the cognition and term of that.

original: de ni dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni dgag pa smras zin pa'i phyir lan du mi rung ngo //
translated: This is not a suitable response because the refutation of that has already been stated.

original: gal te gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: If you say: Since difference is clarified by difference, it is not of the nature of that.

original: de dang ldan pa don med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa don med pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: And it is not the case that possessing that is meaningless.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical.

original: gsal bar byed pas gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas gzhan nyid kyis de gsal bar byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang
analyzed: gsal bar byed pas gsal bar bya ba'i don gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid du gsal bar byed pa'i phyir gzhan nyid kyis gzhan 'di ni gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byed pas gzhan nyid kyis de gsal bar byed pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang
translated: Because the clarifier clarifies the object to be clarified as having the nature of clarity, it is not logical that the clarifier clarifies that by means of otherness, because it would be meaningless for the clarifier to clarify that by means of otherness, since it is already established that it is other.

original: / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / gzhan nyid ma yin pas ni 'di gzhan yin no zhes gsal bar byar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is not logical that the clarifier clarifies that by means of non-otherness, since it is not logical to say ‚Äúthis is other‚Äù by means of non-otherness.

original: 'di ni phyogs tsam pa zhig bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni phyogs tsam pa zhig bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is a mere indication of the position.

original: 'dis spyi dang khyad par dang yod pa nyid dang / tshad la sogs pa dag kyang dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis spyi dang khyad par dang yod pa nyid dang / tshad la sogs pa dag kyang dgag par bya'o //
translated: By this, universals, particulars, existence, measure, and so on should also be refuted.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas ma grub pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan nyid mi 'thad pas gtan tshigs ji skad smos pas ma grub pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since otherness is not tenable in that way, the reason stated is not unestablished.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa gzhan nyid kyi mtha' dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' de dag ni mtha' gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa gzhan nyid kyi mtha' dang / gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyi mtha' de dag ni mtha' gnyis te /
translated: Others say: The two extremes of otherness and non-otherness are the two extremes.

original: de la gal te khyed kyis gzhan nyid kyi mtha' med do zhes de dgag pa brjod pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis mtha' yongs su bzung ba byas pas des na mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la gal te khyed kyis gzhan nyid kyi mtha' med do zhes de dgag pa brjod pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyis mtha' yongs su bzung ba byas pas des na mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say ‚Äúthe otherness-limit does not exist,‚Äù by that statement of negation you would hold to the limit of non-otherness, and thereby you would be harmed by the limit of activity.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ji ltar @156b bstan pa'i tshul gyis re zhig gzhan nyid med do zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas /
analyzed: ji ltar @156b bstan pa'i tshul gyis re zhig gzhan nyid med do zhes bya ba de bstan zin pas /
translated: The way it was taught, ‚Äúotherness does not exist,‚Äù has already been taught.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If otherness does not exist,

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
translated: neither otherness nor sameness exist.

original: gzhan la ltos pas sam /
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pas sam /
translated: Because of dependence on the other,

original: de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid grub pas /
analyzed: de bkag pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid grub pas /
translated: or because of the negation of that, non-otherness is established.

original: tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: tha snyad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan nyid ma grub pas gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The thought is: because it is a convention, and because otherness is not established, non-otherness also does not exist.

original: ji ltar de dgag ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dgag ce na /
translated: How is that negated?

original: don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par lta ba po ni blta bar bya ba dang gzhan ma yin pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, the seer is not non-different from the seen.

original: brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can brten pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is dependent on the special expression.

original: dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na blta bar bya ba'i rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the object of vision itself.

original: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang ; rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / lan 'ga' shes pa log pa'am the tshom can gyi yul nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa byas par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du yod pa nyid dang ; rgyu nyid dang / 'bras bu nyid dang / lan 'ga' shes pa log pa'am the tshom can gyi yul nyid dang / rkyen gyi dbye bas tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa byas par bstan par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should demonstrate the inference by means of the reasons: ‚Äúbecause of existence, because of being a cause, because of being an effect, because of being the object of a cognition that is sometimes erroneous or doubtful, and because of being different due to the division of conditions.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gzhan ma yin pa nyid kyang bkag pa'i phyir mdzad pa'i mtha' la gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, since non-difference is also refuted, the conclusion is not undermined.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar gcig pa nyid la sogs pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because in this way, sameness and so on are not established,

original: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
analyzed: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
translated: It does not contact itself.

original: gzhan yang gzhan dang phrad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhan dang phrad mi 'gyur //
translated: Nor does it contact another.

original: zhes rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: zhes rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'i dbang gis mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: This is the conclusion based on the statements in the treatise.

original: gang la la 'di skad ces 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gang la la 'di skad ces 'dod chags dang chags pa dag phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Someone might say this: The existence of the contact of attachment and one who is attached is tenable.

original: phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa yod pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: Because that which is in the process of contact exists,

original: 'o ma dang chu dag bzhin no //
analyzed: 'o ma dang chu dag bzhin no //
translated: like, for example, milk and water.

original: yang na phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na phrad pa de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Or, the existence of the contact that possesses that contact is tenable.

original: mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa bzhin pas phrad pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod do //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pas bcings pa bzhin pas phrad pa phrad pa dang ldan pa'i mthar thug pa'i sgrar brjod pa de yang yod do //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is used, like, for example, being bound by iron fetters and so on. Therefore, the term ‚Äúultimate‚Äù is used for the contact that possesses contact.

original: de bzhin du don dam par phrad pa po de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par phrad pa po de dang ldan pa'i phrad pa yod pa nyid de /
translated: Similarly, the existence of the contact that possesses that contactor is tenable.

original: brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dper na zas dang 'brel pas brjod pa khyad par can gyi cha la brten pa'i za ba po bzhin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod pas /
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir dang / dper na zas dang 'brel pas brjod pa khyad par can gyi cha la brten pa'i za ba po bzhin pas phrad pa po brjod pa khyad par can gyis brjod par bya ba'i phrad pa po de yang yod pas /
translated: because it is expressed by a special expression, and because, for example, just as the experiencer is dependent on the special aspect of the expression connected with food, the experiencer is expressed by a special expression, and that experiencer also exists.

original: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir phrad pa yod pa nyid do zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, contact exists.

original: de'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThe one who is contacted, the contact,

original: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang // phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
translated: and the one who contacts do not exist.

original: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas gzhan nyid mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that because the proof has been presented, difference is not possible.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i @157a * //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i @157a * //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is as follows.üîΩThe opponent first presents a proof.

original: dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dang por sgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas phrad pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Aryadeva then criticizes that proof and demonstrates that contact lacks intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la phrad pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la phrad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, the power of his own skill is to overcome form.üîΩ

original: bral ba med do //üîΩde bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am /
analyzed: bral ba med do // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la yang phrad pa'am /
translated: Therefore, there is no contact or separation of one‚Äôs own power from form.

original: bral ba med do //
analyzed: bral ba med do //
translated: Similarly, there is no contact or separation of one‚Äôs own power from feeling, from perception, from volitional factors, and from consciousness.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la phrad pa'am bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la phrad pa'am bral ba med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: That which is the absence of contact or separation of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.‚Äù

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: The master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs Lamp of Wisdom, commentary on NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called ‚ÄúExamination of Contact.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter.

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, in the same way, through the refutation of the specific attributes of the opposite of emptiness,

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco lnga pa brtsam mo //
translated: The fifteenth chapter is composed in order to demonstrate the meaning of dependent origination as neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de /üîΩde nyid kyi don de la skur ba btab pa'i phyir dper na smras pa /
analyzed: khyed dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med do zhes smra ba'i dam bcas pa la rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba'i skyon yod de / de nyid kyi don de la skur ba btab pa'i phyir dper na smras pa /
translated: You who maintain that things have no essence have the fault of contradicting your own words,

original: thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba bzhin no //üîΩ'dir yang gal te /
analyzed: thams cad brdzun no zhes bya ba bzhin no // 'dir yang gal te /
translated: because you repudiate the very object you intend to refer to. For example, it is like saying, ‚ÄúEverything is false.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ji ltar dngos po yin /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa yin na ni ji ltar dngos po yin /
translated: Here, if things have no essence, how could they be things?

original: ci ste dngos po yin na ni //
analyzed: ci ste dngos po yin na ni //
translated: But if they are things,

original: ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas dam bcas pa la de nyid kyis don de la skur ba btab pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin pas dam bcas pa la de nyid kyis don de la skur ba btab pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: they cannot be essenceless. Thus, you have the fault of contradicting your own words with respect to the very object you intend to refer to.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: Things do not have essence ultimately,

original: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam ma bcas pa'i phyir des na dam bcas pa'i don la skur ba ma btab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la
analyzed: dper na che ge mo zhig bzhin no zhes bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir dang / don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid du khas blangs nas ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du dam ma bcas pa'i phyir des na dam bcas pa'i don la skur ba ma btab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin la
translated: For example, it is like so and so, because there is no entailment, and because ultimately, having accepted that things do exist intrinsically, we do not subscribe to the view that they are essenceless. Therefore, since we do not deny the meaning of our thesis, our reason is not unestablished.

original: / tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du dam bcas pa la de bzhin du skur ba ma btab pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do //
analyzed: / tha snyad du yang dngos po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid sgyu ma'i ngo bo nyid bzhin du dam bcas pa la de bzhin du skur ba ma btab pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni skye ba med do zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir 'di la skyon med do //
translated: And since we do not deny the conventional intrinsic existence of things, which is like the intrinsic existence of an illusion, and since we have already responded to the objection that dependent origination is not nonarisen, there is no fault in our position.

original: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gzhan du phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gzhan du phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Other scholars who are conceited about their knowledge respond to this as follows:

original: de dag ngo bo nyid gang gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod /
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid gang gis ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du 'dod /
translated: By what intrinsic nature do you assert that things are essenceless?

original: gal te rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid @157b sgro btags nas ma grub bo zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te rang gi rnam par rtog pa'i bzos sbyar ba'i ngo bo nyid @157b sgro btags nas ma grub bo zhe na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you say that they are not established by superimposing an essence that is fabricated by your own thoughts, then you are proving what is already established for us.

original: ci ste de dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa des ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhe na ni de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa des ngo bo nyid med pa nyid do zhe na ni de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you say that they are essenceless in the sense that they arise from causes and conditions, then that is illogical,

original: mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would be undermined by direct perception and by what is commonly acknowledged.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: don dam par rnam par shes pa rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i gzugs la dmigs pa'i skye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do ;
analyzed: don dam par rnam par shes pa rnam par brtags pa'i dngos po'i gzugs la dmigs pa'i skye ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir dang / dngos po yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad ma spangs pa'i phyir mngon sum dang grags pa'i gnod pa med pas kho bo cag gi phyogs la gang gis gang la gnod pa yang med do ;
translated: Since we do not accept that consciousness arises in dependence on the form of an entity that is imagined ultimately, since we refute the existence of entities, and since we do not abandon worldly conventions, there is no undermining of our position by direct perception and what is commonly acknowledged. Therefore, there is no undermining of anything by anything.

original: / mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod par ston par 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod par ston par 'dod na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you want to show that there is contradiction by direct perception, that is not logical.

original: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du yod pa nyid du bstan par bya dgos na de yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum du dmigs pa'i dngos po mngon sum du yod pa nyid du bstan par bya dgos na de yang ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You must show that the entity that is perceived by direct perception exists by direct perception, but that is not established.

original: gal te don dam par dngos po 'ba' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yod par gyur na rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa de'i skye ba don med par 'gyur te /üîΩngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po 'ba' zhig rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis yod par gyur na rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod pa de'i skye ba don med par 'gyur te / ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //
translated: If an entity existed in any way ultimately, its arising would be pointless, because it would exist by its own nature.üîΩIt is not logical for an essence

original: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: to arise from causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra ba'i phyogs la zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the position that advocates an essence‚Äù is left out.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rang gi ngo bo ste /
translated: An essence is one‚Äôs own nature.

original: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for ‚Äúone‚Äôs own nature.‚Äù

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arising is origination.

original: ci ste 'byung bar mthong bas bsnyon par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'byung bar mthong bas bsnyon par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: But if you say, ‚ÄúWe see arising, so it cannot be denied,‚Äù

original: de yang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan la rag las pa yin pas /
analyzed: de yang rgyu dang rkyen gzhan la rag las pa yin pas /
translated: that is also dependent on other causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: And arise from causes and conditions.üîΩ

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
translated: The nature of what arises from causes and conditions is created.

original: de la rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang gi don dang de ma thag pa dang / cha mthun pa dang bskyed pa gcig bu gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu ni thun mong ma yin pa dang / rang gi don dang de ma thag pa dang / cha mthun pa dang bskyed pa gcig bu gang yin pa'o //
translated: The cause is the uncommon, the one that produces the object, the immediate antecedent, the concordant class, and the single generator.

original: rkyen ni de las bzlog pa ste //
analyzed: rkyen ni de las bzlog pa ste //
translated: The condition is the opposite of that.

original: lhan cig byed pa dag go //
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dag go //
translated: The co-operating cause.

original: byas pa ni bcos ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byas pa ni bcos ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Created means artificial.

original: de la 'dir rab ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos mngon no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don te /
translated: Here, the best is the property of the subject, as it is the opposite of the counter-position. This is the meaning of the words.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, sound is not impermanent.

original: rtag pa ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because permanence is created.

original: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: rtag pa la ni byas pa nyid med la sgra la ni byas pa nyid yod pas de'i phyir sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Permanence does not exist in sound, but creation does exist in sound. Therefore sound is impermanent.

original: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de bzhin du 'dir yang ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar mi rigs te /
translated: Just as it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it is produced,‚Äù in the same way, here also, it is not tenable that an intrinsic reality arises from causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung ba'i ngo bo nyid ni byas pa yin par 'gyur la /
translated: An intrinsic reality that arises from causes and conditions would be produced.

original: ngo bo nyid la ni byas pa nyid yod pa ma @158a * //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la ni byas pa nyid yod pa ma @158a * //
translated: But an intrinsic reality does not exist that is produced.

original: yin te // ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te // ngo bo nyid ni ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an intrinsic reality is not produced.

original: 'di la ni byas pa nyid yod pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ni byas pa nyid yod pas 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi skye mched rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, since it is produced, the inference is: ultimately, the internal sense bases do not exist with intrinsic reality,

original: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang / phyugs dang / ri dags dang / bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba'i phyir dper na sgyu mar byas pa'i mi dang / phyugs dang / ri dags dang / bya la sogs pa'i rdzas dag bzhin no //
translated: because they arise from causes and conditions, just like the substances of a man, a cow, a deer, a bird, etc., created by magic.

original: gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog go //
analyzed: gang la ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni 'byung bar mi 'gyur bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog go //
translated: Whatever exists with intrinsic reality does not arise. Therefore, it is reversed from the discordant class.

original: 'dir tshig gi don ma rtogs pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir tshig gi don ma rtogs pa sun 'byin par 'dod pa kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone who wishes to refute the meaning of the wordsüîΩsays, ‚ÄúThe example is flawed because it does not instantiate the property to be proven.

original: sgyu ma ni gsang sngags dang sman yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis 'jim pa dang / sa dang / rtsa dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid las glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'i phyir /üîΩdpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: sgyu ma ni gsang sngags dang sman yongs su gzung ba'i dbang gis 'jim pa dang / sa dang / rtsa dang / 'bras bu dang / lo ma la sogs pa dag yod pa nyid las glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs su snang ba'i phyir / dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: The illusion is clay, earth, grass, fruit, leaves, and so on that appear in the form of an elephant and so on due to the power of the mantra and medicine that are held.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: glang po cher snang ba glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa dpe nyid du 'dod kyi rtsa la sogs pa dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: glang po cher snang ba glang po che'i ngo bo nyid med pa dpe nyid du 'dod kyi rtsa la sogs pa dag mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / de dag gi ngo bo nyid kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: We assert that the appearance as an elephant is the example of the absence of the elephant‚Äôs intrinsic reality, but we do not assert that it is grass and so on, because their intrinsic reality does not exist.

original: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / sa la sogs pa dag rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because their production is refuted and because the substantial existence of earth and so on is refuted.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say,

original: ji tsam du gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba de dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal pa nyid yin no //
