analyzed: ji tsam du gang dag rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba de dag thams cad dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal pa nyid yin no //
translated: Whatever arises from causes and conditions is an entity, and so the meaning of your reason is contradictory.

original: ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: ma nges pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also uncertain,

original: sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma la sogs pa kha cig mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because some illusions and so on exist in both the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyang yin te /
translated: It is also unestablished, because the meaning of your reason is not established, since it does not pervade the entire similar class.

original: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dang rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas dang rgyu dang rkyen las ma byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because space and so on are uncompounded and do not arise from causes and conditions.

original: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas su zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu dag rgyu dang rkyen gyis byas su zin kyang gzhan la med pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces brjod de /
translated: because although the entity itself, which is like an illusion, a dream, or a mirage, is produced by causes and conditions, it is called an entity because it does not exist elsewhere.

original: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin pas de'i phyir ngo bo nyid ces bya ba de ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa pa ma yin no //
translated: For example, it is like the heat of fire. Therefore, that which is called ‚Äúintrinsic reality‚Äù is a conventional expression, not an ultimate reality.

original: don dam par ni /üîΩngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
analyzed: don dam par ni / ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
translated: In the ultimate sense,

original: ji lta bur ni rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur ni rung bar 'gyur //
translated: how could intrinsic realityüîΩbe a product?

original: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni ngo bo nyid med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The point is that being a product is not possible without the absence of intrinsic reality.

original: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma @158b yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don 'gal ba nyid dang ma nges pa nyid ma @158b yin no //
translated: Therefore, because there is no counterexample, the meaning of the reason is neither contradictory nor uncertain.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the case that it does not pervade all similar instances,

original: tha snyad du yang nam mkha' la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du yang nam mkha' la sogs pa ma skyes pa dag ni ri bong gi rva bzhin du yod pa nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even conventionally, such things as space, which are not produced, are not accepted as existent, like the horn of an ass.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba bzhin du de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad la ma khyab tu zin kyang bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med pas brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba bzhin du de yang gtan tshigs yin pa'i phyir dang / dus gcig tu phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir dang / 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po phyogs su ma byas pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Since it is not a property of the subject at one time, and since an unconditioned thing is not a property of the subject, there is no fault.

original: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags na yang de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs brtags na yang de las bzlog pas phyogs kyi chos kyi dbang gis rjes su dpag pa smra bar 'dod nas bshad pa /
translated: Now, when the dissimilar instances are examined, since it is the opposite of that, the property of the subject is stated by the power of inference.üîΩAn intrinsic reality is not fabricated

original: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: bcos ma ma yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyis ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not fabricated because it is not produced by causes and conditions.

original: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni brjod pa khyad par can brten pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la ltos pa med pa ni brjod pa khyad par can brten pa gzhan la ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not depend on another because it does not depend on another, a special expression.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams ni de ltar bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams ni de ltar bcos ma ma yin pa dang / gzhan la ltos pa med pa ma yin te /
translated: Internal things are not unfabricated and not independent.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: byas pa nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin no //
translated: They are produced and they are dependent.

original: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos bya ba nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos bya ba nyid dang / ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: This shows that the property of things is activity and dependence.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, the inference is: ultimately, internal things are essenceless,

original: byas pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa'i phyir dang / brjod pa khyad par can bstan pa nyid la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul pa'i mi la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are produced and because they are dependent on the teaching of a special expression, like, for example, a man created by a magician.

original: gang ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which exists essentially cannot be reversed.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no /üîΩ// / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu gcig pa //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no / // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu gcig pa //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might argue as follows:

original: don dam par nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi skye mched kyi dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: In reality, things that are internal sources exist essentially becauseüîΩthey are the cause of the expression ‚Äúother than itself‚Äù and of the distinctiveüîΩobject of the expression. For example, they are the cause of the expression

original: rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ring po thung ngu'i brjod pa dang ; brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na ring po thung ngu'i brjod pa dang ; brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa bzhin no //
translated: ‚Äúlong‚Äù and of the distinctive object of the expression.

original: de bzhin du rang las gzhan pa la'ang /
analyzed: de bzhin du rang las gzhan pa la'ang /
translated: Similarly, in the case of ‚Äúother than itself,‚ÄùüîΩthere is the cause of the expression ‚ÄúThis is other‚Äù and of the distinctive

original: 'di ni gzhan no zhes brjod pa dang / brjod pa khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yod do //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan no zhes brjod pa dang / brjod pa khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yod do //
translated: object of the expression.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa du ma brjod pas /
analyzed: 'di la ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa du ma brjod pas /
translated: Since many inferences have been presented showing that there is no essence,

original: dngos po'i @159a * //üîΩngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan zin pas /
analyzed: dngos po'i @159a * // ngo bo nyid med do zhes bstan zin pas /
translated: it has been demonstrated that thingsüîΩhave no essence.

original: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
translated: If there were no essence,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod pa de smros shig / ngo bo nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde'i phyir / gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod pa de smros shig / ngo bo nyid ni de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos po zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so // de'i phyir / gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: So tell us, how could there be any otherness in that?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
translated: The meaning is that intrinsic reality is called ‚Äúotherness‚Äù in dependence on a thing that is other than it.

original: ces bya ba smras te /
analyzed: ces bya ba smras te /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThe intrinsic reality of othernessüîΩIs called ‚Äúotherness.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod pa yin no //üîΩngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang ma grub pas de'i phyir rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po'i rang gi bdag nyid kyi ngo bo nyid ni dngos po gzhan la ltos nas gzhan gyi dngos por brjod pa yin no // ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang ma grub pas de'i phyir rang las gzhan pa'i brjod pa dang / brjod par bya ba khyad par can nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: The intrinsic reality of the intrinsic reality of otherness is called ‚Äúotherness‚Äù in dependence on another thing.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin la /
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin la /
translated: Since it has no intrinsic reality, otherness is not established. Therefore the reason ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of the distinction between the expression and the object of expression that are different from itself‚Äù is either unestablished or contradictory.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: And there is no example.

original: ring po dang thung ngu dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ring po dang thung ngu dag ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because long and short are not established.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag gis don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dngos po dag gis don dam pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa nyid de /
translated: The ultimate nature of things such as eyes exists because they are things.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na me'i tsha ba nyid bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the heat of fire.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: med dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par me'i tsha ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang /
analyzed: med dang bud shing brtag pa'i skabs su don dam par me'i tsha ba nyid bsal ba'i phyir dang / don dam par yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir me ma grub pas dpe'i chos can ma grub pa'i skyon dang /
translated: Because in the context of the analysis of fire and fuel, the ultimate heat of fire is refuted, because ultimate existence is refuted, and because arising is refuted, fire is not established. Therefore the example has the fault of an unestablished subject.

original: dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: dpe bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan pa'i skyon yod do //
translated: And the example does not possess the property to be proven.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: Apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality, how could there be any entity?

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the words is that entities do not exist.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten te byung ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ni ngo bo nyid ces bya la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams la brten te byung ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid ni ngo bo nyid ces bya la /
translated: The nature of things that arise in dependence on causes and conditions is called ‚Äúintrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po rgyu la sogs pa dag ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid las gzhan pa'i dngos po rgyu la sogs pa dag ni gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ste /
translated: The things that are other than intrinsic reality, such as causes, are called ‚Äúextrinsic reality.‚Äù

original: de la / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
analyzed: de la / ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / yod na dngos po 'grub par 'gyur //
translated: If intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality exist, then things would be established.

original: de dag kyang ji ltar med pa de ltar sngar spyi dang khyad par bstsal bas /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar med pa de ltar sngar spyi dang khyad par bstsal bas /
translated: But since they do not exist, as explained above in the sections on general and specific refutations,

original: de bstsal zin pas /
analyzed: de bstsal zin pas /
translated: they have already been refuted.

original: de'i phyir dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore the meaning of the reason, ‚Äúbecause they exist,‚Äù is not established.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:üîΩThose who view intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //üîΩde dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba // de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: Things and nonthings,üîΩDo not see the truth

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: In the Buddha‚Äôs teaching.

original: zhes khyod kyis 'og nas smras pa de la da @159b ltar khyod /
analyzed: zhes khyod kyis 'og nas smras pa de la da @159b ltar khyod /
translated: You will say this later.

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag / ma gtogs dngos po ga la yod //
translated: apart from intrinsic reality and extrinsic reality?

original: ces smra ba 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ces smra ba 'dis gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: This statement refutes you.

original: yang na dngos po yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na dngos po yod pa nyid de /
translated: Or, an entity does exist,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod pa'i phyir dper na /
translated: because its opposite exists, just as

original: bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bya rog yod pas 'ug pa yod pa bzhin no //
translated: the existence of crows is due to the existence of owls.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩdon dam par skye ba bkag pas /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / don dam par skye ba bkag pas /
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf, due to the negation of ultimate arising,

original: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te dngos po ma grub na //
translated: an entity is not established,

original: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: a nonentity is not established.

original: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po bkag pas dngos po med pa zhes brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a nonentity is said to be the negation of an entity.

original: dngos po med par yang mi brjod pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
analyzed: dngos po med par yang mi brjod pas khas blangs pa la gnod pa yang med la /
translated: Since a nonentity is not said to exist, there is no contradiction in our position,

original: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no //üîΩyang na / dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa yang ma yin no // yang na / dngos po gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: and the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.üîΩOr,üîΩPeople say that the transformation of an entity

original: dngos med yin par skye bo smra //üîΩdngos po med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dam /
analyzed: dngos med yin par skye bo smra // dngos po med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid dam /
translated: is a nonentity.

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Since that also does not exist because an entity does not exist, the reason is not common to both sides or it contradicts the meaning.

original: dpe yang med de /
analyzed: dpe yang med de /
translated: There is no example of that.

original: dam dam par bya rog dang 'ug pa dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dam dam par bya rog dang 'ug pa dag yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because crows and owls are not renowned as existing.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar nye bar brtags na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar nye bar brtags na /
translated: Because, when examined in this way,

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma grub pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras gang dag chags pa med pa'i blo yod pa shes bya'i rgya mtsho chen po mtha' dag la blo gros kyi 'od zer thogs pa med pa dang
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po med pa ma grub pa de'i phyir bde bar gshegs pa'i sras gang dag chags pa med pa'i blo yod pa shes bya'i rgya mtsho chen po mtha' dag la blo gros kyi 'od zer thogs pa med pa dang
translated: the entities of essence, other, existence, and nonexistence are not established, therefore, the heirs of the sugatas, who have minds free from attachment, who possess the stainless light rays of intelligence on the great ocean of objects of knowledge,

original: ldan pas thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ldan pas thams cad la phan gdags pa'i phyir /
translated: who are endowed with the ability to benefit all,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul spyad dka' ba spyod par byed pa rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta la spyod pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par mi blta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i tshul spyad dka' ba spyod par byed pa rnams par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi shing rta la spyod pa de dag ni ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang / dngos po dang / dngos po med par mi blta'o //
translated: who practice the difficult conduct of the way of the tathƒÅgatas, who ride the chariot of nonconceptual wisdom, do not view essence, other, existence, and nonexistence.

original: de dag las gzhan pa'i sems can chung ngu tshe rabs gzhan du yang chos zab cing rgya che ba la bzod pa ma skyes pa ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po dang dngos po med par smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo nyams par gyur pa /
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa'i sems can chung ngu tshe rabs gzhan du yang chos zab cing rgya che ba la bzod pa ma skyes pa ngo bo nyid dang / gzhan gyi dngos po dang dngos po dang dngos po med par smra ba la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo nyams par gyur pa /
translated: Other sentient beings, even though they are small, have not generated the patience for the profound and vast Dharma in other lifetimes, and their minds are impaired by the latent tendencies of attachment to the views of inherent existence, other existence, existence, and nonexistence.üîΩThose who view inherent existence, other existence,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //
translated: existence, and nonexistence,

original: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //
translated: in the teaching of the Buddha,

original: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: do not see reality.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba ni /
translated: The view of inherent existence, etc.,

original: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rigs pa dang lung dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: is intended to be contradictory to reasoning and scripture.

original: de la ji ltar rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la ji ltar rigs pa dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar ni bstan zin to //
translated: How it is contradictory to reasoning has already been explained.

original: ji ltar lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir bshad de /üîΩbcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: ji ltar lung dang 'gal ba nyid yin pa de ltar 'dir bshad de / bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: How it is contradictory to scripture will now be explained.üîΩThe Lord has said to Katyayana:

original: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
analyzed: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
translated: ‚ÄúThe Buddha does not exist

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // @160a * //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // @160a * //
translated: And in the instructions,

original: med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
analyzed: med pa gnyi ga'ang dgag pa mdzad //
translated: both existence and nonexistence are refuted.

original: k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
analyzed: k'a ty'a ya na 'jig rten 'di ni gnyis la gnas te /
translated: KƒÅtyƒÅyana said, ‚ÄúThis world is based on duality,üîΩmost of it thinking in terms of existence and nonexistence.‚Äù

original: phal cher yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: phal cher yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du kun dga' bo yod ces bya ba ni rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: And similarly, ƒÄnanda, to say ‚Äúit exists‚Äù is eternalism,

original: med ces bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: med ces bya ba ni chad par 'gyur ro zhes kyang gsungs so //
translated: and to say ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is annihilationism.

original: yang na kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang na kha cig la blo 'di lta bu 'byung ste /
translated: Or, some think as follows:

original: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par dngos po rnams med pa yin na /
translated: If ultimately things do not exist,üîΩthen what is it that is said to see reality when one sees that?

original: 'o na gang dag gi / de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong zhes bya snyam na thub pa chen po'i sras rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba gang dag / dngos po rgyu
analyzed: 'o na gang dag gi / de kho na mthong ba la de kho na mthong zhes bya snyam na thub pa chen po'i sras rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa'i nyi ma'i 'od zer gyis mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba gang dag / dngos po rgyu
translated: The sons of the Great Sage, who have dispelled the darkness of ignorance with the light rays of the sun of the knowledge of dependent origination, say that things that arise from causes and conditions

original: dang rkyen las byung ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag la /
analyzed: dang rkyen las byung ba tha snyad kyi yan lag tu gyur pa dag la /
translated: are the limbs of convention.

original: shes rab kyis yongs su rtog na /
analyzed: shes rab kyis yongs su rtog na /
translated: If one sees by means of wisdom,

original: ngo bo nyid kyang med /üîΩgzhan gyi dngos po yang med /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyang med / gzhan gyi dngos po yang med /
translated: there is no intrinsic reality,üîΩno extrinsic reality,üîΩno reality,

original: dngos po yang med /
analyzed: dngos po yang med /
translated: and no unreality.

original: dngos po med pa yang med do zhes dgag pa'i tshul gyis mthong ba de dag ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang med do zhes dgag pa'i tshul gyis mthong ba de dag ni de kho na mthong ba yin te /
translated: Those who see in this way by means of the method of negation see reality,

original: de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the cause of seeing reality.

original: gzhan stong pa nyid du lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa /
analyzed: gzhan stong pa nyid du lta bas 'jigs shing skrag par gyur pa /
translated: Those who are frightened and terrified by the view of the emptiness of other,üîΩlike those who wish to eliminate space, which is the abode of tangible objects that are frightening and terrifying,

original: nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi gnas su gyur pa'i nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa lta bu ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba la gnas pa /
analyzed: nam mkha' 'jigs shing skrag pa thogs pa dang bcas pa'i rdzas kyi gnas su gyur pa'i nam mkha' sel bar 'dod pa lta bu ngo bo nyid la sogs par lta ba la gnas pa /
translated: who abide in the view of intrinsic reality, etc.,üîΩwho view intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality,

original: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag dngos nyid gzhan dngos dang // dngos dang dngos med nyid lta ba //
translated: reality, and unreality,üîΩdo not see reality

original: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //üîΩde nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas bstan pa la //üîΩde nyid mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: in the teaching of the Buddha.

original: de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag mthong ba ni log pa'i shes pas mthong ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because seeing them is seeing through a mistaken consciousness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩbcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / bcom ldan dngos dang dngos med pa //
translated: Thus,

original: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
analyzed: ston pas k'a ty'a ya na yi //
translated: the Transcendent Lord, in the advice to Katyayana,

original: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyis ka dgag par mdzad //
analyzed: gdams ngag las ni yod pa dang // med pa gnyis ka dgag par mdzad //
translated: refuted both existence and nonexistence.

original: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid la sogs par mi lta ba ni de kho na mthong ba yin no zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par bya ba nyid du rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to understand that not seeing essence and so forth is seeing reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na //
translated: If things essentially existed,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: they would not become nonexistent.

original: / dngos po rnams la ni snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa nyid dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: / dngos po rnams la ni snga na med pa dang / zhig nas med pa nyid dag kyang yod do //
translated: Things also have nonexistence prior to arising and nonexistence after disintegration.

original: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po'i chos gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that things change into something else.

original: ci'i phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dngos po'i bdag nyid rang bzhin gyis yod pa nyid yin na /
translated: Why, if the nature of things existed essentially,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du mi 'dod ce na /
translated: would it not be accepted that they change into something else?

original: de'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan @160b nyid kyi /üîΩrang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po'i mtshan @160b nyid kyi / rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: of the characteristics of things

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: never makes sense as transforming into something else.

original: zhes smras te /
analyzed: zhes smras te /
translated: This is what he means.

original: me'i tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: me'i tsha ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rang bzhin grang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The essential nature of the characteristic of fire is not cold, just as the essential nature of the characteristic of heat is not cold.

original: de'i phyir de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin te /
translated: Therefore this is an example of dissimilarity.

original: dper na brtag pa la byas pa nyid yod par mi rigs pa bzhin no //üîΩ'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ji ltar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dper na brtag pa la byas pa nyid yod par mi rigs pa bzhin no // 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ji ltar rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin te /
translated: For example, it is not tenable that a pot is a product.

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa med dang phrad pas /
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir dper na chu'i reg pa med dang phrad pas /
translated: Here the argument is as follows: Ultimately, the essential nature that is conceived in relation to internal things does not exist because it transforms into something else, like the heat of water.

original: tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: tsha ba'i dngos por gyur pa la don dam pa pa'i tsha ba'i ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no //
translated: When it comes into contact with cold, the thing that is hot does not ultimately have the nature of heat.

original: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: But if someone thinks this,

original: lung las / shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas tshul yang tsha ba nyid yod pa'i phyir dpe med do snyam na /üîΩde la rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: lung las / shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pas tshul yang tsha ba nyid yod pa'i phyir dpe med do snyam na / de la rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'am /
translated: then that is not so.

original: sems la dbang thob pas rtsva 'am /
analyzed: sems la dbang thob pas rtsva 'am /
translated: One who possesses supernatural power or who has obtained control over mind can transform grass,üîΩstraw, excrement and so on into jewels, gold, silver and so on by blessing it and saying, May this become that.

original: phub ma dang / lci ba la sogs pa gang dang gang la nor bu dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob par byed pa de dang de bzhin du 'gyur ba shing la zhal gyis bzhes nas /
analyzed: phub ma dang / lci ba la sogs pa gang dang gang la nor bu dang / gser dang / dngul la sogs par gyur cig ces byin gyis rlob par byed pa de dang de bzhin du 'gyur ba shing la zhal gyis bzhes nas /
translated: Similarly, the Buddha accepted that the tree had various constituents and said,

original: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin no //üîΩgal te khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhe na ;
analyzed: shing sdong po 'di la khams sna tshogs yod do zhes gsungs pa yin no // gal te khams sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni nus pa sna tshogs zhes bya ba'i don yin no zhe na ;
translated: This tree has various constituents.üîΩIf the meaning of various constituents is various powers,

original: gang zhig gang gi nus pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi nus pa dang ldan pa de ni de'i ngo bo nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: then it is illogical that that which possesses a particular power is the essence of that power.

original: sa'i sra ba nyid kyang gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa'i sra ba nyid kyang gsher ba nyid dang / tsha ba nyid dang g-yo ba nyid kyi ngo bo nyid du gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Earth‚Äôs solidity would become the essence of water‚Äôs wetness, fire‚Äôs heat, and wind‚Äôs motility.

original: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /üîΩdngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
analyzed: bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa / dngos po gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa dag kyang yod pa nyid du shes par bya ste /
translated: The VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas say:üîΩThe transformation of the state and time of things should be understood to exist because they are objects of consciousness, just like the present.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas des na gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir dper na da ltar bzhin pas des na gzhan du gyur pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don gal te byung nas 'jig pa yin na ni /
translated: Therefore, if the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause it transforms‚Äù is that it arises and is destroyed,

original: gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: then the meaning of the reason is not established for the opponent.

original: ci ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: ci ste gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na ni rang la gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: But if the meaning of the reason is that it transforms, then the meaning of the reason is not established for us.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa yang med de /
analyzed: don dam par da ltar byung ba'i dngos po yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas dpe ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir dang / gnas skabs dang dus gzhan du gyur pa yang med de /
translated: Nor does it change into another state or time,

original: skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'das pa dang ma @161a * //
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa bzhin du de dag kyang bkag pa'i phyir ro // 'das pa dang ma @161a * //
translated: because they are refuted just like arising.

original: 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Past and future things also do not exist.

original: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: da ltar ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: Because they are not present, like a sky flower.

original: tha snyad du yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: tha snyad du yang 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dngos po rnams yod pa nyid du mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even conventionally, past and future things are not established as existing,

original: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi sgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub pas /
analyzed: 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa'i gnod pa yod pa'i phyir dang / dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag mi sgrub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub pas /
translated: because there is the contradiction of the nonerroneous refutation of them, and because things and nonthings are not established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that is not good.

original: grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: grangs can dag las gang dag yod pa nyid zil gyis non pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Some SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that because existence is overcome,

original: bag la zha ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang sgrub pa brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: bag la zha ba'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes zer ba de dag la yang sgrub pa brgal zhing brtag par bya ste /
translated: But this is not so, because the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: gal te de dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
analyzed: gal te de dag na re dngos po 'gags pa dang / ma skyes pa ni yod pa nyid de /
translated: If they say that a thing that has ceased and a thing that has not yet arisen exist,

original: zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i phyir nyi ma'i 'od zer dag gis skar ma'i 'od zil gyis non pa bzhin nam /
translated: because they are overwhelmed, like the light of the stars is overwhelmed by the light of the sun,

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ram /üîΩdus su brjod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ram / dus su brjod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because they are objects of consciousness,üîΩbecause they are expressed in terms of time,

original: 'di zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: 'di zhes bstan pa'i phyir da ltar gyi dngos po bzhin no zhes zer na /
translated: or because they are indicated as this or that, like a present thing,

original: de la yang dgag pa ji skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la yang dgag pa ji skad bstan pa nyid brjod par bya'o //
translated: then the refutation that has been taught should be stated to them.

original: zil gyis non pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: zil gyis non pa'i gtan tshigs kyi don kyang ma grub pa nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: And the meaning of the reason of being overwhelmed should be stated to be not established.

original: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar byar mi rung ste /
analyzed: mi gsal ba ni gsal bar byar mi rung ste /
translated: That which is unclear cannot be made clear,

original: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it is unclear, like a sky flower.

original: de bzhin du bag la ma zha ba yang bag la zha bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩbag la ma zha ba'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin nam /
analyzed: de bzhin du bag la ma zha ba yang bag la zha bar mi 'gyur te / bag la ma zha ba'i phyir dper na shes pa yod pa nyid bzhin nam /
translated: Likewise, that which is not latent will not become latent.

original: gtso bo bzhin pas grub pa'i mtha' la gnod do //
analyzed: gtso bo bzhin pas grub pa'i mtha' la gnod do //
translated: Because it is not latent, it is like the existence of consciousness or like the primal substance.üîΩTherefore, your tenet is undermined.

original: dngos po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid du 'dzin pa la skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: There is another fault in apprehending things as existent.

original: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin yod nyid na /
translated: If intrinsic reality exists,

original: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni med nyid mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it will not become nonexistent.

original: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ni //
translated: Intrinsic reality transforming into something else

original: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nam yang 'thad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will never be tenable.

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / dpe yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The intended meaning is that intrinsic reality does not transform because there is no example of it.

original: rang bzhin med pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du bstan par mi nus te /
translated: Intrinsic realitylessness cannot be demonstrated as transforming into something else.

original: mo gsham gyi bu'i na tshod bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa bzhin pas /
analyzed: mo gsham gyi bu'i na tshod bzhin du 'gyur ba med pa bzhin pas /
translated: Like the age of the son of a barren woman, it does not transform.

original: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: what transforms into something else?

original: de lta bas na mtha' de gnyi ga yang skyon che bas dam pa rnams de dag yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na mtha' de gnyi ga yang skyon che bas dam pa rnams de dag yongs su 'dzin par mi byed do //
translated: Therefore, since both of these extremes are faulty, the holy do not accept them.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩkhyod kyis rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes smras pa'i phyir dgag pa nyid brjod pas de'i skabs ston pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi @161b mthus /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / khyod kyis rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa la gzhan du 'gyur ba med do zhes smras pa'i phyir dgag pa nyid brjod pas de'i skabs ston pa'i phyir sgra'i don gyi @161b mthus /
translated: Here, someone might say:üîΩSince you have said that that which does not intrinsically exist does not transform, you have stated a negation.

original: rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid du khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: Since you have stated a negation, you have thereby accepted that it transforms.

original: des na khyod kyis phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na khyod kyis phyogs snga ma la gnod pa dang / gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, you have undermined your own position and your reason is not established.

original: rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod na gzhan du 'gyur ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if it intrinsically existed, it would be impossible for it to transform.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: kho bo ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa stong pa nyid du smra'i /
analyzed: kho bo ni med pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa stong pa nyid du smra'i /
translated: We maintain that the nature of nonexistence is emptiness.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par mi smra ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par mi smra ste /
translated: We do not maintain that it has an existent nature.

original: gang gi phyir chos gang la yang rang bzhin yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos gang la yang rang bzhin yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that any phenomenon has intrinsic nature.

original: ci ste yang mi 'thad bzhin du yang rtog pa la goms pa'i dbang gis rab tu rtog par byed na /
analyzed: ci ste yang mi 'thad bzhin du yang rtog pa la goms pa'i dbang gis rab tu rtog par byed na /
translated: But if you imagine that you can imagine that they exist essentially, even though it is not tenable that they do,

original: rang bzhin yod pa yin na yang //
analyzed: rang bzhin yod pa yin na yang //
translated: then even if they existed essentially,

original: gzhan du 'gyur bar ji ltar rung //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur bar ji ltar rung //
translated: how could they change into something else?

original: lan btab zin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: lan btab zin pa'i phyir dang / gzhan du 'gyur ba ni rang bzhin stong pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The response to this has already been given, and it is also the intention that change is impossible if there is no emptiness of essence.

original: dgag pa nyid kyang tha snyad pa yin te /
analyzed: dgag pa nyid kyang tha snyad pa yin te /
translated: The negation is conventional,

original: tha snyad pa kho nar yod pa nyid du sgrub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tha snyad pa kho nar yod pa nyid du sgrub pa yin gyi /
translated: because it establishes that they exist only conventionally,

original: don dam pa pa ma yin pas phyogs snga ma la gnod par yang mi 'gyur la tha snyad du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang 'grub pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam pa pa ma yin pas phyogs snga ma la gnod par yang mi 'gyur la tha snyad du gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid kyang 'grub pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: and not ultimately. Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs position is not undermined, and since it is established that they change conventionally, the meaning of the reason is not unestablished.

original: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag tu smra ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here the Vaibhaikas say:

original: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched drug po dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par mig la sogs pa skye mched drug po dag ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The six sense bases such as the eye exist ultimately with their own intrinsic nature.

original: yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir dper na mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is the cause of the cognition of existence, like nirvana.

original: de la 'dir smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do //üîΩyod pa'i blo nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes nges par bzung nas gtan tshigs sbyor bar byed na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de la 'dir smig rgyu'i chu la sogs pa dag kyang yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma nges pa nyid do // yod pa'i blo nyid kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes nges par bzung nas gtan tshigs sbyor bar byed na yang gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Here, the reason is unestablished, because even water in a mirage, etc., is the cause of the cognition of existence.üîΩIf you specify the reason as ‚Äúbecause it is the cause of the cognition of mere existence,‚Äù then the reason is unestablished.

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Or, the reason is contradictory.

original: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
analyzed: skyon gzhan 'di yang yod de /
translated: There is another fault.

original: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
translated: To say ‚Äúit exists‚Äù is to grasp permanence;

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta //
translated: to say ‚Äúit does not exist‚Äù is to fall into nihilism.

original: de gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa yin te /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang lta ba ngan pa yin te /
translated: Both of these are bad views,

original: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtho ris dang byang grol gyi gegs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they obstruct rebirth in the higher realms and liberation.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa nyid yin na gang bde bar gyur pa de yang bde bar gyur pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa nyid yin na gang bde bar gyur pa de yang bde bar gyur pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, if it were permanent, then what is pleasure would be pleasure alone.

original: gang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de yang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa de yang sdug bsngal bar gyur pa nyid yin pas /
translated: Whatever is suffering is suffering itself.

original: bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam kun du sten par mi byed de /
analyzed: bde ba bskyed pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir sdug bsngal 'gog par 'gro ba'i lam kun du sten par mi byed de /
translated: Therefore, in order to generate pleasure and to pacify suffering, one should not cultivate the path that leads to the cessation of suffering,

original: yod pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa la bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because action is untenable with respect to what exists.

original: chad pa nyid yin na yang med pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bde ba @162a * //
analyzed: chad pa nyid yin na yang med pa la kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i sdug bsngal dang / bde ba @162a * //
translated: Moreover, if one is annihilated, then the afflicted and purified states of suffering and happiness are untenable with respect to what does not exist.

original: mi 'thad pa su zhig tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te 'jug cing ci'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa su zhig tshul khrims yang dag par blangs te 'jug cing ci'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: What person would engage in the practice of moral discipline and why would one engage in it?

original: med pa la 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: med pa la 'jug pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro // de'i phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: Because it is untenable that what does not exist engages in the practice of moral discipline.üîΩTherefore, the wise do not

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: dwell in existence or nonexistence.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir yod pa dang med par lta ba de dag lta ba skyon chags pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir yod pa dang med par lta ba de dag lta ba skyon chags pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because those views of existence and nonexistence are faulty views,

original: mkhas pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa las brgal bar 'dod pas mtho ris kyi gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dag tu lha'i grong khyer na lha mo'i longs spyod rnyed sla ba'i bde ba dang / tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bde ba /
analyzed: mkhas pa 'khor ba'i dgon pa las brgal bar 'dod pas mtho ris kyi gnas dang / skyed mos tshal dag tu lha'i grong khyer na lha mo'i longs spyod rnyed sla ba'i bde ba dang / tshor ba thams cad rgyun chad pa'i bde ba /
translated: The wise, who wish to cross the wilderness of cyclic existence, desire the bliss of the higher realms and the bliss of the cessation of all feelings,

original: spros pa thams cad ma lus par nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba myong bar 'dod pa /üîΩbdag nyid dang ldan pas /
analyzed: spros pa thams cad ma lus par nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba myong bar 'dod pa / bdag nyid dang ldan pas /
translated: the bliss of the complete pacification of all elaborations.

original: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la gnas par mi bya ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi yod pa nyid dang / med pa nyid la gnas par mi bya ste /
translated: Thus, they do not abide in the existence or nonexistence of things.

original: de dag la gnas pa ni rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de dag la gnas pa ni rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The idea is that if one abides in those, the errors of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: ji ltar na yod pa dang / med par lta ba dag rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na yod pa dang / med par lta ba dag rtag pa dang / chad par lta ba thal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that the views of existence and nonexistence entail the views of eternalism and nihilism?üîΩIt is said:

original: gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ngo bo nyid yod pa //
translated: That which has its own intrinsic reality

original: de ni med pa min pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa //
analyzed: de ni med pa min pas rtag / sngon byung da ltar med ces pa //
translated: Is not nonexistent and thus is permanent.

original: des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: des na chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the consequence of nihilism does not follow.

original: dbu mar smra ba thams cad tha snyad tsam du 'dod pas /üîΩgzugs la sogs pa skyes pa 'di dag ni yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin la /
analyzed: dbu mar smra ba thams cad tha snyad tsam du 'dod pas / gzugs la sogs pa skyes pa 'di dag ni yod pa'i blo'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir yod pa yin la /
translated: All the Madhyamikas accept that form, etc. exist conventionally,üîΩbecause they are the causes of cognitions of existing things.

original: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag ni med do zhes smra ba rnams la ni de ltar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dag ni med do zhes smra ba rnams la ni de ltar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But those who say that form, etc. that have arisen exist, and that what has not arisen and what has been destroyed do not exist, are not subject to the consequence of nihilism.

original: don dam par yang rtogs par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du lta ba med la /
analyzed: don dam par yang rtogs par bya ba'i ngo bo nyid stong pa'i phyir dang / ma skyes pa'i phyir yod pa nyid du lta ba med la /
translated: And, because the nature of the object to be realized is empty, and because it is non-arisen, they do not view it as existent.

original: don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po'i ngo bo nyid med pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: And, because it is not the case that ultimately the nature of things does not exist,

original: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma byas pa bzhin pas med pa nyid du lta ba yang med pa'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang ldan pa'i phyir dper na sgyu ma byas pa bzhin pas med pa nyid du lta ba yang med pa'am /
translated: and because it is endowed with causes, like a magical creation, they do not view it as nonexistent.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i blo la mngon par zhin pa med pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung ba yang med do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i blo la mngon par zhin pa med pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i mtha' gnyis su ltung ba yang med do //
translated: Or else, because they do not settle down on the cognitions of existence and nonexistence, they do not fall into the two extremes of existence and nonexistence.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is to teach dependent origination as free from annihilation and permanence by refuting the specific counter positions to emptiness.

original: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la chad pa'i dngos po'am rtag pa'i dngos po med do //üîΩde bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la chad pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la chad pa'i dngos po'am rtag pa'i dngos po med do // de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la chad pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: Subh≈´ti, there is no real entity of annihilation or real entity of permanence in form.

original: rtag @162b pa'i dngos po med do //üîΩgzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la chad pa'i dngos po'am /
analyzed: rtag @162b pa'i dngos po med do // gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la chad pa'i dngos po'am /
translated: Similarly, there is no real entity of annihilation or real entity of permanence in feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.üîΩThat which is the absence of a real entity of annihilation or real entity of permanence in form,

original: rtag pa'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag pa'i dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du /
translated: feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness is the perfection of wisdom.

original: yod dang med pa gnyi ga mtha' //
analyzed: yod dang med pa gnyi ga mtha' //
translated: And similarly, Existence and nonexistence are both extremes.

original: dag dang ma dag gnyi ga mtha' //üîΩde phyir mtha' gnyis rnam spangs te //
analyzed: dag dang ma dag gnyi ga mtha' // de phyir mtha' gnyis rnam spangs te //
translated: Both pure and impure are extremes.üîΩTherefore, the wise do not abide

original: mkhas pa dbus na'ang gnas mi byed //
analyzed: mkhas pa dbus na'ang gnas mi byed //
translated: Even in the middle that is free from those two extremes.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du /üîΩji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du / ji ltar byis pas rnam brtags ltar //
translated: And similarly,üîΩAll things exist just as

original: dngos rnams thams cad yod pa nyid //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad yod pa nyid //
translated: The childish conceive them to exist.

original: gal te ji ltar de mthong yod //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar de mthong yod //
translated: If they existed as they are seen,

original: thams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad de nyid mthong bar 'gyur //
translated: Everyone would see reality.

original: chos rnams thams cad yod min pas //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad yod min pas //
translated: Since all phenomena do not exist,

original: nyon mongs med cing rnam dag med //
analyzed: nyon mongs med cing rnam dag med //
translated: There is no affliction and no purification.

original: de dag ji ltar mthong ltar med //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar mthong ltar med //
translated: They do not exist as they are seen.

original: de dag med pa nyid kyang min //
analyzed: de dag med pa nyid kyang min //
translated: They do not exist as nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: These statements are established.

original: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: This is the commentary on the fifteenth chapter, having sixteen verses, called

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'o /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /üîΩrab tu byed pa bco lnga pa'o /
translated: ‚Äúthe examination of things and nonthings.‚Äù

original: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
analyzed: // / da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pas /
translated: Now, in the same way, by refuting the specific counter positions to emptiness,

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa brtsam mo //
translated: in order to demonstrate that cyclic existence and nirvana are essenceless, the sixteenth chapter is begun.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, internal phenomena definitely have essences

original: de dag la bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag la bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their bondage and liberation exist.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin par nges par gzung ba de la ni bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin par nges par gzung ba de la ni bcings pa dang thar pa mi 'thad de /
translated: For that which is ascertained not to exist definitely has neither bondage nor liberation,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: like the son of a barren woman.

original: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni de ltar bcings pa dang / thar pa med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag yod pas /
analyzed: nang gi dngos po rnams la ni de ltar bcings pa dang / thar pa med pa ma yin pas de'i phyir de dag yod pas /
translated: But internal phenomena are not like that, in that they have neither bondage nor liberation. Therefore they exist.

original: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus, in reality, internal phenomena definitely have essences.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la 'du byed kyi rgyun thog ma med pa'i dus nas rab tu bsags pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pas mdongs par gyur pa /
analyzed: 'di la 'du byed kyi rgyun thog ma med pa'i dus nas rab tu bsags pa'i mi shes pa'i mun pas mdongs par gyur pa /
translated: Here, the continuum of compositional activity is blinded by the darkness of ignorance that has been accumulated since beginningless time.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khris zin pa /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i chu srin 'dzin khris zin pa /
translated: It is seized by the crocodile of the apprehension of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚Äù

original: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par 'da' ba'i 'gro ba nyams pa /
analyzed: sgyu ma dang / rmi lam dang / smig rgyu lta bu 'khor ba'i btson ra nas yang dag par 'da' ba'i 'gro ba nyams pa /
translated: It is impaired in its ability to transcend the prison of cyclic existence, which is like an illusion, a dream, or a mirage.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis gzhungs pa ni bcings pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis gzhungs pa ni bcings pa'o //
translated: It is bound by the fetters of affliction such as attachment.

original: yang @163a * //
analyzed: yang @163a * //
translated: Moreover,

original: dag pa'i shes pa skyes pas /
analyzed: dag pa'i shes pa skyes pas /
translated: it is liberated by the arising of correct knowledge.üîΩIt is freed from the fetters of affliction such as attachment and is definitely released from them.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis gzhungs pa dang bral zhing de las nges par grol ba ni thar pa'o zhes tha snyad bden par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis gdags par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i lcags sgrog gis gzhungs pa dang bral zhing de las nges par grol ba ni thar pa'o zhes tha snyad bden par rtogs pa'i shes rab kyis gdags par zad kyi /
translated: This is merely designated by the wisdom that realizes conventional reality.

original: don dam pa'i bden par rtogs pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden par rtogs pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not realized by the wisdom that realizes ultimate reality,

original: don dam par bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par bcings pa dang thar pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because bondage and liberation are untenable in the ultimate.

original: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: de ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: The BhagavƒÅn also said this:

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor ba med la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor ba med la /
translated: ‚ÄúThe TathƒÅgata designates sa·πÉsƒÅra, but no one at all is in sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang /
translated: The TathƒÅgata designates nirvƒÅ·πáa,

original: der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' ba med do zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' ba med do zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: but no one at all attains nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis kyang don de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcings par rnam par rtogs pa dag rnam par brtags te /üîΩ'di ltar bcings pa zhig yod par gyur na 'du byed rnams sam /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang don de nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas bcings par rnam par rtogs pa dag rnam par brtags te / 'di ltar bcings pa zhig yod par gyur na 'du byed rnams sam /
translated: The Master also, in consideration of that very meaning, analyzed the conception of bondage:

original: sems can yin grang /
analyzed: sems can yin grang /
translated: Thus, if there were bondage, it would be formations or sentient beings.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang rtag pa dag gam /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang rtag pa dag gam /
translated: Are formations permanent or impermanent?üîΩIf you say they are permanent,üîΩthen they would not cycle.

original: mi rtag pa dag cig yin grang na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dag cig yin grang na /
translated: If you say they are impermanent,üîΩthen they would not cycle.

original: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na bshad pa /üîΩgal te 'du byed 'khor zhe na //
analyzed: de la gal te brtag pa snga ma ltar 'dod na bshad pa / gal te 'du byed 'khor zhe na //
translated: If you say they are both permanent and impermanent,

original: de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
analyzed: de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
translated: then they would not cycle.üîΩIf you say they are neither permanent nor impermanent,üîΩthen they would not cycle.

original: 'du byed rtag pa yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas bcings pa dang / thar pa med pas de dag bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rtag pa yod pa nyid du ston pa'i rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas bcings pa dang / thar pa med pas de dag bstsal ba'i phyir dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid las bzlog pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because there is no inference that shows the existence of permanent formations, and because the error of the opposite of the nature of things would occur in the thesis, since one would be bound by the inference of permanence and there would be no liberation.

original: yang na / de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
analyzed: yang na / de dag rtag na mi 'khor te //
translated: Or else, if they were permanent, they would not cycle

original: zhes bya ba 'di la 'khor ba ni rgyun chags par rgyu zhing 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba yin pa de yang 'du byed rtag pa snga phyi khyad par ma skyes pa rnams la mi 'thad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di la 'khor ba ni rgyun chags par rgyu zhing 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba yin pa de yang 'du byed rtag pa snga phyi khyad par ma skyes pa rnams la mi 'thad do //
translated: Here, cycling is the continuous occurrence of causes and the cycling of beings in the five realms. That is untenable for permanent formations that are not distinguished by earlier and later births.

original: 'dir grangs can dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir grangs can dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here, the Enumerators say:

original: gal te ther zug tu smra ba rnams kyang de skad smra ba dgag pa'i phyir rtag pa rnams mi 'khor ro zhes zer na ni rigs so //
analyzed: gal te ther zug tu smra ba rnams kyang de skad smra ba dgag pa'i phyir rtag pa rnams mi 'khor ro zhes zer na ni rigs so //
translated: If you say that the thesis that they do not cycle is correct because it refutes the assertion of the eternalists, then it is correct.

original: 'on te 'du byed gnas skabs snga ma snga ma gzhan bor nas /
analyzed: 'on te 'du byed gnas skabs snga ma snga ma gzhan bor nas /
translated: Or do they discard the previous states of the formations andüîΩ

original: gnas skabs phyi ma phyi ma gnas 'thob myong bar 'gyur ba mi 'jig pa kho na dag mi 'khor ro zhes zer na ni de mi rigs te /
analyzed: gnas skabs phyi ma phyi ma gnas 'thob myong bar 'gyur ba mi 'jig pa kho na dag mi 'khor ro zhes zer na ni de mi rigs te /
translated: But if you say that conditioned phenomena do not cycle because they do not cycle without abandoning their prior states and attaining later states,üîΩthen that is illogical.

original: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar kho bo cag gi phyogs la 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i dus na rgyu ma zhig par shes par bya ste /
translated: Thus, in our system, it should be understood that at the time the effect arises, the cause has not disintegrated,

original: yul dang / tshad dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i nye ba'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: yul dang / tshad dang / gzugs la sogs pa'i nye ba'i phyir dper na 'bras bu'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because the effect is similar to the cause in terms of object, measure, form, and so on.

original: yang na 'jig pa bkag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na 'jig pa bkag pa'i phyir /
translated: Or, because disintegration is refuted,

original: lus dang / dbang @163b po dang / blo'i mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed rnams nges par gnas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: lus dang / dbang @163b po dang / blo'i mtshan nyid kyi 'du byed rnams nges par gnas pa kho na ste /
translated: conditioned phenomena that have the characteristics of body, sense faculties, and mind definitely endure.

original: skyes bu'i don bya ba'i phyir skyes bu'i dmigs pa bsgrub nus pa'i tshul gyis snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i chos gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu'i don bya ba'i phyir skyes bu'i dmigs pa bsgrub nus pa'i tshul gyis snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i chos gzhan gyi mtshan nyid du yongs su 'gyur bas yongs su 'gyur ba ni 'khor ba zhes bya'o //
translated: and it is the appearance of the other characteristics of manifest and unmanifest things that is called ‚Äúsamsara.‚Äù

original: yongs su 'gyur ba yang nges par gnas pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
analyzed: yongs su 'gyur ba yang nges par gnas pa rnams kyi yin gyi /
translated: And this transformation is of those things that endure,

original: de'i dus su 'jig pa rnams kyi yin par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i dus su 'jig pa rnams kyi yin par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: but not of those things that are destroyed at the time of their existence.

original: 'dir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i chos can yang de dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir dang / yul la sogs pa nye ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi skyon yang sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: snang ba dang / mi snang ba'i chos can yang de dang ldan par bstan pa'i phyir dang / yul la sogs pa nye ba'i gtan tshigs dag gi skyon yang sngar bstan zin pa'i phyir dang / skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / dngos po'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang /
translated: because it has been shown that manifest and unmanifest things are endowed with it, and because the fallacies of the reasons of the object, etc., have been previously demonstrated, and because origination has been refuted, and because the intrinsic reality of things has been refuted.

original: pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa ma grub pas 'du byed mi 'jig pa rnams 'khor ro zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa'i sgrub pa ma grub pas 'du byed mi 'jig pa rnams 'khor ro zhes bya ba de mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not correct to say that formations that do not perish cycle.

original: gzegs zan pa dag dang / rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzegs zan pa dag dang / rang gi sde pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas and our own schools say:

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams 'khor ba nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams 'khor ba nyid yin gyi /
translated: Compounded phenomena that are impermanent cycle.

original: rtag pa snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa rnams la 'khor ba med pa ni bden no //
analyzed: rtag pa snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa rnams la 'khor ba med pa ni bden no //
translated: It is true that permanent phenomena that are not produced, which are distinguished as earlier and later, do not cycle.

original: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: In response to them, it is said:

original: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
translated: Even if they are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: 'di ltar mi rtag par rab tu zhigs pa rnams la phyir skye ba med pas /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag par rab tu zhigs pa rnams la phyir skye ba med pas /
translated: Thus, since those that are impermanent and disintegrate do not arise again,

original: de'i phyir de dag la yang rgyun chags par rgyu zhing 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag la yang rgyun chags par rgyu zhing 'byung ba dang / 'gro ba lngar 'khor ba mi 'thad do //
translated: it is untenable that they cycle in the five realms, moving continuously and arising.

original: yang na mi rtag pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i chos su rjes su dpog pas 'khor ba med pas 'khor ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na mi rtag pa rnams la mi rtag pa'i chos su rjes su dpog pas 'khor ba med pas 'khor ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: Or, since it is inferred that impermanent phenomena are impermanent, they do not cycle. Therefore, to refute cycling,üîΩthe error of refuting the nature of things is committed in the thesis.

original: dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod de de'i phyir /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos kyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod de de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bshad de /
analyzed: mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur // zhes bshad de /
translated: Even if they are impermanent, they do not cycle.

original: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams zhes bya ba'i skabs yin no //
translated: This is the context of the term compounded phenomena.

original: yang na / mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na / mi rtag na yang 'khor mi 'gyur //
translated: Even if impermanent, it would not cycle.

original: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi 'du byed rnams bzhin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma ste /
translated: The remainder of the sentence is ‚Äúlike external formations.‚Äù

original: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe mi 'khor ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos kyi khyad par can du byas pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe mi 'khor ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos kyi khyad par can du byas pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Thus, this is a statement that makes the example similar to the phenomenon, i.e., that internal formations do not cycle, by qualifying the phenomenon with the attribute of impermanence.

original: byas pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: byas pa ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: This is like the statement ‚ÄúThe produced is impermanent.‚Äù
