original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad de /
translated: Here the syllogism is: Ultimately, it is not tenable that internal formations cycle

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because they are impermanent, like external vases and so on.

original: ci ste 'du byed rnams rtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir sems can 'khor ro zhes rnam par rtog na de la yang brgal @164a * //üîΩzhing brtag pa de nyid de /
analyzed: ci ste 'du byed rnams rtag pa gnyi ga ltar yang 'khor bar mi 'thad pa'i phyir sems can 'khor ro zhes rnam par rtog na de la yang brgal @164a * // zhing brtag pa de nyid de /
translated: If one conceives the thought, ‚ÄúSince it is not tenable that either permanent or impermanent formations cycle, sentient beings cycle,‚Äù then the same critique and analysis applies to that.

original: ci sems can rtag pa zhig gam /
analyzed: ci sems can rtag pa zhig gam /
translated: Is the sentient being permanent or impermanent?

original: 'on te mi rtag pa zhig /'khor gnyi ga ltar yang dam 'cha' na lan kyang de nyid de rtag pa ni mi 'gyur bas gnas skabs snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa yang zhig nas mi skye ba'i phyir mi 'khor bas /
analyzed: 'on te mi rtag pa zhig /'khor gnyi ga ltar yang dam 'cha' na lan kyang de nyid de rtag pa ni mi 'gyur bas gnas skabs snga phyi'i khyad par ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / mi rtag pa yang zhig nas mi skye ba'i phyir mi 'khor bas /
translated: If you assert that the self is both permanent and impermanent, the same fault applies, because a permanent self would not change and would not arise with a difference of earlier and later states, and an impermanent self would not arise again after being destroyed.

original: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
analyzed: sems can la yang rim 'di mtshungs //
translated: This same process applies to sentient beings.

original: dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dgag pa'i tshul gyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúin the manner of negation‚Äù is the same.

original: de bas na sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa 'khor ba'i phyogs la yang dam bcas pa'i skyon dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa snga ma bzhin no /
analyzed: de bas na sems can rtag pa dang mi rtag pa 'khor ba'i phyogs la yang dam bcas pa'i skyon dang / rjes su dpag pa'i gnod pa snga ma bzhin no /
translated: Therefore, the fault of the assertion and the refutation by inference apply in the same way to the position that permanent or impermanent sentient beings cycle.

original: ci de yang 'du byed rnams dang sems can mi rtag par smra ba dag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: ci de yang 'du byed rnams dang sems can mi rtag par smra ba dag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Do you also refute the assertion that compounded phenomena and sentient beings are impermanent?

original: 'du byed rnams dang / sems can zhig pa'i rgyu can gyi 'du byed rnams dang / sems can gyi rgyud phyi ma de dag gi rgyu las byung ba dag gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / sems can zhig pa'i rgyu can gyi 'du byed rnams dang / sems can gyi rgyud phyi ma de dag gi rgyu las byung ba dag gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: and the formative factors that are the cause of the destruction of sentient beings, and the subsequent continuum of sentient beings that arise from those causes, because their antidotes have not arisen.

original: rgyun chags su 'khor bas 'khor ba 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: rgyun chags su 'khor bas 'khor ba 'grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: Since they cycle in continuity, samsara is established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: This is not good,

original: de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang / sems can zhig pa dag skad cig ma phyi ma'i rkyen nyid yin pa bstsal ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i skyon ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / de skad smra ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'i rkyen bzhin du 'du byed rnams dang / sems can zhig pa dag skad cig ma phyi ma'i rkyen nyid yin pa bstsal ba'i phyir dang / dam bcas pa'i skyon ma spangs pa'i phyir dang / de skad smra ba la rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir /
translated: because like the immediately preceding condition, the formative factors and the destruction of sentient beings are refuted as being the conditions of the subsequent moment, because the fault of the thesis is not eliminated, and because this assertion is undermined by inference.

original: skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not faultless.

original: 'dir 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir 'jig rten rgyang phan pa dag gis smras pa /
translated: Here the Lokayatas say:

original: 'du byed rnams dang / sems can rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa mi 'khor ro zhes zer ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang / sems can rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa mi 'khor ro zhes zer ba ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Formative factors and sentient beings that are permanent or impermanent do not cycle.

original: ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba //
analyzed: ji tsam dbang po'i spyod yul ba //
translated: And whatever is the domain of the senses,üîΩ

original: skyes bu de tsam nyid du zad //üîΩsngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba //
analyzed: skyes bu de tsam nyid du zad // sngo bsangs mang thos gang smra ba //
translated: A person is no more than the range of experience of the senses.

original: de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
analyzed: de dag spyang ki'i rjes dang 'dra //
translated: The talk of the learned is like the tracks of a wolf.

original: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
analyzed: mdzes ma legs par spyod cing zo //
translated: O beautiful one, enjoy and eat well,

original: lus mchog khyod 'das gang de med //
analyzed: lus mchog khyod 'das gang de med //
translated: for after you pass away, there is nothing.

original: 'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus pa tsam du zad //
analyzed: 'jigs rung song ba phyir mi ldog / lus 'di 'dus pa tsam du zad //
translated: The one who has gone to a frightful place does not return. This body is just a collection.

original: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten gzhan du chos 'ga' yang mi 'gro zhing /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di nas 'jig rten gzhan du chos 'ga' yang mi 'gro zhing /
translated: Nothing whatsoever passes from this world to the next.

original: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi 'jig rten gang yin pa de nas kyang 'dir 'ga' yang ma 'ongs te /
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi 'jig rten gang yin pa de nas kyang 'dir 'ga' yang ma 'ongs te /
translated: And from the world of the previous life, nothing whatsoever comes here.

original: gang dag mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol na 'jig rten yod do zhes bya ba'i don de bsgrub pa'i phyir mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de ni de ma thag tu 'gags pa'i blo can du 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: gang dag mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol na 'jig rten yod do zhes bya ba'i don de bsgrub pa'i phyir mngal na gnas pa'i sngon rol gyi blo gang yin pa de ni de ma thag tu 'gags pa'i blo can du 'gro ba yin te /
translated: The mind of the previous life of the one in the womb is the mind of the one who has just died.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na de'i 'og rol gyi blo bzhin no zhes sgrub pa smra ba de dag la ni dpe med de /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na de'i 'og rol gyi blo bzhin no zhes sgrub pa smra ba de dag la ni dpe med de /
translated: The example does not exist for those who argue, ‚ÄúThe mind exists at the time of death because it is a mind, like the mind that exists after it.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ma shi ba'i bar du gnas pa @164b rnams la blo gcig kho nar zad pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ltar re zhig 'jig rten snga ma med do /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma shi ba'i bar du gnas pa @164b rnams la blo gcig kho nar zad pa'i phyir te / de ltar re zhig 'jig rten snga ma med do /
translated: Because there is only one mind that exists until death.üîΩThus, first, the prior world does not exist.

original: ji ltar 'jig rten phyi ma med pa de ltar 'di bshad de /üîΩlhas byin gyi 'chi ka'i sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten phyi ma med pa de ltar 'di bshad de / lhas byin gyi 'chi ka'i sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med de /
translated: The subsequent world does not exist

original: 'chi ka'i sems yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka'i sems bzhin no //
analyzed: 'chi ka'i sems yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i 'chi ka'i sems bzhin no //
translated: The mind of Devadatta‚Äôs death does not link with another mind because it is the mind of death, like the mind of death of an arhat.

original: de la 'dir 'du byed mi rtag pa 'khor ba tha snyad du ma bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rtag pa 'khor ba ni //
analyzed: de la 'dir 'du byed mi rtag pa 'khor ba tha snyad du ma bkag pa'i phyir dang / 'du byed rtag pa 'khor ba ni //
translated: Here, since the impermanence of compounded phenomena is not refuted conventionally, and since the permanence of compounded phenomena is refuted in both

original: gnyi gar yang bkag pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gar yang bkag pa'i phyir grub pa la sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: systems, this is not an argument that proves what is already established.

original: lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi gzugs kyi blo ni sgra'i blo las gzhan pa ma yin te //
analyzed: lhas byin gyi rgyud kyi gzugs kyi blo ni sgra'i blo las gzhan pa ma yin te //
translated: The mind that conceives Devadatta‚Äôs form is not different from the mind that conceives sound because

original: yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa la dpe yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'i phyir dper na rgyud gzhan gyi blo bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa la dpe yod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the objects are different, for example, like the mind of another continuum, there is an example that refutes your inference.

original: tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol snga ma ma grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad du 'jig rten pha rol snga ma ma grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, conventionally, the existence of a former world is not unestablished.

original: 'jig rten pha rol phyi ma yang med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol phyi ma yang med pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, a later world does not not exist,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ka'i sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'chi ka'i sems ni sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor te /
translated: because a contaminated final mind links with another mind,

original: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba'i rgyu'i sems bzhin pas tha snyad kyi bden pa dang 'gal ba med do //üîΩgal te don dam par lhas byin gyi blo yang rgyud gzhan gyi blo thams cad las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa'i phyir dper na 'chi ba'i rgyu'i sems bzhin pas tha snyad kyi bden pa dang 'gal ba med do // gal te don dam par lhas byin gyi blo yang rgyud gzhan gyi blo thams cad las gzhan nyid ma yin te /
translated: because it is contaminated, for example, like the mind that is the cause of death. Therefore, there is no contradiction with conventional truth.

original: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na lhas byin gyi blo bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir dper na lhas byin gyi blo bzhin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúUltimately, the mind of Devadatta is not different from all the minds of other continua, because it is a mind, for example, like the mind of Devadatta,‚Äù

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: don dam par lhas byin gyi blo'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa nyid ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa'i sems kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang /üîΩnying mtshams sbyor ba med par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / don dam par sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par lhas byin gyi blo'i skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dang / de las gzhan pa nyid ma yin pa ma grub pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du gzhan nyid ma yin par dam 'cha' na grags pa'i gnod par 'gyur pa'i phyir dang / dgra bcom pa'i sems kyang nying mtshams sbyor ba dang / nying mtshams sbyor ba med par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / don dam par sgrub pa dpe ma tshang ba'i skyon yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately the arising of Devadatta‚Äôs mind is refuted, because it is not established that it is not different from that, because if you assert that it is not different conventionally, it would contradict what is commonly perceived, and because ultimately the example is flawed because it is incomplete.

original: tha snyad du zag pa med pa'i sems phyogs su byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad du zag pa med pa'i sems phyogs su byed na ni grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //
translated: If you take the uncontaminated mind conventionally, then it would be establishing what is already established.

original: srid pa snga ma'i 'chi ka'i sems sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor bas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: srid pa snga ma'i 'chi ka'i sems sems gzhan dang nying mtshams sbyor bas ma nges pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Also, the mind at the death of a former existence is not established as either connected or not connected to the next existence.

original: gal te de yang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de yang phyogs su byas pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because that is also taken as a subject,üîΩthen it would follow that the subject would not be established.

original: 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs la srid pa snga ma'i 'chi ka'i sems ma grub pas de phyogs su bya ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol la skur pa 'debs pa'i phyogs la srid pa snga ma'i 'chi ka'i sems ma grub pas de phyogs su bya ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Since the position that denies the existence of other worlds is not established by the mind at the time of death in a previous existence, it is not tenable to take that as a position.

original: brtag pa spros pas chog go //
analyzed: brtag pa spros pas chog go //
translated: Enough with this elaboration of analysis.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde ba dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde ba dag gis smras pa /
translated: The VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas say:

original: gang zag ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rtag pa dang / mi rtag @165a * //
analyzed: gang zag ni phung po dang khams dang / skye mched rnams las de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du rtag pa dang / mi rtag @165a * //
translated: Just as the person is not described as the same as or different from the aggregates, elements, and bases, in the same way, it is also not described as permanent or impermanent.

original: pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon de dag kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
analyzed: pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon de dag kho bo cag la mi gnod de /
translated: Therefore the faults that you teach to both positions do not apply to us.

original: gang zag de lta bu de 'khor ro //
analyzed: gang zag de lta bu de 'khor ro //
translated: That kind of person cycles.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na //
analyzed: gal te gang zag 'khor zhe na //
translated: If you think the person cycles,

original: phung po skye mched khams rnams la //üîΩde ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
analyzed: phung po skye mched khams rnams la // de ni rnam pa lngas btsal na //
translated: then the person is not the aggregates, elements, and bases.üîΩIf you search for the person in five ways,

original: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: med na gang zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: then what cycles?

original: 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba kho na ste /
analyzed: 'khor bar mi 'gyur ba kho na ste /
translated: It is not that it cycles.

original: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: because it does not exist.

original: de ltar na de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar bzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos nye bar bzhag pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the statement of the probandum and the probative property.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gang zag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par gang zag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, the statement of the syllogism is: ultimately, the person does not exist,üîΩbecause its characteristics are not perceived apart from form, feeling, conception, formation, and consciousness, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf, although it does not exist, the person is imagined to exist due to the impairment of the intellect by the latent potential for attachment to it, like the perception of hair in the visual field by one with an eye disease, then in that case,üîΩif it is appropriated, it is not a self,

original: gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir dper na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa las ma gtogs pa'i mtshan nyid dmigs su med pa'i phyir dper na bong bu'i rva bzhin no //
translated: because it is appropriated, like appropriated form.üîΩIf it is not appropriated, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is not appropriated, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩIf it is not a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is not a self, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩIf it is not a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is not a self, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩIf it is not a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is not a self, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩIf it is not a self, it is not a self,

original: ci ste med bzhin du yang de la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pas rab rib can gyis skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa yod par mthong ba bzhin du de yod par rnam par rtog na de lta na yang /
analyzed: ci ste med bzhin du yang de la mngon par zhen pa'i bag chags kyis blo gros nyams pas rab rib can gyis skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa yod par mthong ba bzhin du de yod par rnam par rtog na de lta na yang /
translated: because it is not a self, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,

original: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
analyzed: nye bar len nas nyer len par //
translated: because it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.üîΩIf it is not a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is not a self, like the horn of an ass.üîΩIf it is a self, it is not a self,üîΩbecause it is a self, like the self of the tƒ´rthikas.

original: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'khor na srid pa med par 'gyur //
translated: If it is not a self, it is not a self,

original: nye bar len pa nas nye bar len par 'khor na nye bar len pa'i bar du nye bar len pa med cing nye bar len pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa nas nye bar len par 'khor na nye bar len pa'i bar du nye bar len pa med cing nye bar len pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one transmigrates from appropriation to appropriation, then appropriation would be without appropriation and would be free from appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa ni srid pa zhes gdags pas nye bar len pa med na srid pa de yang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar len pa ni srid pa zhes gdags pas nye bar len pa med na srid pa de yang med pa'i phyir //
translated: Since existence is designated as appropriation, if there is no appropriation, then existence would not exist.

original: srid med nye bar len med na //
analyzed: srid med nye bar len med na //
translated: If there is no existence and no appropriation,

original: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: what is it that transmigrates?

original: srid pa med pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa ni gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa med pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa ni gsal bar byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since existence and appropriation do not exist, there is no illumination.

original: gal te bar ma do'i srid pa'i phung po nye bar len pas nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bar ma do'i srid pa'i phung po nye bar len pas nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid du grub pa'i phyir skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because the aggregates of the intermediate state of existence are established as having appropriation since they appropriate,

original: kha cig na re /
analyzed: kha cig na re /
translated: then some say:

original: de yongs su gtong ba na ji skad smos pa'i skyon rjes su 'brang pa'i phyir de ni len du mi rung ngo zhes so //
analyzed: de yongs su gtong ba na ji skad smos pa'i skyon rjes su 'brang pa'i phyir de ni len du mi rung ngo zhes so //
translated: Since the error mentioned above would follow if they relinquished them, it is not tenable that they appropriate.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not correct.

original: skad cig ma gcig kho na la srid pa snga ma dang phyi ma gtong zhing len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma gcig kho na la srid pa snga ma dang phyi ma gtong zhing len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because in just one moment, one gives up the former existence and takes up the latter.

original: 'di ltar rnam pa lngas btsal na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar rigs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam pa lngas btsal na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de ltar rigs so //
translated: It is reasonable to say that it does not exist because it is not found in the five ways.

original: pha rol pos smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol pos smras pa /
translated: The opponent says:

original: gang zag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang zag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The person certainly exists,

original: nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas gnas pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'di na gang med pa de ni nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas mi gnas te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas gnas pa'i phyir ro // 'di na gang med pa de ni nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas mi gnas te /
translated: because it endures through the transference of appropriation.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no//
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no//
translated: Here, what does not exist does not endure through the transference of appropriation, just like the son of a barren woman.

original: @165b gang zag la ni nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas gnas pa 'di lta bu yod de /
analyzed: @165b gang zag la ni nye bar len pa gzhan du 'pho bas gnas pa 'di lta bu yod de /
translated: But the person does endure through the transference of appropriation.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe de'i dus na nga nyid nga las nur gyur to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe de'i dus na nga nyid nga las nur gyur to //
translated: As the BhagavƒÅn said, ‚ÄúAt that time, at that epoch, I was the merchant‚Äôs son Subh≈´ti.‚Äù

original: nga nyid legs mthong du gyur to zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: nga nyid legs mthong du gyur to zhes ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: And, ‚ÄúI myself became the perfectly awakened Buddha Vipa≈õyin.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus gang zag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus gang zag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the force of the reason stated, the person certainly exists.

original: 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir slob dpon gyis bshad pa /
translated: Here, the master explains:

original: nye bar len pas na nye bar len par 'khor na de srid pa snga phyir gdags pa'i gnas nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: nye bar len pas na nye bar len par 'khor na de srid pa snga phyir gdags pa'i gnas nye bar len pa dang ldan pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If it cycles due to appropriation, then it would not possess appropriation, which is the basis for designating prior and subsequent existences.

original: lhas byin khyim nas khyim gzhan du rgyu ba bzhin pas srid pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyim nas khyim gzhan du rgyu ba bzhin pas srid pa'i ngo bo nyid dang bral zhing srid pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it would be like Devadatta moving from one house to another house, it would be devoid of the entity of existence and would not exist.

original: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de de'i nye bar len pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de de'i nye bar len pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since it is not its entity, it would not appropriate it.

original: nye bar len pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would also not exist as appropriation.

original: khyed nye bar len pa gang dag nye bar len par 'dod pa de dag kyang des nye bar len par mi byed de /
analyzed: khyed nye bar len pa gang dag nye bar len par 'dod pa de dag kyang des nye bar len par mi byed de /
translated: Also, those appropriations that you assert to be appropriated would not appropriate it.üîΩSince it would be an appropriation, it would be like another appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa las de ltar /üîΩsrid med nye bar len pa na //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa'i nye bar len pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pa las de ltar / srid med nye bar len pa na //
translated: In this way, through inference,üîΩWithout existence, what is appropriated

original: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de gang ci zhig 'khor bar 'gyur //
translated: What cycles in samsara?

original: de ltar re zhig don dam par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang gang zag 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig don dam par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang gang zag 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, in the first place, it is untenable that formations, sentient beings, and persons ultimately cycle in samsara.üîΩNow, if nirvana existed, then some of those would go to nirvana.

original: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhig yod par gyur pa na yang de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur grang na /üîΩde la gal te don dam par 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na /üîΩ'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
analyzed: da ni mya ngan las 'das pa zhig yod par gyur pa na yang de dag las gang yang rung ba zhig mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur grang na / de la gal te don dam par 'du byed rnams mya ngan las 'da' bar 'dod na / 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
translated: If you assert that formations ultimately go to nirvana,

original: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do //üîΩdon dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang rtag pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir dang / don dam par mi rtag pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do // don dam par ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / tha snyad du yang rtag pa dag ma grub pa'i phyir dang / don dam par mi rtag pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad de /
translated: then it is not tenable in any wayüîΩthat formations go to nirvana.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not tenable that ultimately unarisen formations go to nirvana because they are not established as permanent conventionally and because it is not tenable that ultimately impermanent formations go to nirvana because they are impermanent.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like external earth and so on.

original: ji ste sems can mya ngan las 'da'o zhe na yang /
analyzed: ji ste sems can mya ngan las 'da'o zhe na yang /
translated: But if you say that sentient beings go to nirvana,üîΩthen it is not tenable in any way

original: sems can mya ngan 'da' bar yang //
analyzed: sems can mya ngan 'da' bar yang //
translated: that sentient beings go to nirvana.

original: ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur //üîΩrtag pa'am mi rtag par yongs su brtag pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'thad mi 'gyur // rtag pa'am mi rtag par yongs su brtag pa'o //
translated: It is not tenable in any way.üîΩThe examination of whether or not it is permanent.

original: de la re zhig rtag pa ni //
analyzed: de la re zhig rtag pa ni //
translated: First, it is not permanent,

original: mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: because it does not transcend suffering.

original: rgyu med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: It is like space, because it is without cause.

original: rgyu med pa ni yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu med pa ni yod pa nyid du ma grags pa'i phyir /
translated: That which is without cause is not renowned as existent,

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin pas rtag pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin pas rtag pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas /
translated: like the son of a barren woman. Therefore, because it is permanent and without cause,üîΩit is not attained.

original: thar pa mi thob pas de bsal ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa las /üîΩchos can gyi khyad par bstsal @166a * //
analyzed: thar pa mi thob pas de bsal ba'i phyir rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa las / chos can gyi khyad par bstsal @166a * //
translated: Therefore, in order to refute the assertion that it is permanent,

original: ba'i skyon yod do //üîΩmi rtag pa yang mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: ba'i skyon yod do // mi rtag pa yang mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: the fault of the distinction of the subject is stated.üîΩIt is also not impermanent, because it does not transcend suffering.

original: don dam par gang mi rtag pa de ni mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
analyzed: don dam par gang mi rtag pa de ni mya ngan las mi 'da' ste /
translated: Ultimately, that which is impermanent does not transcend suffering,

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi sa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is impermanent, like external earth and so on.

original: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas thar pa mi 'thob pas de bsal ba'i phyir sems can mi rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa la /
analyzed: 'dir yang mi rtag pa nyid du rjes su dpog pas thar pa mi 'thob pas de bsal ba'i phyir sems can mi rtag pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa la /
translated: Here, since one does not attain liberation by inferring impermanence, the fault of the thesis that sentient beings are impermanent is that

original: chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: the specific property of the subject is not established.

original: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag / gang zag ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas ji skad smos pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa grub bo zhes zer na /
analyzed: gnas ma bu'i sde pa dag / gang zag ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas ji skad smos pa'i skyon med pa'i phyir mya ngan las 'das pa grub bo zhes zer na /
translated: The VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´ya say: Since the person is not described as permanent or impermanent, the previously mentioned fault does not exist and nirvana is established.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /üîΩgang zag rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub tu zin na yang don dam par thar pa mi 'thad de /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te / gang zag rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa zhig rdzas su yod pa nyid du grub tu zin na yang don dam par thar pa mi 'thad de /
translated: That is not good.

original: brten te gdags pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brten te gdags pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it were established that the person exists substantially and is not described as permanent or impermanent, ultimate liberation is untenable because it is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, like a pot.üîΩIt is undermined by inference.

original: gang rdzas yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: gang rdzas yin pa de ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Whatever is substantial is impermanent.

original: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin pas rdzas nyid du rjes su dpog pas /üîΩmi rtag pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid kyis de dag tu brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin pas rdzas nyid du rjes su dpog pas / mi rtag pa nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid kyis de dag tu brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: For example, it is like form and so on.

original: rdzas su yod pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: rdzas su yod pa nyid du smra ba'i dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Since they are inferred to be substantial, they are not to be expressed as impermanent and expressible, because the fault of the distinction of the subject in the thesis that they substantially exist is eliminated.

original: gzhan yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi skad cig ma la gal te gang zag yod na ni rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan yang phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi skad cig ma la gal te gang zag yod na ni rtag pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, if the person exists in the instant of the dhƒÅtu of nirvƒÅ·πáa without remainder, the error of permanence would ensue.

original: gal te med na ni chad pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te med na ni chad pa nyid kyi skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it does not exist, the error of annihilation would ensue.

original: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin na ni dbu ma pa smra ba dang mthun par smra ba yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin na ni dbu ma pa smra ba dang mthun par smra ba yin no //
translated: If it is not to be expressed as existing or not existing, then it accords with the Madhyamaka‚Äôs statement.

original: gal te rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa dang med pa nyid du tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: gal te rnam par shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul gyi gzugs la sogs pa dag yod pa dang med pa nyid du tha snyad gdags par bya ba ma yin yang /
translated: If form, etc., which are the objects of non-conceptual consciousness, do not exist, then they cannot be designated as existent or non-existent.

original: dngos po yod pa nyid yin pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid yin pa bzhin te /
translated: But they are existent things.

original: de ltar yang //
analyzed: de ltar yang //
translated: As it is said:

original: thar la gal te bdag yod rtag / gal te med na mi rtag 'gyur //
analyzed: thar la gal te bdag yod rtag / gal te med na mi rtag 'gyur //
translated: If the self exists in liberation, it is permanent; if it does not exist, it is impermanent.

original: skyes bu brjod par bya min yang //üîΩmkhas pas shes par bya min min ;
analyzed: skyes bu brjod par bya min yang // mkhas pas shes par bya min min ;
translated: The person is not to be described asüîΩexistent or non-existent.

original: / zhes smras pa lta bu'o zhe na /
analyzed: / zhes smras pa lta bu'o zhe na /
translated: The wise do not know it as existent or non-existent.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not correct,

original: dngos po yod pa nyid yin na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa nyid yin na de nyid dang / gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas grub pa'i mtha' dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if things are existent, it follows that they are to be described as identical or different, and that contradicts our tenets.

original: don dam par gang zag gi blo 'di ni dngos po yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par gang zag gi blo 'di ni dngos po yod pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate, the mind of the person is not a subject that has an existent object,

original: blo yin pa'i phyir zhe @166b na ;
analyzed: blo yin pa'i phyir zhe @166b na ;
translated: because it is a mind.

original: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i blo bzhin pas gang zag dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dper na bum pa la sogs pa'i blo bzhin pas gang zag dngos po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the person is not established as a thing, like the cognition of a pot, etc.

original: don dam par de la thar pa med do //
analyzed: don dam par de la thar pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no liberation for it in the ultimate sense.

original: gal te gang zag ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te gang zag ni rdzas su yod pa yin te /
translated: If someone says that the person exists substantially,

original: rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is an object of cognition,

original: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na gzugs bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like form, for example,

original: de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni ri bong gi rva la sogs pa dag gis ma nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: that is not so, because it is not established by the horns of a rabbit, etc.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtag pa de dang mi mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba nyid kyang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dag med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir rtag pa de dang mi mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas /
translated: Also, because impermanence, etc., do not occur without it, the person is established as a phenomenon that is incompatible with permanence.

original: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is also contradictory in meaning.

original: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa dag las kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Some of our own schools say this:

original: 'du byed rgyu dang rkyen gcig nas gcig tu rgyun chags su 'jug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / thar pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba la gegs byed pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas bcings pa'i phyir bcings pa yang 'grub la /üîΩbcings pa rnams dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sogs pa las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba shar bas mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba na /
analyzed: 'du byed rgyu dang rkyen gcig nas gcig tu rgyun chags su 'jug pa 'dod chags la sogs pa dang lhan cig skyes pa rnams dang / thar pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba la gegs byed pa'i 'dod chags la sogs pas bcings pa'i phyir bcings pa yang 'grub la / bcings pa rnams dam pa'i chos mnyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la sogs pa las byung ba yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba shar bas mi shes pa'i mun pa bsal ba na /
translated: Since compounded phenomena arise in a continuous succession from one cause and condition to another, and since they are produced together with attachment and so on, and since they are bound by attachment and so on that obstruct liberation and going to the higher realms, bondage is also established.üîΩWhen the light of correct wisdom arises from listening to the sublime teaching, proper mental application and so on and the darkness of ignorance is dispelled, those who are bound are definitely freed from the bonds of attachment and so on.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las nges par 'grol ba'i phyir thar pa yang 'grub bo //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i 'ching ba las nges par 'grol ba'i phyir thar pa yang 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore liberation is also established.

original: de dag kyang 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i dus na rgyu'i skad cig ma 'jig pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag kyang 'bras bu'i skad cig ma skye ba'i dus na rgyu'i skad cig ma 'jig pa'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Since the moment of the effect arises at the time the moment of the cause ceases, they are also not permanent.

original: rgyu rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa yang ma yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: rgyu rtag pa'i phyir mi rtag pa yang ma yin pas phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Because the cause is permanent, it is also not impermanent. Therefore, the error that is taught in both positions does not exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
translated: Compounded phenomena that have the property of arising and ceasing

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: are not bound and are not liberated.

original: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang mtshungs par te /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba ni snga ma dang mtshungs par te /
translated: ‚ÄúAs before‚Äù means as in the previous verse.

original: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'du byed mi rtag pa rnams la 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa mi 'thad par sngar bstan pa bzhin du zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúAs before‚Äù means as it was previously explained that samsara and nirvana are untenable for impermanent compounded phenomena.

original: ji ltar der don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: ji ltar der don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams 'khor bar mi 'thad de /
translated: Just as it was explained there, how is it that ultimately internal compounded phenomena are not tenable in samsara?

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par mi rtag pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyi bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bya ba dang / don dam par mi rtag pa rnams ni mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'thad de /
translated: It is like an external vase, for example. And ultimately impermanent compounded phenomena are not tenable in nirvana.

original: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyis la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'du byed skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can rnams la bcings pa dang thar par mi 'thad do //üîΩde'i phyir sde pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'du byed rnams la yang don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa thams @167a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i phyir dper na phyi rol gyis la sogs pa bzhin no zhes bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang 'du byed skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can rnams la bcings pa dang thar par mi 'thad do // de'i phyir sde pa gzhan dag gis yongs su brtags pa'i 'du byed rnams la yang don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa rnam pa thams @167a * //
translated: In the same way, here also, it is not tenable that compounded phenomena, which are subject to arising and destruction, are bound or liberated.

original: cad du mi 'thad de /üîΩ'du byed skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'am dus gzhan du gnas pa'am /
analyzed: cad du mi 'thad de / 'du byed skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa'am dus gzhan du gnas pa'am /
translated: Therefore, in the ultimate sense, cyclic existence and nirvana are not tenable in any way for the compounded phenomena imagined by other schools.üîΩBecause compounded phenomena that are imagined to be destroyed in each instant, to endure for another instant,

original: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par brtags pa rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin par brtags pa rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or to be inexpressible as either permanent or impermanent are subject to arising and destruction.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
analyzed: yang na / skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams //
translated: Compounded phenomena that are subject to arising and destruction

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //
translated: are not bound and are not liberated.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'du byed nges par mi gnas pa rnams la bcings pa dang / thar pa'i mtshan nyid dus tha dad par myong bar 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'du byed nges par mi gnas pa rnams la bcings pa dang / thar pa'i mtshan nyid dus tha dad par myong bar 'gyur pa'i gnas skabs gzhan mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is because it is impossible for formations that definitely do not endure to have the characteristics of bondage and liberation, since it is impossible for them to experience another state at a different time.üîΩOr,

original: yang na / skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: yang na / skye 'jig chos can 'du byed rnams /
translated: Formations that possess the attributes of arising and destruction

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te //üîΩzhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa rnams ni zhig pa'i phyir dang / ma bcings pa rnams la ni thar pa skad cig ma phyi ma la 'byung bar 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi 'gyur te // zhes bya ba ni 'du byed 'dod chags la sogs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa rnams ni zhig pa'i phyir dang / ma bcings pa rnams la ni thar pa skad cig ma phyi ma la 'byung bar 'gyur ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ram /
translated: are not bound and are not liberated.

original: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because formations that arise simultaneously with attachment and so on are destroyed and it is untenable that those not bound are liberated in the second moment or because that is contradictory.

original: smras pa / mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: smras pa / mtshan nyid las /
translated: Objection: The Lak·π£a·πáƒÅvatƒÅra states:

original: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
translated: The mind of one beyond training arises

original: sgrib pa las ni rnam par grol //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni rnam par grol //üîΩzhes 'byung ngo //
translated: and is liberated from obscurations.

original: skye bzhin pa yang nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid la skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid la skyon de nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The error is the same for that now arising as afflicted or unafflicted.üîΩSince it is not even tenable that it is to be expressed, it is not tenable that it is afflicted or unafflicted.

original: brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa la yang nyon mongs par 'gyur ba bzhin pas nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa la yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir thar pa med do //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa la yang nyon mongs par 'gyur ba bzhin pas nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa nyid du brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa de bzhin du skye bzhin pa la yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir thar pa med do //
translated: In the same way, since that now arising is not even tenable as to be expressed, there is no liberation.

original: gal te rgyun la bcings pa dang thar pa yod pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rgyun la bcings pa dang thar pa yod pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: But if you think that since there is bondage and liberation in the continuum, there is no error,

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is illogical.

original: rgyun rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang / rgyun nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa dag la snga ma bzhin du thar bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / bcings pa dang /
analyzed: rgyun rdzas su med pa'i phyir dang / rgyun nyon mongs pa can dang / nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa dang / brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa dag la snga ma bzhin du thar bar mi 'grub pa'i phyir dang / bcings pa dang /
translated: Because the continuum does not exist as a substance, and because liberation is not established for the afflicted, unafflicted, and inexpressible continuums, as before.

original: thar pa dag tha snyad par 'dod pa ni dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa dag tha snyad par 'dod pa ni dam bcas pa nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The assertion that liberation is conventional is a violation of your own tenets.üîΩThe refutation of the bound sentient being and the one liberated should be applied

original: sems can bcings pa dang / thar pa smra ba la yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: sems can bcings pa dang / thar pa smra ba la yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: to the assertion that the sentient being is bound and liberated.

original: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du sems can yang //
translated: As before, the sentient being is

original: mi 'ching grol bar mi mi 'gyur ro //üîΩsnga ma bzhin du sems can yang mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: mi 'ching grol bar mi mi 'gyur ro // snga ma bzhin du sems can yang mi 'ching ste /
translated: not bound and is not liberated.

original: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i phyogs la skyon smos pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgrol bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i phyogs la skyon smos pa'i phyir ro // grol bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: As before, the sentient being is not bound because the error has been pointed out in the context of the positions of permanence and impermanence.

original: 'du byed rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la thar pa mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: 'du byed rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la thar pa mi 'thad par bstan pa bzhin no zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Nor is it liberated because, as has been shown, liberation is untenable for permanent and impermanent compounded phenomena.

original: sems can bcings pa dgag @167b pa sngar bstan pa dang / khyad par med du zin kyang rgol ba tha dad de sngar ni sems can bcings pa 'ba' zhig tu dam bcas pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can bcings pa dgag @167b pa sngar bstan pa dang / khyad par med du zin kyang rgol ba tha dad de sngar ni sems can bcings pa 'ba' zhig tu dam bcas pa bsal bar 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is no difference in the refutation of the bound sentient being as previously presented, the opponent is different because previously the thesis of the bound sentient being alone was to be refuted.

original: 'dir ni sems can bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyi gar dam bcas pa de dag dgag pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni sems can bcings pa dang / thar pa gnyi gar dam bcas pa de dag dgag pa 'dra bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, both the bondage and the liberation of sentient beings are refuted, and they are shown to be similar.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: sems can gyi nye bar len pa ni 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa ni 'ching ba yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi nye bar len pa ni 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa ni 'ching ba yin la /
translated: Since the appropriation of sentient beings is bondage, appropriation is bondage.

original: de gtan du nye bar zhi ba ni thar pa yin zhing rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de gtan du nye bar zhi ba ni thar pa yin zhing rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid du yang brjod par bya ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since its complete pacification is liberation, and since it is not to be described as permanent or impermanent,

original: 'du byed rnams dang sems can rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i phyogs su bstan pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas ji skad smos pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams dang sems can rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa'i phyogs su bstan pa'i skyon mi 'thad pas ji skad smos pa'i skyon med do //
translated: the error of teaching that formations and sentient beings are permanent or impermanent is not tenable. Therefore the previously mentioned error does not exist.

original: 'dir bshad pa /üîΩgal te nye bar len 'ching na //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te nye bar len 'ching na //
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf appropriation is bondage,

original: nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len bcas 'ching mi 'gyur //
translated: One who possesses appropriation is not bound.

original: gal te don dam par nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin na nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i nye bar len pa po lhas byin nye bar len pa gang gis nye bar len pa dang bcas par brjod pa de ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te don dam par nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin na nye bar len pa dang bcas pa'i nye bar len pa po lhas byin nye bar len pa gang gis nye bar len pa dang bcas par brjod pa de ni 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If appropriation were bondage in the ultimate, then the appropriator Devadatta who possesses appropriation would not be bound by that appropriation which he possesses.

original: yang na / gal te nye bar len 'ching na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te nye bar len 'ching na //
translated: Or, if appropriation were bondage,

original: nye bar len bcas grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: nye bar len bcas grol mi 'gyur //
translated: one who possesses appropriation would not be liberated.

original: zhes bya bar yang sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes bya bar yang sbyar te /
translated: This is also applied.

original: de dang ldan pa de grol bar mi 'dod de dgag pa mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩyang na don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa de nye bar mi len te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa de grol bar mi 'dod de dgag pa mi mthun pa'i phyir ro // yang na don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa de nye bar mi len te /
translated: One who possesses that is not asserted to be liberated, because of the incompatibility of negation.

original: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, in the ultimate, that appropriation of Devadatta does not appropriate because it is appropriation.

original: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the appropriation of Yaj√±a.

original: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: ci ste dam bcas pa de'i don gang yin /
translated: But what is the meaning of that thesis?

original: gal te nye bar len par byed pa'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de de'i 'ching ba ma yin no zhe na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te nye bar len par byed pa'i nye bar len pa gang yin pa de de'i 'ching ba ma yin no zhe na ni dpe med de /
translated: If it is said that that which is the appropriation of the appropriator is not its bondage, then there is no example.

original: mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa 'ching ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appropriated aggregates of a sacrifice are the bonds of Devadatta.

original: ci ste 'ching ba gzhan zhig yod do zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste 'ching ba gzhan zhig yod do zhe na ni phyogs snga ma la gnod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is another bondage, then the former position is undermined.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not correct,

original: mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa lhas byin gyi 'ching ba nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa lhas byin gyi 'ching ba nyid du ma grub pa nyid dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir dpe med pa yang ma yin la /
translated: because the appropriated aggregates of a sacrifice are not established as the bonds of Devadatta, and because the example is accepted, it is not the case that there is no example.

original: de las gzhan pa'i 'ching ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med do ;
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i 'ching ba khas ma blangs pa'i phyir phyogs snga ma la gnod pa yang med do ;
translated: And because another bondage is not accepted, the former position is not undermined.

original: / don dam par lhas byin gyi rang gi nye bar len pa 'di ni nye bar len pa ma yin te /
analyzed: / don dam par lhas byin gyi rang gi nye bar len pa 'di ni nye bar len pa ma yin te /
translated: Ultimately, Devadatta‚Äôs own appropriated aggregates are not appropriated,

original: brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod pa khyad par can bsten pa la ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid yin pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
translated: because they depend on the use of special terminology, like the appropriated aggregates of a sacrifice.

original: 'di ltar nye bar len pa med pa yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas nye bar len med mi 'ching ste /üîΩnye bar len pa med @168a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar nye bar len pa med pa yang yod pa nyid du ma grub pas nye bar len med mi 'ching ste / nye bar len pa med @168a * //
translated: Thus, since one who is without appropriation does not exist, one who is without appropriation is not bound.

original: pa yang 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa yang 'ching bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: One who is without appropriation does not become bound.

original: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs ma gtogs par gnas skabs gzhan med pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: nye bar len pa dang bcas pa dang / nye bar len pa med pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnas skabs ma gtogs par gnas skabs gzhan med pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no condition apart from the condition of one who has appropriation and the condition of one who is without appropriation,

original: gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas skabs gang zhig 'ching bar 'gyur //
translated: then what condition would be bound?

original: zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'ching ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: 'ching ba med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don to //
translated: The meaning of the sentence is that there is no bondage.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: sems can bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: sems can bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The bound sentient being exists,

original: de'i 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pa 'ching ba yod na des bcing bar bya ba yang yod pa bzhin pas 'ching ba nye bar len pa 'di yod pas /
analyzed: de'i 'ching ba yod pa'i phyir dper na lcags sgrog la sogs pa 'ching ba yod na des bcing bar bya ba yang yod pa bzhin pas 'ching ba nye bar len pa 'di yod pas /
translated: because its bondage exists, just as, for example, that which is bound exists when there is bondage by iron fetters, etc. Since this appropriation is bondage,

original: de'i phyir sems can bcings pa yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can bcings pa yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: therefore the bound sentient being exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, it is explained:

original: khyod 'dod pa ltar /üîΩgal te bcings pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: khyod 'dod pa ltar / gal te bcings pa'i snga rol na //
translated: If, as you assert,üîΩThe bound one existed prior to being bound,üîΩThen bondage would be tenable.

original: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de bcings pa'i snga rol na 'ching ba de yang med de /
analyzed: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de bcings pa'i snga rol na 'ching ba de yang med de /
translated: But that does not exist. Prior to being bound, that bondage does not exist.

original: 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i chos dus tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i chos dus tha dad pa ma yin pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that the appropriated and the appropriator are not different in time.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa ni lhas byin gyi 'ching ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa ni lhas byin gyi 'ching ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the inference is this: Ultimately, the appropriated aggregates are not the bondage of Devadatta,

original: dus mnyam pa'i phyir dper na lhas byin gyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dus mnyam pa'i phyir dper na lhas byin gyi rang gi bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: because they are simultaneous, just like Devadatta‚Äôs own self.

original: yang na / gal te bcings pa'i snga rol na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te bcings pa'i snga rol na //
translated: Again, if the bound one existed prior to being bound,üîΩthen bondage would be tenable.

original: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de bcings pa'i snga rol na 'ching ba de yang med de /
analyzed: 'ching ba yod na 'ching la rag / de yang med de bcings pa'i snga rol na 'ching ba de yang med de /
translated: But that does not exist. Prior to being bound, that bondage does not exist.

original: 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i chos snga na med pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni nye bar len pa'i chos snga na med pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This demonstrates that the appropriated aggregates do not exist prior to the appropriator.

original: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par lhas byin gyi nye bar len pa ni /
translated: Therefore, the inference is this: Ultimately, the appropriated aggregates are not the bondage of Devadatta,üîΩbecause they are simultaneous, just like Devadatta‚Äôs own self.

original: lhas byin gyi 'ching ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lhas byin gyi 'ching ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not the fettered state of Devadatta,

original: snga na med pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
analyzed: snga na med pa'i phyir dper na mchod sbyin gyi nye bar len pa bzhin no //
translated: because it does not exist prior to the fettered state, just as the appropriation of a sacrifice does not exist prior to the sacrifice.

original: lhag ma ni /
analyzed: lhag ma ni /
translated: The remainder

original: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan //
analyzed: song dang ma song bgom pas bstan //
translated: are shown by the gone, not-gone, and that being gone over.

original: ci zhig bstan ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig bstan ce na /
translated: What is shown?

original: bcings pa mi 'thad par sgrub pa lhag ma dag ste /
analyzed: bcings pa mi 'thad par sgrub pa lhag ma dag ste /
translated: The remainder of the proof that bondage is untenable.

original: ji ltar der song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag la 'gro ba mi 'thad par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcings pa ni mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: ji ltar der song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag la 'gro ba mi 'thad par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcings pa ni mi 'ching ste /
translated: Just as it has been shown that going is untenable with respect to that over which one has gone, that over which one has not yet gone, and that over which one is going, so here also it is shown that that which is bound is not bound,

original: bcings zin pa'i phyir dper na bcings pa la yang 'ching ba don med pa'am /
analyzed: bcings zin pa'i phyir dper na bcings pa la yang 'ching ba don med pa'am /
translated: because it is already bound, just as it is pointless for that which is already bound to be bound again,

original: bcings zin par the tshom med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bcings zin par the tshom med pa bzhin no //
translated: or just as there is no doubt that it is already bound.

original: ma bcings pa yang mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: ma bcings pa yang mi 'ching ste /
translated: That which is not bound is not bound,

original: bcings pa bsal ba'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bcings pa bsal ba'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is devoid of bondage, just as liberation is.

original: 'ching bzhin pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa yang mi 'ching ste /
analyzed: 'ching bzhin pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa yang mi 'ching ste /
translated: That which is in the process of being bound and that which is inexpressible are also not bound.

original: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pa la 'ching @168b ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pa la 'ching @168b ba mi 'thad pa bzhin no //
translated: Because both errors would ensue, and because it is inexpressible, just as it is untenable that liberation is bound.

original: ji ltar der song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcings pa dang / ma bcings pa dang / 'ching bzhin pa dag la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med do //
analyzed: ji ltar der song ba dang / ma song ba dang / bgom pa dag la 'gro ba'i rtsom pa med par bstan pa de bzhin du 'dir yang bcings pa dang / ma bcings pa dang / 'ching bzhin pa dag la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med do //
translated: Just as it has been demonstrated that the beginning of going does not exist for one who has gone, for one who has not gone, or for one who is going, so too here, the beginning of bondage does not exist for one who is bound, for one who is not bound, or for one who is being bound.

original: bcings pa la ni 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
analyzed: bcings pa la ni 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
translated: For one who is bound, the beginning of bondage does not exist.

original: bcings zin pa'i phyir dper na bcings nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bcings zin pa'i phyir dper na bcings nas yun ring du lon pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is already bound, just like one who has been bound for a long time.

original: ma bcings pa la yang 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
analyzed: ma bcings pa la yang 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
translated: For one who is not bound, the beginning of bondage does not exist.

original: ma bcings pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bcings pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin no //
translated: Because he is not bound, just like liberation.

original: 'ching bzhin pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
analyzed: 'ching bzhin pa dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med de /
translated: For one who is being bound, and for one who is inexpressible, the beginning of bondage does not exist.

original: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skyon gnyi gar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na thar pa bzhin pa la 'ching ba'i rtsom pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: Because both errors would ensue, and because it is inexpressible, like liberation.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúBondage surely exists,

original: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its antidote exists.‚Äù

original: shes pa'i gnyen po mi shes pa bzhin du bcings pa'i gnyen po thar pa yod pas de'i phyir bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: shes pa'i gnyen po mi shes pa bzhin du bcings pa'i gnyen po thar pa yod pas de'i phyir bcings pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Just as there is ignorance as the antidote to knowledge, since liberation exists as the antidote to bondage, therefore bondage surely exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩIf liberation existed ultimately,

original: don dam par thar pa yang yod par gyur na bcings pa'am /
analyzed: don dam par thar pa yang yod par gyur na bcings pa'am /
translated: then one who is bound,

original: ma bcings pa'am /
analyzed: ma bcings pa'am /
translated: or one who is not bound,

original: grol bzhin pa zhig thar par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: grol bzhin pa zhig thar par 'gyur grang na /
translated: or one who is being liberated would be liberated.

original: de la re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol te /
analyzed: de la re zhig bcings pa mi 'grol te /
translated: First, one who is bound is not liberated,

original: 'di ltar bcings pa zhes bya ba ni /üîΩ'ching ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcings pa zhes bya ba ni / 'ching ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa ste /
translated: because one who is called ‚Äúbound‚ÄùüîΩhas not generated the antidote to bondage.

original: de yang 'ching ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir mi 'grol te /
analyzed: de yang 'ching ba'i gnyen po ma skyes pa'i phyir mi 'grol te /
translated: Moreover, one who is bound is not liberated because the antidote to bondage has not arisen.

original: dper na nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nyon mongs pa'i 'ching ba mtha' dag dang ldan pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like someone who is bound by all the bonds of affliction.

original: ma bcings pa yang grol mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ma bcings pa yang grol mi 'gyur //
translated: One who is not bound is not liberated.

original: bcings pa dang bral ba'i grol ba nyid la ni tha snyad du yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcings pa dang bral ba'i grol ba nyid la ni tha snyad du yang de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation, which is the separation of the bound, does not exist even conventionally.

original: ci ste mtshan nyid las /
analyzed: ci ste mtshan nyid las /
translated: But if you think that since the Lak·π£a·πáƒÅnusƒÅri·πáƒ´ says,

original: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
analyzed: mi slob sems ni skye bzhin pa //
translated: The mind of one who is not a learner arises

original: sgrib pa las ni rnam par grol //üîΩzhes 'byung bas /üîΩ'grol bzhin pa thar bar 'gyur snyam na /
analyzed: sgrib pa las ni rnam par grol // zhes 'byung bas / 'grol bzhin pa thar bar 'gyur snyam na /
translated: liberated from obscurations,üîΩthen liberation is in the process of arising.

original: grol bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: grol bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But we would say that what is called ‚Äúin the process of arising‚Äù is what?

original: gal te bcings pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bcings pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say it is bound,

original: bcings pa grol bzhin yin gyur na //
analyzed: bcings pa grol bzhin yin gyur na //
translated: If the bound one were in the process of being liberated,

original: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings dang grol ba dus gcig 'gyur //
translated: the bound and the liberated would be simultaneous.

original: 'ching ba gang gis bcings pa zhes bya ba dang / thar pa gang gis grol ba zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig tu 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: 'ching ba gang gis bcings pa zhes bya ba dang / thar pa gang gis grol ba zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig tu 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: Since the one who is bound by whatever bondage is called ‚Äúbound‚Äù and the one liberated by whatever liberation is called ‚Äúliberated,‚Äù those two would be simultaneous. But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir de ni bcings pa nyid dam thar pa nyid gcig yin par gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni bcings pa nyid dam thar pa nyid gcig yin par gdon mi za bar bsgrub par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, it is definitely necessary to establish whether it is bound or liberated.

original: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir lan cung zad ma thebs so //
analyzed: de lta yin na rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pa dag gis gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir lan cung zad ma thebs so //
translated: Since that is the case, since it is harmed by the previously explained inferences, he has not offered any response at all.

original: skye bzhin pa yang @169a * //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang @169a * //
translated: Moreover, that which is in the process of arising

original: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'am /
analyzed: skyes pa dang ma skyes pa'am /
translated: is either arisen or not arisen,

original: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: bcings pa dang ma bcings pa nyid yin pas /
translated: bound or liberated,

original: ji skad smos pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: so the previously mentioned faults are not averted.

original: gal te skye bzhin pa ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa yin no zhen yang /
analyzed: gal te skye bzhin pa ni skye ba la mngon par phyogs pa yin no zhen yang /
translated: If you say that that which is in the process of arising is that which is approaching arising,

original: rta bcing ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon ldog pa med do //üîΩgal te sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la ltos nas /
analyzed: rta bcing ba lta bu yin pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ji skad smos pa'i skyon ldog pa med do // gal te sems kyi skad cig ma snga ma la ltos nas /
translated: then, because it would be like a horse and its bridle, and because the same analysis applies, the previously mentioned faults cannot be averted.

original: mi slob pa'i sems rnam phar grol bar rtog na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slob pa'i sems rnam phar grol bar rtog na de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If you imagine that the mind of a nonlearner is liberated from the mind of the prior moment, that is illogical.

original: bcings pa dang / thar pa dag tha snyad pa nyid du grub pas /
analyzed: bcings pa dang / thar pa dag tha snyad pa nyid du grub pas /
translated: Because bondage and liberation are established as mere conventions.

original: 'dod pa'i don nyams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i don nyams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the thesis is undermined,

original: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par thar pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / thar pa bzhin du shes pa'i gnyen po mi shes pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang pa'i skyon yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar don dam par thar pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir gnyen po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dang / thar pa bzhin du shes pa'i gnyen po mi shes pa ma grub pas dpe med pa'i phyir sgrub pa dpe ma tshang pa'i skyon yang yod do //
translated: the reason ‚Äúbecause an antidote exists‚Äù is not established, and since ignorance, the antidote to knowledge, is not established, as liberation is, the example is not established. Thus the proof is faulty because the example is incomplete.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: don dam par thar pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par thar pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Liberation definitely exists ultimately,

original: de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because those who desire it aspire to it.

original: 'di na gang don dam par med pa de la ni de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang don dam par med pa de la ni de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa med de /
translated: In this regard, those who desire it do not aspire to that which does not exist ultimately,

original: dper na chu sbrul gyi mgo'i nor bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na chu sbrul gyi mgo'i nor bu bzhin no //
translated: like the crest jewel on a water snake.

original: thar pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bdag bud shing zad pa'i me bzhin du nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur na ci ma rung /
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa rnams la ni bdag bud shing zad pa'i me bzhin du nye bar len pa med par mya ngan las 'da' bar gyur na ci ma rung /
translated: But those who desire liberation think, ‚ÄúOh, that I might attain nirvana without appropriation, like a fire without fuel!

original: mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir gyur na ci ma rung snyam du smon pa yod pas /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa bdag gir gyur na ci ma rung snyam du smon pa yod pas /
translated: Oh, that nirvana might be mine!‚Äù

original: de'i phyir don dam par thar pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par thar pa ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, liberation definitely exists ultimately.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
analyzed: bdag ni len med mya ngan 'da' //
translated: ‚ÄúI will attain nirvana without appropriation,

original: myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces //
analyzed: myang 'das bdag gir gyur cig ces //
translated: and nirvana will be mine!‚ÄùüîΩThose who grasp in this way

original: gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi / nyer len legs par zin ma yin //
analyzed: gang dag 'dzin pa de dag gi / nyer len legs par zin ma yin //
translated: do not properly grasp appropriation.
