original: thar pa 'dod pa gang dag bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa de dag gi nye bar len pa ni legs par zin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: thar pa 'dod pa gang dag bdag dang bdag gir dmigs pa legs par zin pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa de dag gi nye bar len pa ni legs par zin pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who desire liberation but engage in what is not properly grasped, such as observing a self and mine, do not properly grasp appropriation.

original: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mchog tu bzung zhing /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa'i tshul gyis mchog tu bzung zhing /
translated: Because they hold the view that the self and mine are supreme,

original: gnas pa ni thar pa'i bgegs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: gnas pa ni thar pa'i bgegs yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: and that is an obstacle to liberation.

original: yang na nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid la nye bar len pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa ni yul da la log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir nye bar len pa ni legs par zin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na nye bar len pa med pa'i ngo bo nyid la nye bar len pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa ni yul da la log pa'i shes pa skye ba'i phyir nye bar len pa ni legs par zin pa ma yin no //
translated: Or else, the apprehension of the nature of the aggregates as the self is the arising of a consciousness that is mistaken with respect to its object. Therefore, the apprehension of the aggregates is not correct.

original: yang na nye bar zhi ba nyid thar pa yin pas de gang gi yang ma yin pa la gang nye bar len pa med par gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa de'i nye bar len pa ni /
analyzed: yang na nye bar zhi ba nyid thar pa yin pas de gang gi yang ma yin pa la gang nye bar len pa med par gyur na ci ma rung snyam pa de'i nye bar len pa ni /
translated: Or else, since peace itself is liberation, the one who thinks, ‚ÄúHow good it would be if anyone were without appropriation‚Äù has an appropriation

original: legs par zin pa @169b ma yin pas /
analyzed: legs par zin pa @169b ma yin pas /
translated: that is not correct.

original: de'i phyir de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir de 'dod pa rnams la smon pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, the reason, ‚Äúbecause of the desire for those,‚Äù is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid yin no //
translated: Or else, it is contradictory.

original: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na don dam par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang gang zag la bcings pa dang / thar pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar brtags na don dam par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang gang zag la bcings pa dang / thar pa mi 'thad par bsgrub pa bstan pa'i dbang gis mjug bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, when this is analyzed, the conclusion is that, ultimately, the bondage and liberation of compounded phenomena, sentient beings, and persons are not tenable. This is demonstrated by the power of the proof statements.

original: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
analyzed: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
translated: Nirvana is not generated.

original: 'khor ba bstsal ba'ang yod min pas //
analyzed: 'khor ba bstsal ba'ang yod min pas //
translated: Nor is samsara eliminated.

original: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
translated: What is samsara here?üîΩWhat is nirvana?

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ci zhes brtag /'di la don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las pa'i chos nyid nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ci zhes brtag /'di la don dam par 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las pa'i chos nyid nam mkha' bzhin du mtshan nyid gcig pa nyid kyis khyad par med pa dag ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi spyod yul yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: In this regard, ultimately, samsara and nirvana are not different, since they are of a single characteristic, like space, and are the domain of nonconceptual wisdom.

original: bskyed pa med pa dang / dbri ba med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bskyed pa med pa dang / dbri ba med pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since they are not generated and are not diminished,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin yang rdzas nyid dang / rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgro gdags su yang med la /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa phan 'dogs par byed pa nyid yin yang rdzas nyid dang / rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i rnam pas mya ngan las 'das pa sgro gdags su yang med la /
translated: even though nirvana benefits, nirvana is not imputed in terms of substance, permanence, and so on.

original: 'khor ba gnod pa byed pa nyid yin yang bsal bar byar med pas /
analyzed: 'khor ba gnod pa byed pa nyid yin yang bsal bar byar med pas /
translated: And even though samsara harms, it is not to be eliminated.

original: de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa ni shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das par rnam par rtog pa ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur pa 'debs pa ni shes pa rnam par rtog pa'i dbang gis dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: The passage means that superimposition and denial are objects of conceptual consciousness and

original: dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po ni bskyed pa dang / dbri ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba'i yul gyi dngos po ni bskyed pa dang / dbri ba'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: that objects of conceptual consciousness are phenomena that can be increased or decreased.

original: yang na kun rdzob kyi phyogs la gdul ba'i skye bo rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yang na kun rdzob kyi phyogs la gdul ba'i skye bo rnams mya ngan las 'das pa la nye bar 'dun par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Alternatively, in the context of the relative, in order to encourage beings to be interested in nirvana,üîΩthe Buddha said, ‚ÄúNirvana, which has the characteristic of the complete pacification of afflictions, exists.‚Äù

original: mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid zhi ba yod do zhes ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed skye ba med pa tsam la rtog pas sgro 'dogs par byed cing /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i mtshan nyid zhi ba yod do zhes ma 'ongs pa'i 'du byed skye ba med pa tsam la rtog pas sgro 'dogs par byed cing /
translated: However, some people superimpose the nonexistence of future formations, which is mere nonarising, onto nirvana.

original: 'khor ba la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'khor ba sdug bsngal mang po ldan pa /
analyzed: 'khor ba la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir 'khor ba sdug bsngal mang po ldan pa /
translated: In order to generate disgust with cyclic existence, the Buddha taught that cyclic existence is endowed with many sufferings,

original: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i ngo bo nyid thog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pas bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'du byed kyi sgrar brjod pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes bsal ba bstan par zad kyi /
analyzed: rmi lam dang / mig 'phrul dang / chu zla dang / smig rgyu lta bu'i ngo bo nyid thog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pas bskyed pa'i bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'du byed kyi sgrar brjod pa rnams spang bar bya'o zhes bsal ba bstan par zad kyi /
translated: and that compounded phenomena, which are the things that are produced by the continuum of conditions since beginningless time, are like dreams, illusions, the moon in water, and mirages. He taught that they should be abandoned.

original: don dam par ni 'du byed ma grub pa'i phyir gang gi skye ba med pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid med pas mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed du yang med la /üîΩ'du @170a * //
analyzed: don dam par ni 'du byed ma grub pa'i phyir gang gi skye ba med pa mya ngan las 'das pa yin no zhes bya ba de nyid med pas mya ngan las 'das pa bskyed du yang med la / 'du @170a * //
translated: But ultimately, since compounded phenomena are not established, nirvana is not produced, since it is the nonarising of that which does not exist.

original: byed ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du zhi ba nyid yin pa la bsal ba mi 'thad pas 'khor ba bsal ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: byed ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa rnams mya ngan las 'das pa bzhin du zhi ba nyid yin pa la bsal ba mi 'thad pas 'khor ba bsal ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since compounded phenomena, which are not inherently arisen, are just as peaceful as nirvana, it is not tenable that they are cleared away. Therefore cyclic existence is not cleared away.

original: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa rab tu dben pa ro gcig pa /
analyzed: de ltar don dam par chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i mtshan nyid gnyis su med pa rab tu dben pa ro gcig pa /
translated: Thus, in the ultimate, all phenomena are non-dual, isolated, and of one taste in the characteristic of non-production.

original: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
analyzed: gang la mya ngan 'das bskyed med //
translated: There is no nirvana that is produced.

original: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba bsal ba'ang yod min pa //
translated: Nor is there any samsara that is eliminated.

original: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba ci zhig yin //
translated: What, then, is samsara?

original: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ji zhes brtag ste /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'ang ji zhes brtag ste /
translated: What, then, is nirvana?

original: rtogs par bya ba la tha dad pa med pas blo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yul de la tha dad par rtog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rtogs par bya ba la tha dad pa med pas blo tha dad pa med pa'i phyir yul de la tha dad par rtog pa mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Since there is no difference in what is to be realized, there is no difference in the mind. Therefore, it is not tenable to conceive of a difference in the object. This is the intended meaning.

original: de'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, the opponent‚Äôs argument in the first chapter that ultimately internal things have an intrinsic reality because

original: de dag la bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de dag la bcings pa dang / thar pa yod pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: their bondage and liberation exist is a reason that does not establish its object.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos bsgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni pha rol pos bsgrub pa smras pa'i skyon brjod pas 'khor ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of the chapter is to demonstrate that cyclic existence and nirvana are essenceless by pointing out the faults of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba spong bar yang mi mdzad la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par yang mi mdzad mod kyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs kyi bu de lta bas na bcom ldan 'das ni 'khor ba spong bar yang mi mdzad la mya ngan las 'das pa thob par yang mi mdzad mod kyi /
translated: Therefore, O child of good lineage, the Bhagavat does not abandon cyclic existence and does not attain nirvana.

original: 'on kyang 'khor ba las yang dag par bzla ba gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'khor ba las yang dag par bzla ba gsungs te /
translated: However, he does teach the transcendence of cyclic existence.

original: 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba yang med la /
analyzed: 'di la 'ga' yang 'khor ba las yang dag par 'da' ba yang med la /
translated: In this regard, there is no one who transcends cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su 'thob pa yang med do //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa rjes su 'thob pa yang med do //
translated: and there is no one who attains nirvana.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar mnyam pa nyid la 'khor ba yang med /
analyzed: 'di ltar mnyam pa nyid la 'khor ba yang med /
translated: Because in sameness, there is no cyclic existence,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang med /
translated: and there is no nirvana.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa yang med /
translated: There is no affliction,üîΩand there is no purification.

original: rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la 'khor ba'am 'khor ba'i chos can med do //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / de bzhin du rab kyi rtsal gyis rnam par gnon pa gzugs la 'khor ba'am 'khor ba'i chos can med do //
translated: And similarly, Subh≈´ti, there is no form that is a sa·πÉsƒÅra or has the quality of sa·πÉsƒÅra.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'khor ba'am 'khor ba'i chos can med do //üîΩgzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'khor ba'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'khor ba'am 'khor ba'i chos can med do // gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'khor ba'am /
translated: Similarly, there is no feeling, no perception, no volitional factors, and no consciousness that is a sa·πÉsƒÅra or has the quality of sa·πÉsƒÅra.üîΩThe absence of form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, and consciousness that is a sa·πÉsƒÅra or has the quality of sa·πÉsƒÅra is the perfection of wisdom.

original: 'khor ba'i chos can dag med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ngas 'khor ba yang ma dmigs /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i chos can dag med pa gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa dang / de bzhin du tshangs pa ngas 'khor ba yang ma dmigs /
translated: And similarly, BrahmƒÅ, I do not apprehend sa·πÉsƒÅra,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs so //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa yang ma dmigs so //
translated: nor do I apprehend nirvƒÅ·πáa.

original: @170b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: @170b de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'khor ba 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang 'khor bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: The TathƒÅgata designates ‚Äúsa·πÉsƒÅra,‚Äù but no one at all cycles in it.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //üîΩslob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mya ngan las 'das pa 'dogs par mdzad kyang der 'ga' yang mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no // slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: The TathƒÅgata designates ‚ÄúnirvƒÅ·πáa,‚Äù but no one at all attains nirvƒÅ·πáa.‚ÄùüîΩThe master BhƒÅviveka‚Äôs

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Root Verses on the Middle Way,

original: bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bcings pa dang thar pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: is called ‚ÄúExamination of Bondage and Liberation.‚Äù

original: rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu drug pa'o /
translated: This is the sixteenth chapter.

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma /
translated: Lamp of Wisdom, a Commentary on the Root Verses of the Middle Way

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: PART 12

original: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa brtsam mo //
analyzed: da ni de bzhin du stong pa nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi khyad par dgag pa las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa brtsam mo //
translated: Now, in the same way, the seventeenth chapter is begun for the sake of the meaning of the teaching of the unreality of action and result, by way of the refutation of the special adverse side of emptiness.

original: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang / gang zag 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: rab tu byed pa 'das ma thag par 'du byed rnams dang / sems can dang / gang zag 'khor bar mi 'thad do //
translated: In the immediately preceding chapter, it was shown that the cyclic life of formations, of sentient beings, and of persons is not tenable.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dir pha rol po dag gis bstan bcos mdzad pas dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'dir pha rol po dag gis bstan bcos mdzad pas dam bcas pa'i don sgro btags nas smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, here the opponents, having exaggerated the meaning of the treatise‚Äôs thesis, say:

original: khyod kyis 'du byed rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
analyzed: khyod kyis 'du byed rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa rnams la 'khor ba mi 'thad de /
translated: ‚ÄúYou have said that the cyclic life of permanent and impermanent formations is not tenable,

original: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas ni /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes smras pas ni /
translated: because the errors of eternalism and nihilism would ensue.

original: 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
analyzed: 'du byed mya ngan 'da' bar ni //
translated: But it is not tenable that formations are liberated from suffering,

original: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: ji lta bur yang mi 'thad do ;
translated: in any way whatsoever.

original: / zhes bstan pa yin pas /
analyzed: / zhes bstan pa yin pas /
translated: Thus, it is shown.

original: de'i phyir 'dir ji ltar rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir ji ltar rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, here, we will establish how the error of eternalism and nihilism is not committed,

original: 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yang yod pa de ltar bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yang yod pa de ltar bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: and how cyclic existence exists for compounded phenomena.

original: don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, only internal compounded phenomena have cyclic existence.

original: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is a connection between karma and its effects.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ma mthong ste /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ma mthong ste /
translated: Here, we do not see a connection between karma and its effects for that which does not exist.

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba'i 'du byed rnams bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu zhes bya ba'i 'du byed rnams bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like compounded phenomena called the son of a barren woman.

original: nang gi 'du byed rnams la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: nang gi 'du byed rnams la ni las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Since there is a connection between karma and its effects for internal compounded phenomena, therefore, by the power of the reason stated, in reality, only internal compounded phenomena have cyclic existence.

original: de la re zhig las ni /
analyzed: de la re zhig las ni /
translated: Here, first, karma is:

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs byams sems gang //
translated: The restraint of one‚Äôs own self, and the altruistic mind of love.

original: de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: de chos de ni 'di gzhan du //
translated: That is Dharma, here and in the next world.

original: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag gi sa bon yin //
translated: The seed of the fruits.

original: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yang dag par sdom par byed cing mi dge ba las ldog par byed pa ste /üîΩmi dge ba spong @171a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid legs par sdom pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid yang dag par sdom par byed cing mi dge ba las ldog par byed pa ste / mi dge ba spong @171a * //
translated: The phrase one who is well-controlled means one who is self-controlled and who turns away from evil.

original: ba'i sems pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ba'i sems pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one who has a mind that is set on abandoning evil means one who has a mind that is set on the avoidance of evil.

original: gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la phan 'dogs par zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang snyan par smra ba dang / 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob pa la sogs pa gzhan dag la phan 'dogs par byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who is helpful to others means one who helps others by means of generosity, kind words, and assistance, as well as by sharing in the joys and sorrows of others.

original: byams pa zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes las 'byung bas byams pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya ba ni mdza' bshes las 'byung bas byams pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who is loving means one who is friendly.

original: yang na byams pa nyid byams pa ste /
analyzed: yang na byams pa nyid byams pa ste /
translated: Alternatively, the term loving means one who is loving.

original: bdag gi don la de dang mthun pa'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag gi don la de dang mthun pa'i rkyen brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term loving is used to express a condition that is favorable to one's own welfare.

original: de lta bu'i sems pa gang yin pa de chos yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sems pa gang yin pa de chos yin no //
translated: The phrase one who has a mind that is set on these qualities means one who has a mind that is set on these qualities.

original: de ni sa bon yin te /
analyzed: de ni sa bon yin te /
translated: The phrase the seed of the fruits means the seed of the fruits of generosity, etc.

original: rgyu dang rkyen ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase the cause and condition means the cause and condition.

original: gang dag gi zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhe na /
translated: The result of the wholesome is threefold:üîΩthe result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.

original: 'bras bu dag gi'o //üîΩgang du zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu dag gi'o // gang du zhe na /
translated: The result of the unwholesome is the opposite.üîΩThe result of the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.

original: 'di dang gzhan du ste /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du ste /
translated: The result of the neutral is twofold:

original: tshe 'di dang gzhan dag tu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen dbang gis so //üîΩsems pa ni sa bon nyid du gsungs te /
analyzed: tshe 'di dang gzhan dag tu myong bar 'gyur ba'i rkyen dbang gis so // sems pa ni sa bon nyid du gsungs te /
translated: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.üîΩThe result of the wholesome and the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.

original: lus dang ngag gi las dag kun nas slong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi las dag kun nas slong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result of the neutral is twofold: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.üîΩThe result of the wholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.

original: chos las bzlog pas chos ma yin te /
analyzed: chos las bzlog pas chos ma yin te /
translated: The result of the unwholesome is the opposite.üîΩThe result of the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the neutral is twofold: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.

original: chos ma yin pa dang / sdig pa dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa dang / sdig pa dang / mi dge ba zhes bya ba dag ni rnam grangs so //
translated: The result of the wholesome and the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the neutral is twofold: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.üîΩThe result of the wholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.

original: chos ma yin pa las bzlog pas chos kyi rnam grangs dag go //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa las bzlog pas chos kyi rnam grangs dag go //
translated: The result of the unwholesome is the opposite.üîΩThe result of the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the neutral is twofold: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.üîΩThe result of the wholesome and the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the neutral is twofold: the result of human action and the result of natural outcome.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa dang / spyod lam las byung ba dang / bzo'i gnas las byung ba dang / sprul pa byed pa las byung ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The result of the wholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the unwholesome is the opposite.üîΩThe result of the unwholesome is threefold: the result of human action, the result of natural outcome, and the result of disconnection.üîΩThe result of the neutral is twofold:

original: rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / dge ba dang / mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan to //
translated: They are indeterminate because they do not produce a desirable or undesirable karmic maturation, and because they do not convey a conventional symbol of virtue or nonvirtue.

original: de ltar chos la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te /üîΩdrang srong mchog gis las rnams ni //
analyzed: de ltar chos la sogs pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa de dag kyang rnam pa gnyis te / drang srong mchog gis las rnams ni //
translated: These karmas, which are differentiated by the categories of Dharma and so on, are also twofold.üîΩThe supreme sage has declared

original: sems pa dang ni bsam par gsungs //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni bsam par gsungs //
translated: that karma is intention and what is produced by intention.

original: drang srong mchog ni bcom ldan 'das te /üîΩde ni drang srong yang yin la mchog kyang yin te /
analyzed: drang srong mchog ni bcom ldan 'das te / de ni drang srong yang yin la mchog kyang yin te /
translated: The supreme sage is the Bhagavat.

original: bgrod par bya ba ma lus par bgrod zin pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i drang srong rnams las mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bgrod par bya ba ma lus par bgrod zin pa'i phyir dang / nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya ba'i drang srong rnams las mchog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is a sage and supreme because he has traversed all that is to be traversed and because he is supreme among the sages called sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, and bodhisattvas.

original: de las chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de las chos dang / chos ma yin pa dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i dbye bas tha dad pa rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The karmas that are differentiated by the categories of Dharma, nondharma, and indeterminate are twofold.

original: sems pa dang / bsam pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: sems pa dang / bsam pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: intention and volition.

original: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
analyzed: las de dag gi bye brag ni //
translated: The varieties of these actions

original: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags //
analyzed: rnam pa du mar yongs su bsgrags //
translated: are proclaimed in many ways.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the brief teaching.

original: de rgyas par bshad pa ni /üîΩde la las gang sems pa zhes //
analyzed: de rgyas par bshad pa ni / de la las gang sems pa zhes //
translated: The detailed explanation is as follows:üîΩAmong these, the action called intention

original: gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod //
analyzed: gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod //
translated: is considered to be mental.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra @171b ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i don to //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra @171b ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúamong‚Äù has the sense of exclusion.

original: las gang sems pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod de /üîΩyid kyi zhes bya ba ni yid las byung ba ste /
analyzed: las gang sems pa zhes gsungs pa de ni yid kyir 'dod de / yid kyi zhes bya ba ni yid las byung ba ste /
translated: The action called intention is considered to be mental.

original: yid kyi sgo kho na nas de mthar thug bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi sgo kho na nas de mthar thug bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Mental‚Äù means arising from the mind, because it is completed only through the mind.

original: lus kyi dang ngag gi dag ni sems pa zhes mi brjod de /
analyzed: lus kyi dang ngag gi dag ni sems pa zhes mi brjod de /
translated: The actions of body and speech are not called intention,

original: de dag sems pas kun nas bslang ba yin yang lus dang / ngag gi sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag sems pas kun nas bslang ba yin yang lus dang / ngag gi sgo nas yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: even though they are motivated by intention, because they are completed through the body and speech.

original: bsam pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: bsam pa zhes ni gang gsungs pa //
translated: That which is called volition

original: de ni lus dang ngag gi yin //
analyzed: de ni lus dang ngag gi yin //
translated: is of the body and speech.

original: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni blos bsams nas byed pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa zhes bya ba ni blos bsams nas byed pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Intention is that which is done after having been thought by the mind.

original: de ltar las gang bsam pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni lus dang ngag gi yin te /
analyzed: de ltar las gang bsam pa zhes bya ba gsungs pa ni lus dang ngag gi yin te /
translated: Thus, the karma called ‚Äúintention‚Äù is that of body and speech,

original: lus dang ngag las byung ba'i phyir dang / de dag gi sgo nyid nas mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus dang ngag las byung ba'i phyir dang / de dag gi sgo nyid nas mthar thug par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it arises from body and speech and because it is completed by means of them.

original: de ltar re zhig las rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig las rnam pa gnyis bstan to //
translated: Thus, karma is taught to be of two types.

original: ji ltar rnam pa du ma zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam pa du ma zhe na /
translated: How many types of karma are there?

original: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
analyzed: ngag dang bskyod dang mi spong ba'i //
translated: Speech, movement, and non-aversion

original: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //
analyzed: rnam rig byed min zhes bya gang //
translated: are called nonindicative states.

original: spong ba'i rnam rig byed min pa //
analyzed: spong ba'i rnam rig byed min pa //
translated: Nonindicative states of abandonment

original: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang ni de bzhin 'dod //
translated: are also asserted in the same way.

original: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
analyzed: longs spyod las byung bsod nams dang // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
translated: Merit and demerit arise from enjoyment,

original: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
analyzed: sems pa dang ni chos de bdun //
translated: and intention and the seven elements of the dharma

original: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin //
translated: are asserted to be karma.

original: de la ngag ni yi ge gsal bar brjod pa'o //
analyzed: de la ngag ni yi ge gsal bar brjod pa'o //
translated: Speech is the clear expression of syllables.

original: bskyod pa ni lus g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: bskyod pa ni lus g-yo ba'o //
translated: Movement is the movement of the body.

original: mi spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mi spong ba'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Nonindicative states that do not abandon negative actions are as follows.

original: bdag gi lus sam ngag gam yid kyis mi dge ba 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yi dam bcas pa'i skad cig ma tshun chad nas byed pa pos las de mi byed du zin kyang /
analyzed: bdag gi lus sam ngag gam yid kyis mi dge ba 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yi dam bcas pa'i skad cig ma tshun chad nas byed pa pos las de mi byed du zin kyang /
translated: From the moment one resolves to engage in nonvirtuous actions of body, speech or mind, thinking, I will do this, even if the agent does not perform that action,

original: mi dge ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung ba mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyu las byung ba mi spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: nonindicative states that arise from the cause of correctly taking up nonvirtue and that are characterized by not abandoning negative action exist.

original: spong pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du 'dod de /
analyzed: spong pa'i rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du 'dod de /
translated: Other nonindicative states that abandon negative action are asserted to be similar.üîΩFrom the moment one resolves to engage in virtuous actions of body, speech or mind, thinking, I will do this, even if the agent does not perform that action,

original: bdag gis lus sam ngag gam yid kyi dge ba'i las 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yi dam du bcas pa'i sems pa tshun chad nas byed pa pos las de mi byed du zin kyang dge ba'i bya ba yang dag par blangs pa'i sems pas bskyed pa
analyzed: bdag gis lus sam ngag gam yid kyi dge ba'i las 'di lta bu zhig bya'o snyam du yi dam du bcas pa'i sems pa tshun chad nas byed pa pos las de mi byed du zin kyang dge ba'i bya ba yang dag par blangs pa'i sems pas bskyed pa
translated: indicative and nonindicative states that arise from the intention to correctly take up virtuous action exist.

original: spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang dag yin pa'o //
analyzed: spong ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam par rig byed ma yin pa gang dag yin pa'o //
translated: and the non-informative which has the characteristic of abandonment.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The non-informative is so called because,

original: gzugs dang bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs dang bya ba'i ngo bo nyid yin du zin kyang rnam par rig byed bzhin du gzhan la rnam par rig par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: although it has the nature of form and action, it does not inform others as does the informative.

original: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las bsod @172a * //
analyzed: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las bsod @172a * //
translated: Merit arising from enjoyment is so called because merit arises from the cause of enjoyment.

original: nams de byung ngo zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: nams de byung ngo zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúarising from the cause of enjoyment‚Äù is to be construed with the word ‚Äúmerit.‚Äù

original: yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di dkon mchog gsum gyi yul la dngos po yongs su btang ba nye bar spyad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyod pa zhes bya ba 'di dkon mchog gsum gyi yul la dngos po yongs su btang ba nye bar spyad pa'o //
translated: The enjoyment is the utilization of the object of the Three Jewels.

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las byung ba ste /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba ni de'i rjes las byung ba ste /
translated: Arising from the cause of that is arising from the cause of enjoyment.

original: 'brel pa dang 'phel ba zhes pa dag gi rnam grangs so ;
analyzed: 'brel pa dang 'phel ba zhes pa dag gi rnam grangs so ;
translated: It is a synonym for ‚Äúrelated‚Äù and ‚Äúincreased.‚Äù

original: / bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dag bar byed bas bsod nams te /
analyzed: / bsod nams zhes bya ba ni dag bar byed bas bsod nams te /
translated: Merit is so called because it purifies.

original: dge ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: dge ba zhes bya ba dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: Virtue is a synonym for good.

original: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin te /
analyzed: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams ma yin pa yang tshul de bzhin te /
translated: Non-merit is also like this, arising from enjoyment.

original: yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las byung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said to arise from the cause of enjoyment.

original: bsod nams ma yin pa ni bsod nams las bzlog pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ma yin pa ni bsod nams las bzlog pa las khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Non-merit should be understood as the opposite of merit.

original: sems pa zhes bya bas ni yid kyi las bstan te /
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya bas ni yid kyi las bstan te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúintention‚Äù indicates mental action.

original: 'o na sems pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na sems pa zhes bya ba de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called intention?

original: yon tan dang skyon las sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste yid kyi las so //
analyzed: yon tan dang skyon las sems mngon par 'du byed pa ste yid kyi las so //
translated: It is the mental action of directing the mind toward virtue and non-virtue.

original: de ltar ngag la sogs pa bdun po de dag ni chos te /
analyzed: de ltar ngag la sogs pa bdun po de dag ni chos te /
translated: Thus, these seven, speech and so on, are dharmas.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos yin no //
translated: They are called dharmas because they hold their own characteristics.

original: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: las su mngon par 'dod pa yin zhes bya ba ni las kyi mtshan nyid dag tu 'dod pa yin no //
translated: They are called karma because they are asserted to be the characteristics of karma.

original: bsam gtan dang / klog pa la sogs pa'i las dag kyang yod mod kyi 'di dag nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir bdun kho nar nges par gzung ngo //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang / klog pa la sogs pa'i las dag kyang yod mod kyi 'di dag nyid kyi khongs su 'dus pa'i phyir bdun kho nar nges par gzung ngo //
translated: Although there are other actions such as meditation and recitation, they are definitely included within these seven.

original: las de dang 'bras bur 'brel pa mthong ba ni ;
analyzed: las de dang 'bras bur 'brel pa mthong ba ni ;
translated: The connection between action and effect is seen

original: 'gro ba lngar phung po lnga skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba lngar phung po lnga skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: in the arising of the five aggregates in the five types of transmigration.

original: de ltar las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyis don dam par nang gi 'du byed rnams la 'khor ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, by the reason of the connection between action and effect, in reality the internal compositional factors cycle.

original: des na bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: des na bcings pa dang thar pa yod pa'i phyir don dam par nang gi dngos po rnams la ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, because bondage and liberation exist, in reality the internal things definitely have an intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'di la las de skyes nas smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la las de skyes nas smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas pa'am /
translated: In this regard, after the action has arisen, does it endure until the time of its ripening,

original: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur ba zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: skyes nas 'jig par 'gyur ba zhig yin grang na /
translated: or does it perish after arising?üîΩIn that regard, first:

original: de la re zhig / gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
translated: If it endures until the time of its ripening,

original: gnas na las te rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas na las te rtag par 'gyur //
translated: If it endures, it would be permanent.

original: skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni phyis kyang 'jig pas mi rigs pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig pa de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa ni phyis kyang 'jig pas mi rigs pa'i phyir rtag pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If it did not disintegrate immediately after arising, it would not be reasonable for it to disintegrate later, and thus it would follow that it would be permanent.

original: gal te chu shing dang 'dam bu dang / smyig ma bzhin du 'bras bu smin pa'i 'og tu de 'jig pas skyon med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te chu shing dang 'dam bu dang / smyig ma bzhin du 'bras bu smin pa'i 'og tu de 'jig pas skyon med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no error because it disintegrates after the fruit ripens, like a plantain, a bamboo, or a reed,

original: skyon med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: skyon med pa ma yin te /
translated: there is still an error.

original: chu shing la sogs pa dag skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa nyid dang / @172b de dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyun chad pas 'jig pa nyid tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa ni las bzhin du smyig ma la sogs pa dag kyang 'bras bu dang 'brel par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: chu shing la sogs pa dag skad cig ma re re la 'jig pa nyid dang / @172b de dang rigs mthun pa'i rgyun chad pas 'jig pa nyid tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir dang / don dam pa ni las bzhin du smyig ma la sogs pa dag kyang 'bras bu dang 'brel par mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang /
translated: Because it is accepted that a plantain, etc., disintegrate in each moment and that they disintegrate through the cessation of a continuum that is homogeneous with it, and because, like karma, it is not tenable that a reed, etc., are related to a fruit in an ultimate sense,

original: sngar ma zhig pa phyis de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar ma zhig pa phyis de'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yang bstan dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because it is difficult to demonstrate that it is not previously disintegrated and later becomes its intrinsic nature.

original: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu'i snga rol na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig pa'i rgyu'i snga rol na /
translated: If it is said that it is not tenable that that which is not destroyedüîΩis a thing, then it is not tenable that that which is destroyed is a thing.üîΩ

original: 'jig pa med du zin kyang phyis yod par 'gyur bas sngon ma zhig pa yang phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig pa med du zin kyang phyis yod par 'gyur bas sngon ma zhig pa yang phyis 'jig pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that although disintegration does not exist prior to the cause of disintegration, it comes to exist later, and thus that which previously disintegrated would later disintegrate,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /üîΩ'di ltar gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur brjod pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te / 'di ltar gang zhig gang gi 'jig pa'i rgyur brjod pa de ni de'i 'jig pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: that also is illogical.üîΩThat which is called the cause of disintegration is not the cause of disintegration because it is different from that and it has a cause, like that which is different from it.üîΩIt is also undermined by inference and scripture.

original: de las gzhan pa'i phyir dang / rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / lung las /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i phyir dang / rgyu can yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir dang / lung las /
translated: A sutra states:

original: lus dang dbang po blo rnams ni //
analyzed: lus dang dbang po blo rnams ni //
translated: The body, faculties, and mind

original: skad cig las ni ring mi gnas //üîΩzhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: skad cig las ni ring mi gnas // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Do not remain for a second moment.

original: khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khas blangs pa la gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is undermined by what you accept.

original: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas skyes ma thag tu 'jig par dam bca' na /
analyzed: ci ste skyon der gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas skyes ma thag tu 'jig par dam bca' na /
translated: But if you accept that it disintegrates immediately after it arises because you think that it would be illogical for it to be a fault,

original: de lta na yang /
analyzed: de lta na yang /
translated: then in that case,

original: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
analyzed: gal te 'gags na 'gags gyur pa //
translated: If it ceased, having ceased,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: How could it generate an effect?

original: 'gag pa ni rang gi bdag nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩ'gag bzhin pa yang 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid du rtog na yang 'gag bzhin pa 'gags pa 'am /
analyzed: 'gag pa ni rang gi bdag nyid med pa kho na'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so // 'gag bzhin pa yang 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid du rtog na yang 'gag bzhin pa 'gags pa 'am /
translated: It is because cessation itself does not exist.

original: ma 'gags pa nyid la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa dang / lan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa nyid la de mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / brgal zhing brtag pa dang / lan mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that which is in the process of ceasing generates an effect, then that which is in the process of ceasing would either have ceased or not have ceased. But that is untenable, because the same objections and analyses would apply.

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhes rtog na yang skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni 'gag pa la mngon par phyogs pa'o zhes rtog na yang skyon ji skad bstan pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you imagine that which is in the process of ceasing is that which is about to cease, then the error that has been demonstrated would apply.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rtog na yang don dam par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du rtog na yang don dam par brjod par bya ba ma yin pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa nyid du mi 'thad de /
translated: If you imagine that which is in the process of ceasing is not to be expressed, then it is untenable that that which is not to be expressed ultimately generates an effect.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na skye bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir de yang snying po ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na skye bzhin pas rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir de yang snying po ma yin no //
translated: Because it is not to be expressed, like that which is in the process of arising. That is also unreasonable, because it is undermined by inference.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de nyid yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid kyi skyon dang / don 'gal ba nyid kyi skyon de nyid yod do //
translated: Therefore, the error of the nonestablishment of the meaning of the reason and the error of the contradiction with the meaning still exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa ni 'thad pa kho na yin te /
translated: The connection between karma and its effect is tenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rgyud kyi rgyun las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyud kyi rgyun las 'bras bu 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the effect is established from the continuum.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
translated: The continuum of the sprout

original: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sa bon las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: manifests from the seed.

original: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
translated: From that, the effect arises.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If the seed does not exist, that also does not arise.üîΩBecause the continuum of the seed is the cause,

original: gang phyir sa bon na las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung @173a * //
analyzed: gang phyir sa bon na las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung @173a * //
translated: and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: 'gyur zhing // sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: 'gyur zhing // sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the seed precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sdong bu dang / sbu gu dang / snye ma dang / spun pa dang / gra ma dang / srugs dang / 'bras thug po che la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sa bon 'gags pa las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: myu gu dang / 'dab ma dang / sdong bu dang / sbu gu dang / snye ma dang / spun pa dang / gra ma dang / srugs dang / 'bras thug po che la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sa bon 'gags pa las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: The continuum of characteristics of the sprout, leaf, stem, stalk, bud, flower, husk, husk-cover, and the fully ripe grain, etc., arises from the cessation of the seed. The effect arises from that continuum.

original: sa bon med na myu gu sngon du btang ba'i rgyun de las mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon med na myu gu sngon du btang ba'i rgyun de las mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no seed, the effect would not arise from the continuum that preceded the sprout.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
translated: Because the continuum arises from the seed,

original: rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin te /
translated: and the seed precedes the effect, therefore there is no annihilation,

original: sa bon gyi rgyun gyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa bon gyi rgyun gyis nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed is definitely present in the continuum.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: There is also no permanence,

original: myu gu byung ba na sa bon de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myu gu byung ba na sa bon de 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because when the sprout arises, the seed ceases.

original: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni chos mthun pa'i dpe'i tshig yin no //
translated: This is the example of similarity.

original: de bzhin du /
analyzed: de bzhin du /
translated: Likewise,

original: sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
translated: The continuum of mind

original: sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: arises from intention.

original: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
translated: From that, the effect arises.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'byung //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'byung //
translated: If there is no intention, that does not occur.

original: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: Because the continuum arises from intention, and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: las ni 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the action precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: sems ni rgyun 'brel par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni byams pa dang / byams pa ma yin pa'i sems pa las su brjod pa gang yin pa'i sems 'gag pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems ni rgyun 'brel par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de ni byams pa dang / byams pa ma yin pa'i sems pa las su brjod pa gang yin pa'i sems 'gag pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa nyams su myong ba'i mtshan nyid mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: The continuum of mind is characterized by a continuous engagement. That arises from intention, whether it is the intention to be loving or the intention not to be loving. The effect arises from that continuum, characterized by the experience of the desired or undesired.

original: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no intention, that continuum of mind does not arise.

original: de ltar des ni las kyi chos rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar des ni las kyi chos rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid bstan to //
translated: Thus, he has taught the continuity of the dharmas of action.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa las rgyun ces bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel cing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i rgyun 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don mngon par 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa las rgyun ces bya ba rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos por 'brel cing rgyas par 'gyur ba'i rgyun 'brel pa zhes bya ba'i don mngon par 'byung la /
translated: Because of the continuity of the stream of consciousness, the stream of consciousness is connected as the state of cause and effect, and the meaning of the connection of the stream is manifested.

original: rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: The effect is manifested from the stream.

original: las 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: las 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Since action precedes the effect, there is no annihilation.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And since the stream does not last a second moment, there is no permanence.

original: bsgrub pa ji skad bstan pas 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun gyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma gnyis par nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ji skad bstan pas 'du byed rnams kyi rgyun gyis 'bras bu skyed pa'i phyir dang / skad cig ma gnyis par nges par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs te /
translated: The meaning is that the stream of the formations generates the effect, as has been taught in the proof, and does not last a second moment.

original: de ltar na de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshig yin no //
translated: Thus, this is a concluding statement.

original: de'i phyir 'dir rjes @173b su dpag pa ni don dam par sems can gyi sgrar brjod pa'i 'du byed rnams la las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir rjes @173b su dpag pa ni don dam par sems can gyi sgrar brjod pa'i 'du byed rnams la las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, here, the inference is: ultimately, the formations that are expressed by the term sentient being have a connection with karma and its effects,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu khyad par can thob par 'dod pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu khyad par can thob par 'dod pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because the Lord has taught the means for those who desire to attain a special effect to attain a connection with it.

original: dper na sa bon dang 'bras bur 'brel pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon dang 'bras bur 'brel pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the connection between a seed and its fruit.

original: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs ma bstan te /
analyzed: 'di na gang yod pa ma yin pa de la ni bcom ldan 'das kyis de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs ma bstan te /
translated: Here, the Lord has not taught the means for attaining a connection with that which does not exist.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a garland of sky flowers.

original: 'di la ni /
analyzed: 'di la ni /
translated: Here,

original: chos sgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni /
analyzed: chos sgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni /
translated: the means for accomplishing the Dharma

original: dkar po las ni lam bcu ste //
analyzed: dkar po las ni lam bcu ste //
translated: are the ten paths of virtue.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
translated: The effect of the Dharma is

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
translated: the five sense objects in other lives.

original: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag las so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu khyad par can 'dod pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa yod pas /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i bye brag las so zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis 'bras bu khyad par can 'dod pa rnams la de dang 'brel pa thob par bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa yod pas /
translated: The Blessed One taught that the specific results of evolution and natural outflow are obtained from the specific causes of karma.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus ji skad smras pa'i don grub po //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus ji skad smras pa'i don grub po //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the above statements is established by the power of the reason stated.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gal te brtag pa der gyur na //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa der gyur na //
translated: If that were the case,

original: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //
translated: many great errors would occur.

original: de lta bas na brtag pa de //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtag pa de //
translated: Therefore, that theory

original: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: is not tenable here.

original: gal te khyod kyi sa bon gyi rgyun dang / chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brtag pa de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi sa bon gyi rgyun dang / chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brtag pa de ltar gyur na /
translated: If that theory of the similarity of characteristics of the continuum of seeds were the case,

original: nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: many great errors would occur.

original: mi'i rgyud las lha la sogs pa'i rgyud du skye bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi'i rgyud las lha la sogs pa'i rgyud du skye bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One would not be born in the continuum of a god, and so on, from the continuum of a human.

original: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dper na shing nim pa'i sa bon las aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin pas /üîΩrjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde bzhin du dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / mi dge ba'i sems las dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang /
analyzed: rigs tha dad pa'i phyir dper na shing nim pa'i sa bon las aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu skye bar mi 'gyur ba bzhin pas / rjes su dpag pas gnod pa'i phyir ro // de bzhin du dge ba'i sems las mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / mi dge ba'i sems las dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems dang / lung du ma bstan pa'i sems las dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i sems dang /
translated: Thus it is illogical for a virtuous mind to arise from a nonvirtuous mind, because it is undermined by inference.üîΩSimilarly, a nonvirtuous mind does not arise from a virtuous mind, a neutral mind does not arise from a virtuous or nonvirtuous mind, a virtuous mind does not arise from a neutral mind, a nonvirtuous mind does not arise from a neutral mind,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sems las 'dod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang /
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems las gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang / gzugs na spyod pa'i sems las 'dod pa dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems dang /
translated: a formless realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a formless realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a formless realm mind, a desire realm mind does not arise from a desire realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise from a form realm mind, a form realm mind does not arise

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems las 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur te /üîΩrjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas gnod @174a * //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i sems las 'dod pa dang / gzugs na spyod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i sems skye bar mi 'gyur te / rjes su dpag pa ji skad bstan pas gnod @174a * //
translated: A mind of the desire realm and a mind of the form realm and a supramundane mind do not arise from a formless realm mind.

original: par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is harmed by the previously explained inference.

original: de ltar na dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag bya ba dang / spang bar mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de ltar na dge ba dang / mi dge ba dag bya ba dang / spang bar mi 'thad pas /
translated: Thus, virtue and nonvirtue would not be tenable as things to be done and to be abandoned.

original: de'i phyir brtag pa de ni 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brtag pa de ni 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, this analysis is not tenable here.

original: 'o na ji lta bu 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bu 'thad ce na /
translated: Well then, what is tenable?

original: ji skad smos pa'i skyon gyi dri mas ma gos pa /
analyzed: ji skad smos pa'i skyon gyi dri mas ma gos pa /
translated: The analysis that is tenable here is that which is not sullied by the stains of the faults just mentioned.üîΩIt is that which is taught by the buddhas,

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gsungs pa yi //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gsungs pa yi //
translated: pratyekabuddhas, and ≈õrƒÅvakas.üîΩI will fully explain

original: brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //üîΩde ni rab tu brjod par bya //
analyzed: brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa // de ni rab tu brjod par bya //
translated: that which is tenable here.

original: de yang gang zhe na /üîΩji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na / ji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
translated: What is that?üîΩKarma and its nonexpiration

original: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
analyzed: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
translated: are like a debt and a promissory note.

original: bu lon gyi dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar las kyi chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nges par gnas te /
analyzed: bu lon gyi dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar las kyi chud mi za ba'i mtshan nyid kyi chos nges par gnas te /
translated: Just as a promissory note exists, so too the phenomenon of the nonexpiration of karma exists.üîΩFor example, even though the money of a loan is spent, because of the promissory note, the money of the lender does not expire and the money together with interest will return to him.

original: dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag gi nor chud mi za zhing nor gyi phung po skyed dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ba bzhin du las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang /
analyzed: dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag gi nor chud mi za zhing nor gyi phung po skyed dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ba bzhin du las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang /
translated: Similarly, even though the momentary karma ceases,

original: de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas /
analyzed: de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas /
translated: because of the existence of a phenomenon called the nonexpiration of the karma that arises from that cause,

original: byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'bras bu khyad par dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'bras bu khyad par dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: the result of the karma of the agent does not expire and the result together with its special features will return to him.

original: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir khugs na bu lon gyi dpang rgya ror 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa pos 'bras bu myong na chud mi za ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir khugs na bu lon gyi dpang rgya ror 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa pos 'bras bu myong na chud mi za ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the promissory note is the evidence that the money of the loan was received by the borrower, so too the nonexpiration of karma is the evidence that the result of the karma was experienced by the agent.

original: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi chud mi za ba de ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa'i khams kyi bye brag las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi chud mi za ba de ni 'dod pa dang / gzugs dang / gzugs med par gtogs pa dang / zag pa med pa'i khams kyi bye brag las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the non-expiration of the four types of elements. It is of four types, distinguished according to the realm to which it belongs: the desire realm, the form realm, the formless realm, and the uncontaminated realm.

original: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
translated: It is neutral by nature.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not indicated as virtuous or nonvirtuous.

original: spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas /
translated: It is not abandoned by the path of seeing that abandons the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path.

original: spang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbsgom pas spang ba nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: spang ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro // bsgom pas spang ba nyid kyang yin //
translated: It is not abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'bras bu 'pho ba na bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'pho ba na bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is abandoned by the path of cultivation because it is abandoned when one passes beyond the fruit.

original: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'bras bu bskyed pas kyang spang ba nyid yin no zhes rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni 'bras bu bskyed pas kyang spang ba nyid yin no zhes rnam par brtag pa'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the verse indicates that it is also abandoned by producing the fruit.

original: de phyir chud mi za ba yi //
analyzed: de phyir chud mi za ba yi //
translated: Therefore, non-expiration

original: las kyi 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: The effect of karma will arise.

original: gang gi phyir de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas /
translated: Because it is not abandoned by the path of seeing of the truths of suffering and so on,

original: spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las mi dge ba bzhin du las spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las mi dge ba bzhin du las spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: the effect of karma will arise through the indestructibility of karma, even though karma is abandoned, like the nonvirtue that is to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and so on.

original: de la chud mi za ba de //
analyzed: de la chud mi za ba de //
translated: If that indestructibilityüîΩis abandoned by seeing the truths

original: gal te mthong bas spang ba dang // @174b las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na //üîΩde la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gal te mthong bas spang ba dang // @174b las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na // de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
translated: and is compatible with the transference of karma,üîΩthen the errors of the destruction of karma and so on

original: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: would ensue.

original: de la gal te chud mi za ba de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / las 'pho ba dang / rigs mthun pa yin par gyur na de la las kyi 'bras bu med pas /
analyzed: de la gal te chud mi za ba de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / las 'pho ba dang / rigs mthun pa yin par gyur na de la las kyi 'bras bu med pas /
translated: If that nonexpiration is the negative tendency of affliction abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and so on, then it would be the same as the karma to be discarded and the result of karma would not exist.üîΩüîΩ

original: las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las 'jig pa la sogs pa'i skyon rnams su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that nonexpiration is the same as the negative tendencies of the truth of suffering, etc., that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, etc., then the error of the destruction of karma, etc., would ensue, because there would be no result of karma.

original: las mi dge ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: las mi dge ba ni mthong ba'i lam gyis spang ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Unwholesome karma should be seen as abandoned by the path of seeing,

original: 'phags pa yang so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa yang so so'i skye bo'i las dang ldan par gyur na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable for ƒÅryas to possess the karma of ordinary beings.

original: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / las bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na mthong bas spang bar bya ba dang / las bzhin du spang bar bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, like the karma to be abandoned by seeing, it is not to be abandoned,

original: 'bras bu 'phos na ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phos na ni spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: but if the result has been transferred, it is abandoned.

original: 'dod par gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong la /
analyzed: 'dod par gtogs pa ni 'dod pa'i khams las yang dag par 'das pas spong la /
translated: Karma belonging to the desire realm is abandoned by completely transcending the desire realm.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa dag kyang /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med par gtogs pa dag kyang /
translated: Also, those belonging to the form and formless realmsüîΩ

original: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag las yang dag par 'das pas spong ngo //
