analyzed: gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'i khams dag las yang dag par 'das pas spong ngo //
translated: Those belonging to the form and formless realms are abandoned by transcending the form and formless realms.üîΩAll of the same realm,

original: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: of similar and dissimilar types,

original: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
analyzed: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
translated: are produced in the present

original: gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: by the single one that arises.

original: khams mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni khams 'dra ba'i'o //
analyzed: khams mtshungs pa'i zhes bya ba ni khams 'dra ba'i'o //
translated: The same realm means the same realm.

original: las cha mtshungs pa ni rigs mthun pa'o //
analyzed: las cha mtshungs pa ni rigs mthun pa'o //
translated: Similar type means the same type.

original: cha mi mtshungs pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: cha mi mtshungs pa ni rigs mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Dissimilar type means different types.

original: de dag thams cad kyi chud mi za ba de'i tshe 'di la re re las bskyed pa dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi tshe de dag thams cad 'gag pa na yang gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro //üîΩtshe 'di la ni las dang las //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi chud mi za ba de'i tshe 'di la re re las bskyed pa dag ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i dus kyi tshe de dag thams cad 'gag pa na yang gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur ro // tshe 'di la ni las dang las //
translated: At the time of linking, all of those are produced by the single one that arises, even when all of them cease.üîΩIn this life, all of the two types

original: rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyi //
translated: of karma

original: de ni tha dad skye 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni tha dad skye 'gyur zhing //
translated: are produced by the single one that arises.

original: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin //üîΩtshe 'di la ni las dang las so so ba sems pa dang / bsams pa'i bye brag gam /
analyzed: rnam par smin kyang gnas pa yin // tshe 'di la ni las dang las so so ba sems pa dang / bsams pa'i bye brag gam /
translated: and it endures until the ripening.üîΩIn this life, the non-expiration of karma is of two types, according to whether it is the karma of intention or the karma of the action itself, or according to whether it is wholesome or unwholesome.

original: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyis chud mi za ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba dang / mi dge ba'i bye brag gis rnam pa gnyis po thams cad kyis chud mi za ba gang yin pa de ni tha dad par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-expiration of karma is born in a different body.

original: rnam par smin pa yang gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang gnas pa yin te /
translated: It endures until the ripening.

original: de ni las rnam par smin pa'i rgyus 'gag pa ltar nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni las rnam par smin pa'i rgyus 'gag pa ltar nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that it ceases through the cause of the ripening of karma.

original: de gnas su zin kyang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te /
analyzed: de gnas su zin kyang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te /
translated: Even though it endures, it is not able to produce a result.

original: 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i phyir nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i phyir nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no //
translated: Because the result has already been produced, it is like a promissory note that has already been used.üîΩIt ceases when the result has been produced

original: de ni 'bras bu 'phos pa dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur //üîΩde @175a * //üîΩyi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu 'phos pa dang // shi bar gyur na 'gag par 'gyur // de @175a * // yi rnam dbye zag med dang // zag dang bcas par shes par bya //
translated: and when one dies.üîΩIt should be understood that the non-expiration of karmaüîΩis of two types: undefiled and defiled.

original: las de'i chud mi za ba de'i 'gag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa yin te /
analyzed: las de'i chud mi za ba de'i 'gag pa ni rnam pa gnyis su nges pa yin te /
translated: The cessation of the non-expiration of that karma is definitely of two types:

original: 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa dang / shi bar gyur pa'o //
translated: and when the result has been transferred, and when one dies.

original: de la 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa ni sgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyang yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de la 'bras bu 'phos par gyur pa ni sgom pas spang bar bya ba nyid kyang yin zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the result has been transferred means that it is taught that it is also to be abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: shi bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa ni /
translated: When one dies meansüîΩthat it is taught thatüîΩwhen one dies,üîΩall of the homogeneous actionsüîΩand the heterogeneous actions

original: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi //
analyzed: khams mtshungs las ni cha mtshungs dang // cha mi mtshungs pa thams cad kyi //
translated: of the same realmüîΩare simultaneously transferred.

original: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
analyzed: de ni nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i tshe //
translated: At the time of linking,

original: gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig pu kho nar skye bar 'gyur // zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: only one of them arises.

original: de'i de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i de yang rnam par dbye na rnam pa gnyis su shes par bya ste /
translated: That non-perishing should be known as twofold,

original: zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bye brag gis so //
analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bye brag gis so //
translated: by the distinction of uncontaminated and contaminated karma.

original: de'i phyir de ltar chud mi za ba yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar chud mi za ba yod na /
translated: Therefore, when there is such non-perishing,

original: srog chags las sna tshogs las skyes pa 'gro ba dang / rigs dang / rus dang / yul dang / dus tha dad pa rnams kyi lus dang / dbang po dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / stobs dang / blo dang / mos pa dang /
analyzed: srog chags las sna tshogs las skyes pa 'gro ba dang / rigs dang / rus dang / yul dang / dus tha dad pa rnams kyi lus dang / dbang po dang / kha dog dang / dbyibs dang / stobs dang / blo dang / mos pa dang /
translated: The bodies, faculties, colors, shapes, strengths, minds, interests,

original: ngang tshul dang / longs spyod la sogs pa tha dad pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngang tshul dang / longs spyod la sogs pa tha dad pa dag mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: attitudes, enjoyments, and so on of sentient beings born from various wombs, of various species, castes, countries, and times are established.üîΩTherefore:üîΩEmptiness is not nihilism,

original: de'i phyir / stong pa nyid dang chad min dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min //
analyzed: de'i phyir / stong pa nyid dang chad min dang // 'khor ba dang ni rtag pa min //
translated: and cyclic existence is not eternal.üîΩThe Buddha taught that

original: las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos //üîΩsangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
analyzed: las rnams chud mi za ba'i chos // sangs rgyas kyis ni bstan pa yin //
translated: actions do not perish.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang 'thad pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa de'i phyir stong pa nyid kyang 'thad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because of the connection between actions and effects, emptiness is tenable.

original: 'du byed rnams mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed rnams mu stegs byed kyis yongs su brtags pa'i bdag gis stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because compounded phenomena are empty of the self imagined by the tƒ´rthikas.

original: chad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it nihilism,

original: chud mi za ba nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chud mi za ba nges par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is certain that actions do not perish.

original: 'khor ba yang 'thad de /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang 'thad de /
translated: Cyclic existence is also tenable,

original: 'gro ba tha dad par 'du byed rnams mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba tha dad par 'du byed rnams mngon par grub pa'i mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the characteristics of the formation of the various reincarnating beings exist.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it permanent,

original: las rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnam par 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because karma is destroyed.

original: las rnams kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa de yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las rnams kyang chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos sangs rgyas kyis bstan pa de yang grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And because the doctrine taught by the Buddha, that ‚Äúkarma is not lost,‚Äù is established.

original: de lta bas na brtag pa de nyid 'dir 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brtag pa de nyid 'dir 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this analysis is tenable here.

original: de'i phyir sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar smras pa'i gtan tshigs las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba de'i don ma grub pa nyid kyang ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason stated earlier, ‚Äúbecause there is a connection between karma and its result,‚Äù is not unestablished.

original: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not follow.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
translated: In our system,

original: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
translated: because karma is not produced,

original: de'i phyir las kho na bzhin du don dam par sa bon gyi rgyun kyang skye ba med pas @175b dpe med pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kho na bzhin du don dam par sa bon gyi rgyun kyang skye ba med pas @175b dpe med pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma tshang ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: Therefore, just like karma, the continuum of seeds also does not arise ultimately, and because there is no example, the error of the non-establishment of the probandum remains.

original: gal te las de ci'i phyir skye ba med ce na /
analyzed: gal te las de ci'i phyir skye ba med ce na /
translated: If it is asked why that karma does not arise,

original: gang phyir dngos nyid med de'i phyir //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos nyid med de'i phyir //
translated: because it has no intrinsic reality, therefore it does not arise.

original: gang gi phyir las ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir skye ba med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir las ngo bo nyid med pa de'i phyir skye ba med do //
translated: Because karma has no intrinsic reality, therefore it does not arise.

original: de ltar re zhig phyogs dang po shos kyi phyir skyon bshad do //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig phyogs dang po shos kyi phyir skyon bshad do //
translated: Thus, first the error is explained.

original: phyogs gnyis pa shos kyis gang smras pa de la yang gal te sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yin te /
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa shos kyis gang smras pa de la yang gal te sgrub pa'i sbyor ba 'di yin te /
translated: Now, regarding what is said by the second party, if this is the proof,

original: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang yod la /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang yod la /
translated: there is a connection between karma and its result,

original: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / chad pa'i skyon du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: and the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not occur,

original: chud mi za ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: chud mi za ba yod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because non-expiration exists.

original: de lta na yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
analyzed: de lta na yang kho bo cag gi phyogs la /
translated: Even so, in our position,

original: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
analyzed: gang phyir las ni skye med pa //
translated: because karma does not arise,

original: de'i phyir don dam par chud mi za ba yang ma grub ste ;
analyzed: de'i phyir don dam par chud mi za ba yang ma grub ste ;
translated: Therefore, ultimately, nonexpiration is not established.

original: 'di ltar skyes na ni de'i chud mi za ba yang chud mi za bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes na ni de'i chud mi za ba yang chud mi za bar 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If it were produced, then its nonexpiration would also be nonexpiration.

original: de yang ma skyes pas /
analyzed: de yang ma skyes pas /
translated: But that is not produced.

original: de med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir de yang med pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since that does not exist, that also does not exist. Therefore the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: kun rdzob tu las dang / 'bras bur 'brel pa ston pa na ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob tu las dang / 'bras bur 'brel pa ston pa na ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: If you teach the connection between karma and its result conventionally, then the meaning is contradictory.

original: phyogs dang po pa'i phyir phyogs gnyis pa las gal te /
analyzed: phyogs dang po pa'i phyir phyogs gnyis pa las gal te /
translated: If you say that the first position is the second position,

original: khyod kyi sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brtag pa de ltar gyur na nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes gang smras pa /
analyzed: khyod kyi sa bon gyi rgyun dang chos mthun pa'i mtshan nyid kyi brtag pa de ltar gyur na nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur te zhes gang smras pa /
translated: then you would incur many faults.

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But that is illogical.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis 'brel pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid dang / rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis sa bon gyi rgyun dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i khyad par dag bsgrub par bya ba la rnam par rtog par byed pa yang /üîΩrnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'i ltag chod du 'gyur te /üîΩsems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun las /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rgyun rjes su 'jug pa nyid kyis 'brel pa med na mi 'byung ba nyid dang / rtag pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis sa bon gyi rgyun dpe nyid du 'dod pa'i phyir ro // de'i khyad par dag bsgrub par bya ba la rnam par rtog par byed pa yang / rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba'i ltag chod du 'gyur te / sems dang sems las byung ba'i rgyun las /

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, some say:

original: lung las byung ba yang rtags yin pas chud mi za ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
analyzed: lung las byung ba yang rtags yin pas chud mi za ba yang bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs la /
translated: Since what arises from scripture is also a reason, the Transcendent Lord also taught that karma does not expire.

original: de'i rtags rtag pa ma yin pa dang chad pa ma yin pa nyid kyang grub pa'i phyir las bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i rtags rtag pa ma yin pa dang chad pa ma yin pa nyid kyang grub pa'i phyir las bzhin du /
translated: Since the reason for that, namely, that it is neither permanent nor annihilated, is established, like karma,

original: don dam par chud mi za ba yang ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par chud mi za ba yang ma grub pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: since karma does not expire ultimately, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: 'dir bshad @176a * //
analyzed: 'dir bshad @176a * //
translated: Here we say:

original: pa ; bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: pa ; bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: The Transcendent Lord said:

original: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
analyzed: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //
translated: Because it is not produced,

original: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //üîΩzhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Therefore it does not expire.üîΩThus, he said that what is not produced does not expire.

original: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de 'dod la de yang pha rol po'i phyogs la ma grub pas rang la don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma skyes pa la chud za bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de 'dod la de yang pha rol po'i phyogs la ma grub pas rang la don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Since that is accepted, and since that is not established for the opponent, the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas kyang las la ngo bo nyid med do zhes de khong du chud par bya dgos so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod par smra bas kyang las la ngo bo nyid med do zhes de khong du chud par bya dgos so //
translated: The proponents of intrinsic reality should understand that karma has no intrinsic reality.

original: gzhan du dam bcas na //
analyzed: gzhan du dam bcas na //
translated: Otherwise, if you make a claim,

original: gal te las la dngos nyid yod //
analyzed: gal te las la dngos nyid yod //
translated: if karma has intrinsic reality,

original: rtag par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
analyzed: rtag par 'gyur bar the tshom med //
translated: it will undoubtedly be permanent.

original: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: rang bzhin ni mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: The meaning is that intrinsic reality is unchanging.üîΩTherefore,

original: de'i phyir / las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
analyzed: de'i phyir / las ni byas pa ma yin 'gyur //
translated: karma would not be produced.

original: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag la bya ba med phyir ro //
translated: Because the permanent has no activity.

original: las ma byas pa la 'bras bu myong ba yod par rtog na /üîΩci ste las ni ma byas na //
analyzed: las ma byas pa la 'bras bu myong ba yod par rtog na / ci ste las ni ma byas na //
translated: If you imagine that the result of karma is experienced without karma being produced,üîΩif karma is not produced,

original: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jig 'gyur //üîΩgzhan yang tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang /
analyzed: ma byas pa dang phrad 'jig 'gyur // gzhan yang tshangs spyod gnas pa ma yin pa'ang /
translated: how could one encounter the result of karma not done?üîΩMoreover,

original: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de la skyon du thal bar 'gyur //
translated: the consequence of error would apply to one who does not abide in pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //üîΩtshangs par spyod pa ni de la spyod pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o // tshangs par spyod pa ni de la spyod pa'o //
translated: Brahma is nirvana.üîΩPure conduct is the practice of that.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni de'i don du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ni de'i don du gnas pa'o //
translated: Abiding in pure conduct is abiding for the sake of that.

original: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa ni /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa ni /
translated: One who does not abide in pure conduct

original: tshangs par spyod pa la mi gnas pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa la mi gnas pa'o //
translated: is one who does not abide in pure conduct.

original: de la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa ma yin pa yang tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: And in that case, one who does not abide in pure conduct would be subject to the fault of abiding in pure conduct,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i las ma byas pa nyid la yang de yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //üîΩde bzhin du bum pa dang / snam bu dag gis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'i las ma byas pa nyid la yang de yod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so // de bzhin du bum pa dang / snam bu dag gis shig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i /
translated: because that would exist even for one who has not performed the action that brings about the attainment of nirvana.üîΩIn the same way, all conventions such asüîΩ‚ÄúThe pot and cloth are destroyed‚Äù

original: tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
analyzed: tha snyad thams cad nyid dang yang //
translated: and so on

original: 'gal bar 'gyur ba the tshom med //
analyzed: 'gal bar 'gyur ba the tshom med //
translated: are certainly contradictory.

original: gzhan yang / bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bsod nams dang ni sdig byed pa'i //
translated: Moreover,

original: rnam par dbye ba 'thad mi 'gyur //üîΩ'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba 'thad mi 'gyur // 'di ni bsod nams byed pa'o //
translated: the distinction between the one who createsüîΩmerit and the one who creates demerit would be untenable.

original: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba dag kyang 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ni sdig pa byed pa'o zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba dag kyang 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The distinction ‚ÄúThis one creates merit, this one creates demerit‚Äù would not be tenable.

original: de yi rnam par smin gyur pa //
analyzed: de yi rnam par smin gyur pa //
translated: Its maturation

original: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur //üîΩde yi rnam smin smin gyur pa //
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam smin 'gyur // de yi rnam smin smin gyur pa //
translated: matures again and again.üîΩWhen its maturation has matured,

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par smin pa smin zin par gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i rnam par smin pa smin zin par gyur pa ste /
translated: Its maturation has matured means that its maturation has already matured.

original: las kyi 'bras bu bskyed zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgal te ci'i phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa smin zin kyang /
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu bskyed zin pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te ci'i phyir las kyi rnam par smin pa smin zin kyang /
translated: This means that the result of the karma has already been generated.

original: yang dang yang du rnam par smin par 'gyur bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam par smin par 'gyur bar bshad ce na /
translated: If you ask why it is said that the karma ripens even though its result has already ripened,

original: gal te gang phyir las gnas pa //üîΩde phyir ngo bo nyid yod phyir //
analyzed: gal te gang phyir las gnas pa // de phyir ngo bo nyid yod phyir //
translated: it is because the karma remains.üîΩBecause it remains, it has an intrinsic reality.

original: gal te gang gi phyir @176b las ngo bo nyid kyis nges par gnas pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir @176b las ngo bo nyid kyis nges par gnas pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the karma definitely remains by its intrinsic reality, therefore it has an intrinsic reality.

original: gal te de gnas su zin kyang yang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te de gnas su zin kyang yang 'bras bu bskyed par mi nus te 'bras bu bskyed zin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that even though it remains, it is unable to generate a result again because the result has already been generated,

original: nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya bzhin no zhe na /
translated: like a promissory note that has already been paid.

original: nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya yang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin no ;
analyzed: nges par spyad zin pa'i dpang rgya yang don dam par ma grub pa'i phyir de ni lam ma yin no ;
translated: The seal of the definitely performed action is not ultimately established, so that is not the path.

original: // phyir rgol ba dag na re /
analyzed: // phyir rgol ba dag na re /
translated: Opponents say:

original: don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: An action definitely exists ultimately,

original: de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its cause exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni rgyu mi 'thad de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni rgyu mi 'thad de /
translated: Here, if something does not exist, its cause is untenable,

original: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rus sbal gyi spu'i gos bzhin no //
translated: like the cloth of a tortoise hair.

original: las la ni rgyu nyon mongs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: las la ni rgyu nyon mongs pa dag yod pas de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i mthus don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: Since the cause of action, the afflictions, exist, therefore, by the power of the stated reason, an action definitely exists ultimately.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good, because:

original: las ni nyon mongs bdag nyid na //
analyzed: las ni nyon mongs bdag nyid na //
translated: Action has the nature of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
translated: The afflictions are not real.

original: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
translated: If the afflictions are not real,

original: las ni de yis ji ltar byas //üîΩlas ni nyon mongs bdag nyid na //
analyzed: las ni de yis ji ltar byas // las ni nyon mongs bdag nyid na //
translated: how can action be produced by them?üîΩAction has the nature of the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni las 'di nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni las 'di nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that this action arises from the cause of the afflictions.

original: dper na bum pa 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bum pa 'jim pa'i bdag nyid yin na zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúIf the pot is of the nature of clay.

original: nyon mongs sems dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyon mongs sems dag yang dag min //
translated: Afflictions are not real in mind.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: This means that the nature of the afflictions does not exist.

original: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dag 'dod chags dang / chags pa brtag par de'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skye ba bkag pa'i phyir dag 'dod chags dang / chags pa brtag par de'i ngo bo nyid bkag pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because arising is refuted, they are pure. Because the nature of attachment and the one who is attached is refuted in the analysis of attachment and the one who is attached,

original: yang na 'og nas /üîΩgang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
analyzed: yang na 'og nas / gang dag sdug dang mi sdug pa'i //
translated: or else, as will be stated later:üîΩThose that arise in dependence

original: phyin ci log la brten 'byung ba //
analyzed: phyin ci log la brten 'byung ba //
translated: on the pleasant and the unpleasant

original: de dag ngo bo nyid med pas //
analyzed: de dag ngo bo nyid med pas //
translated: are essenceless.

original: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag min //üîΩzhes 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de phyir nyon mongs yang dag min // zhes 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore the afflictions are not real.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gal te nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na las de ;
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gal te nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag par ngo bo nyid med pa yin na las de ;
translated: Therefore, if the afflictions are not real in that way, how could karma

original: de dag gis byas par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis byas par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: be created by them?

original: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the cause of karma is not the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pa nyid dam /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the reason is not established,

original: don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: or else the meaning is contradictory.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: don dam par nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Afflictions definitely exist ultimately,

original: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their effect exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu gzung du med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist cannot be apprehended as an effect,

original: dper na 'on pa'i rna ba'i dbang po la 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'on pa'i rna ba'i dbang po la 'bras bu rna ba'i rnam par shes pa bzhin no //
translated: just as, for example, the effect of the sense faculty of the ear does not exist for one who is deaf.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams la ni 'bras bu las dang lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir don dam par /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams la ni 'bras bu las dang lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir don dam par /
translated: But since the effect of afflictions exists, which is characterized by karma and body, therefore, ultimately,

original: nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa kho na yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma @177a * //üîΩgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams ni yod pa kho na yin pas gtan tshigs kyi don ma @177a * // grub pa nyid do //
translated: afflictions definitely exist. Thus the meaning of the reason is not established.

original: don 'gal ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
analyzed: don 'gal ba nyid ma yin pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo //
translated: Or else, since the meaning is not contradictory, the intended meaning is established.

original: yang na don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: yang na don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Or else, karma definitely exists ultimately,

original: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because its effect exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni 'bras bu med de /
translated: Here, that which does not exist cannot be apprehended as an effect,üîΩjust as, for example, the effect of the sense faculty of the ear does not exist for one who is deaf.

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi 'bras bu bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi 'bras bu bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the fruit of a sky flower.

original: las la ni 'bras bu lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin pas lus yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las la ni 'bras bu lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pas de'i phyir don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin pas lus yod pa ma yin par sgrub pa'i rjes su dpag pa dag la rtog ge phyi mas gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: But since the effect of karma exists, which is the body, therefore karma exists ultimately. Therefore, the subsequent arguments that prove that the body does not exist are undermined by the later arguments.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
translated: Karma and affliction

original: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
analyzed: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
translated: Are taught to be the conditions of bodies.

original: bstan bcos las de ltar bstan pa ni tha snyad pa dag yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos las de ltar bstan pa ni tha snyad pa dag yin gyi don dam pa pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The teaching in the treatise is conventional, not ultimate.

original: don dam par ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la sgrub pa sngar bstan pa dag gis /
analyzed: don dam par ni kho bo cag gi phyogs la sgrub pa sngar bstan pa dag gis /
translated: In the ultimate, in our own system, the arguments presented earlier

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //
translated: If karma and affliction

original: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
translated: Are empty, how can you say that the body exists?

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dag kho na bzhin du lus kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir las dang nyon mongs pa dag kho na bzhin du lus kyang ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because karma and affliction are not established in reality, the body is not established in reality, just like karma and affliction.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pas ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yang ma nyams la dpe ma grub pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs kyi don ma grub pas ji skad bstan pa'i skyon yang ma nyams la dpe ma grub pas /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the reason ‚Äúbecause its effect exists‚Äù is not established, the fault stated above is not removed, and since the example is not established,

original: rtog ge phyi mas gnod pa yang med do //
analyzed: rtog ge phyi mas gnod pa yang med do //
translated: the later argument is also not harmed.

original: smras pa / don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: smras pa / don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection: Karma definitely exists ultimately,

original: de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the experiencer of its effect exists.

original: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po med de /
analyzed: 'di na gang med pa de la ni de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po med de /
translated: Here, if something does not exist, the experiencer of its effect does not exist,

original: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na nam mkha'i me tog gi phreng ba bzhin no //
translated: just like a garland of sky flowers.

original: las la ni 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po //
analyzed: las la ni 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po //
translated: The experiencer of the effect of karma

original: ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
translated: is the person who is obscured by ignorance.

original: sred ldan de ni za ba po //üîΩde yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
analyzed: sred ldan de ni za ba po // de yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
translated: The one who is desirous is the experiencer of the results of action.üîΩAnd that is not different from the agent,

original: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it identical with it.

original: zhes bya ba yod de /
analyzed: zhes bya ba yod de /
translated: This is the way it is.

original: de la ma rig pa ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos so //
analyzed: de la ma rig pa ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa'i chos so //
translated: Here, ignorance is a phenomenon that is the opposite of knowledge.

original: des bsgribs pa ni g-yogs pa'o //
analyzed: des bsgribs pa ni g-yogs pa'o //
translated: Being obscured by that is being covered by it.

original: skye bo gang zhes bya ba ni skye ba po gang yin pa ste srog chags so //üîΩsred ldan zhes bya ba la sred pa na 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: skye bo gang zhes bya ba ni skye ba po gang yin pa ste srog chags so // sred ldan zhes bya ba la sred pa na 'dod pa'o //
translated: The one who is born is the one who is born, the one who is living, the one who is an animal.üîΩThe one who is desirous is the one who desires.

original: de la kun du sbyor ba de nyid yod pas sred ldan te /
analyzed: de la kun du sbyor ba de nyid yod pas sred ldan te /
translated: He is called the one who is desirous because he is bound by desire.

original: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sred pa'i kun du sbyor ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he is the one who is bound by the fetter of desire.

original: de ni las kyi 'bras bu za ba po ste /
analyzed: de ni las kyi 'bras bu za ba po ste /
translated: He is the experiencer of the results of action.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: mdo sde las /
analyzed: mdo sde las /
translated: In a sutra:üîΩSentient beings obscured by ignorance,

original: ma rig pa sgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa'i kun du sbyor dang ldan //
analyzed: ma rig pa sgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa'i kun du sbyor dang ldan //
translated: bound by the fetter of desire,

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ste khyod @177b rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ste khyod @177b rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And similarly, if you yourself commit this sinful action, you yourself must experience its ripening.

original: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, the agent is not different from the action,

original: de nyid de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not that very action itself,

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be said to be either the same or different.

original: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i ma dus las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan tshigs ji skad smos pa'i ma dus las kyi 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pas /
translated: Therefore, because there is an experiencer of the effect of karma, as stated in the reason,

original: don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: don dam par las ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: karma definitely exists in reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ni bstan bcos kyi dang po kho nar dngos po spyir /
analyzed: de ni bstan bcos kyi dang po kho nar dngos po spyir /
translated: This was explained at the very beginning of the treatise in the general presentation of things:

original: de phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir rkyen las byung ma yin //
translated: Therefore it does not arise from conditions.

original: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung 'bras bu ni //
translated: An effect that does not arise from conditionsüîΩDoes not exist.

original: yod min 'bras bu med pas na ;
analyzed: yod min 'bras bu med pas na ;
translated: Since there is no effect,

original: / rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: / rkyen min rkyen du ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could a noncondition be a condition?

original: zhes bshad zin pas /
analyzed: zhes bshad zin pas /
translated: This was explained above.

original: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni //
analyzed: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni //
translated: Why is that?

original: rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing //
translated: Because this karma does not arise from conditions,

original: rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
analyzed: rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
translated: and does not arise from non-conditions.

original: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
analyzed: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
translated: Therefore, there is no agent.

original: de yang de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: This is because it is not arisen in the same way, because the agent is refuted, and because it does not substantially exist.

original: de'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar sgrub pa ji skad bstan pas /
translated: Therefore, in this way, as it has been taught,

original: gal te las dang byed med na //
analyzed: gal te las dang byed med na //
translated: if there is no karma and no agent,

original: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
analyzed: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
translated: how can there be a result arisen from karma?

original: des na / ji ste 'bras bu yod min na //
analyzed: des na / ji ste 'bras bu yod min na //
translated: If there is no result,

original: za ba po lta ga la yod //
analyzed: za ba po lta ga la yod //
translated: how can there be an experiencer?

original: za ba po'i sgrar brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
analyzed: za ba po'i sgrar brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar dgongs so //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúexperiencer‚Äù itself is causeless.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs de'i don ma grub pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the reason ‚Äúbecause there is an experiencer of its result‚Äù is unestablished.

original: log par ston pa ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: log par ston pa ni don 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: Misrepresenting the reason is contradictory to the meaning.

original: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir kha cig gis smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: las dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba yin pas /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu la skur ba 'debs pa'i lta ba ni log par lta ba yin pas /
translated: The view that denies karma and its effects is wrong view.

original: dbu ma smra ba lta ba'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: dbu ma smra ba lta ba'i skyon gyi ling tog gis blo gros kyi mig bsgribs pa rnams la de kho na mthong ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that those whose eyes of intelligence are obscured by the cataracts of bad views see reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:üîΩJust as an emanationüîΩThrough the perfection of his magical power

original: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
translated: Emanates another emanation,üîΩAnd that emanation emanates another,üîΩSo too, the agent

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //üîΩsprul zhing sprul pas gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis // sprul zhing sprul pas gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Acts through the perfection of his magical power.üîΩHe emanates another emanation, and that emanation emanates another.üîΩSo too, the agent acts through the perfection of his magical power.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //üîΩsprul par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar // sprul par byed pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Just as the emanation is like the nature of the emanator,üîΩso too the agent acts just like the emanation.

original: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas //üîΩde yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
analyzed: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas // de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
translated: The agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation.

original: de bzhin du byed pa pos las gang byas pa'i byed pa po de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /üîΩthog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pa las byung ba'i bdag nyid bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du byed pa pos las gang byas pa'i byed pa po de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin te /üîΩthog ma med pa nas rkyen brgyud pa las byung ba'i bdag nyid bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The agent acts just like the emanation.üîΩThe agent acts just like the emanation

original: las de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin @178a * //
analyzed: las de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin @178a * //
translated: And that action is like an emanation,

original: te ; ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te ; ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
translated: Just as an emanation emanates another emanation,üîΩso it is.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul pa mdzad pa de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sprul pas sprul pa gzhan zhig sprul pa mdzad pa de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa bzhin no //
translated: Just as an emanation of a Tathagata emanates another emanation, so it is.üîΩAfflictions, actions, and bodies,üîΩthe agent and the effects,üîΩare like a city of gandharvas,

original: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang // smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: like a mirage, like a dream.

original: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pas tha snyad du grags pa mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa'i tshogs su gyur pa dag tha snyad du khas len pas /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pas bskyed pas tha snyad du grags pa mtho ris dang byang grol 'thob pa'i tshogs su gyur pa dag tha snyad du khas len pas /
translated: Since they are produced by the aggregation of causes and conditions, we conventionally accept the aggregates that are renowned in the world and that are conducive to attaining high status and definite goodness.

original: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu la skur pa mi 'debs pas ji skad smras pa'i skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, since we do not deny the relation between actions and their effects, we do not commit the error that we claim to commit.

original: gal te don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas de ni lan ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don dam par de dag la skur pa btab pas de ni lan ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not a response because ultimately they are deprecations,

original: de ni sngar /üîΩgal te dngos por ma grub na //
analyzed: de ni sngar / gal te dngos por ma grub na //
translated: then that was previouslyüîΩstated:üîΩIf things are not established,

original: dngos med grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos med grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: nonthings are not established.

original: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
analyzed: yod ces bya ba rtag par 'dzin //
translated: Saying ‚Äúexists‚Äù is to grasp permanence;

original: med ces bya ba chad par lta //üîΩde phyir yod dang med pa la //
analyzed: med ces bya ba chad par lta // de phyir yod dang med pa la //
translated: saying ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù is to view annihilation.üîΩTherefore the wise do not

original: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mkhas pas gnas par mi bya'o //
translated: dwell on existence or nonexistence.

original: zhes bya ba bstan pa der bsgrub pa smras pas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bstan pa der bsgrub pa smras pas /
translated: In that context, the response to the proof

original: las dang 'bras bu med par smra ba khas blangs pa'i phyir lan ma yin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu med par smra ba khas blangs pa'i phyir lan ma yin pa ma yin no //
translated: was stated. Therefore it is not the case that it is not a response because it accepts the statement that actions and effects do not exist.

original: yang na rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na las dang 'bras bu dang de dag 'brel ba dang / byed pa po dang za ba po dag med pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa rnams kyi rnam par rmongs pa'i yol ba bshu ba'i phyir las la sogs pa kun rdzob tu sprul pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa
analyzed: yang na rnam par rmongs pa'i sems dang ldan pa dag don dam par dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid med pa nyid yin na las dang 'bras bu dang de dag 'brel ba dang / byed pa po dang za ba po dag med pas tshangs par spyod pa la gnas pa don med par 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa rnams kyi rnam par rmongs pa'i yol ba bshu ba'i phyir las la sogs pa kun rdzob tu sprul pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa
translated: In order to remove the curtain of confusion of those who think in this way, karma and so on are taught to exist conventionally, like an emanation and so on.

original: bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin du yod par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to teach that they exist like an emanation, it says:

original: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //
translated: Just as the one who displays the emanation

original: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis //üîΩsprul zhing sprul pa gzhan sprul byed //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis // sprul zhing sprul pa gzhan sprul byed //
translated: Through the perfection of his miraculous powersüîΩEmanates and causes another emanation,

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
translated: And that emanation also does the same,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: And so on extensively.

original: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni /
analyzed: de la 'dir rab tu byed pa'i don ni /
translated: Here the meaning of the chapter is as follows.

original: pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas /
analyzed: pha rol pos rab tu byed pa'i dang por smras pa'i gtan tshigs kyi skyon brjod pas /
translated: The opponent‚Äôs statement at the beginning of the chapter is the reason for the fault.

original: las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus the nonexistence of the nature of karma and its effects is taught.

original: de'i phyir gang la las kyang med las kyi 'bras bu yang med pa de ni byang chub bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang la las kyang med las kyi 'bras bu yang med pa de ni byang chub bo //
translated: Therefore, that in which there is no karma and no effect of karma is awakening.

original: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du 'thob pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du 'thob pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is awakening, so is the attainment of awakening.

original: 'thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du lung bstan pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'thob pa ji lta ba bzhin du lung bstan pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is the attainment, so is the prophecy.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la ni las kyang med las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa rnams kyi rigs gang yin pa de la ni las kyang med las kyi rnam par smin pa yang med do //
translated: Just as is the lineage of the noble ones, so in that there is no karma and no ripening of karma.

original: rigs de la ni lus @178b kyis kyang las mi byed /üîΩdag gis kyang mi byed /
analyzed: rigs de la ni lus @178b kyis kyang las mi byed / dag gis kyang mi byed /
translated: In that lineage, the body does not perform karma.üîΩSpeech does not perform karma.üîΩThe mind does not perform karma.

original: yid kyis kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyis kyang mi byed do zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag grub pa yin no //
translated: All of these statements are established.

original: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
analyzed: slob dpon legs ldan byed kyis nye bar sbyar ba /
translated: This is the composition of the master BhƒÅviveka.

original: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
analyzed: dbu ma'i rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma las /
translated: In the Lamp for the Fundamental Treatise,

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the chapter on the examination of action and effect is

original: rab tu byed la bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed la bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: the seventeenth chapter.

original: // / da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa brtsam
analyzed: // / da ni gzhan gyis smras pa'i sgrub pa bsal ba dang bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa kha na ma tho ba med pa bstan pas 'du byed rnams bdag dang bdag gis stong pa nyid du bstan pa'i don gyi dbang gis rab tu byed pa bco brgyad pa brtsam
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the refutation of the arguments of others and the faultlessness of our own arguments, the eighteenth chapter is composed in terms of the meaning of the teaching that compounded phenomena are empty of self and being mine.

original: mo // de la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa du ma dag gi yul yang phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: mo // de la bdag tu lta ba rnam pa du ma dag gi yul yang phung po yin pa'i phyir phung po rnams kho na las brtsams nas dpyad par bya ste /
translated: Since the object of the many different views of self is the aggregates, we should analyze the aggregates.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang /
translated: Thus the BhagavƒÅn also said:

original: dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag bdag tu yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong ngam bram ze gang dag bdag tu yang dag par rjes su lta ba de dag thams cad ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po 'di dag nyid la yang dag par rjes su lta'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: All those who view the self as real, whether they are monks or brahmins, they all view the five aggregates that are appropriated.

original: de la re zhig gang dag 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam par 'jug pa dag gam /
analyzed: de la re zhig gang dag 'byung ba chen po lus kyi rnam par 'jug pa dag gam /
translated: Here, first, those who say that the self is the body that is the manifestation of the great elements,

original: 'byung ba 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba 'dus pa'am /
translated: the aggregation of the elements,

original: dbang po rnams sam /
analyzed: dbang po rnams sam /
translated: the sense faculties,

original: dbang po 'dus pa'am /
analyzed: dbang po 'dus pa'am /
translated: the aggregation of the sense faculties,

original: rnam par shes pa bdag yin no zhes smra ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bdag yin no zhes smra ba de dag la 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste /
translated: or consciousness should be addressed as follows:

original: 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang / dbang po dang / rnam par shes pa so so 'am /
translated: Are the elements, the sense faculties, and consciousness individually orüîΩcollectively the self?

original: 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
analyzed: 'dus pa dag phung po'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de dag bdag yin par rtog na /
translated: If you imagine that they are the self because they have the characteristics of aggregates,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na ji ltar kho bo cag gis tha snyad kyi don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na ji ltar kho bo cag gis tha snyad kyi don du phung po'i yul la bdag ces ston par byed pa lta bu yin nam /
translated: then if the aggregates are the self, are they the self in the same way that we describe the self as the object of conventions?

original: 'on te gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig yin /
translated: Or are they the self in some other way?

original: gal te ji ltar yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar yang rung ste /
translated: If, in some way,

original: bdag grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: bdag grub pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i don grub bo zhe na /
translated: the object of desire is accomplished because of the establishment of the self,

original: de'i phyir da de dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir da de dpyad par bya ste /
translated: then this should be investigated.

original: khyed 'dod pa ltar /
analyzed: khyed 'dod pa ltar /
translated: As you assert,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: if the aggregates are the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur /
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur /
translated: then it would be subject to production and destruction.

original: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates are subject to production and destruction.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni phung po'i chos ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni phung po'i chos ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: In this way, he shows that the aggregates are subject to production and destruction.

original: 'dir skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul gyis gzung bar zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dir skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyang mtshan nyid kyi sgra'i tshul gyis gzung bar zad kyi /
translated: Here, being subject to production and destruction is merely grasped by the method of definition.

original: ji ltar phung po'i chos skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar phung po'i chos skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the aggregates are subject to production and destruction,

original: phung po'i chos 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan @179a * //
analyzed: phung po'i chos 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / rtogs par bya ba nyid dang / rnam par smin pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan @179a * //
translated: in the same way, the aggregates are subject to being a result, a cause, something to be understood, something that is karmic maturation, and so on.

original: dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: dag kyang yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: and pure.

original: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir sbyor ba'i tshig ni don dam par 'byung ba dang / 'byung ba 'dus pa dang / dbang po dang dbang po 'dus pa dang / rnam par shes pa dang / dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus dang / rnam par shes pa dang bcas pa'i lus ni bdag ma yin te /
translated: Here is the syllogism: Ultimately, the elements, the coming together of the elements, the sense faculties, the coming together of the sense faculties, consciousness, the body with the sense faculties, and the body with consciousness are not the self,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have the nature of arising and passing away.

original: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol gyi 'byung ba dag bzhin no //
translated: For example, like the external elements.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs re res kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs re res kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, each of the reasons, ‚Äúbecause of being an effect,‚Äù etc., should be elaborated in an inference.

original: gsal bar smra ba dag la yang gsal ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas pa smra ba rnams la rang gi rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
analyzed: gsal bar smra ba dag la yang gsal ba'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa dag la bdag med pa nyid med na mi 'byung ba'i phyir lus bdag dang bcas pa smra ba rnams la rang gi rjes su dpag pas gnod do //
translated: And for the proponents of manifestation, the body with the self is refuted by their own inference, because of manifestation, because of the absence of the self in pots, etc., which are manifestations.

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lus la bdag mang po nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: the self would be many.

original: phung po mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: phung po mang ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder of the sentence is: because the aggregates are many.üîΩOr else,

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: the self would be subject to production and destruction.

original: zhes bya ba ni des na phung por rjes su dpag pas skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyis bdag gi chos can gyi khyad par skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni des na phung por rjes su dpag pas skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid kyis bdag gi chos can gyi khyad par skye ba dang / 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, because the aggregates are inferred to be the self, the self would be subject to production and destruction. The remainder of the sentence is: because the aggregates are subject to production and destruction.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi khyad par bstsal ba'i skyon yod do //
translated: The fault is that the thesis is contradicted by the nature of the subject.üîΩOr else,

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: the self would be subject to production and destruction.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The remainder of the sentence is:

original: des na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du rjes su dpog pas bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi de'i bdag nyid bstsal ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: des na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid du rjes su dpog pas bdag ma yin pa nyid kyis bdag gi de'i bdag nyid bstsal ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Therefore, since it is inferred that it has the attributes of arising and disintegrating, it is not the self.

original: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do ;
analyzed: dam bcas pa la chos can gyi ngo bo nyid bstsal ba'i skyon yod do ;
translated: Thus, the error of refuting the nature of the subject is committed with respect to the thesis.

original: / yang na /
analyzed: / yang na /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: if the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: zhes bya ba ni bdag ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / don dam par bdag med par smra bar nus te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni bdag ni skye ba dang / 'jig pa can du mi 'dod pas de'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa yod pa nyid du bstan dka' ba dang / don dam par bdag med par smra bar nus te /
translated: Since the self is not asserted to have the attributes of arising and disintegrating, it is difficult to demonstrate that it exists and has a nature that is not that of the self.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ri bong gi rva bzhin no //
translated: It is possible to say that ultimately the self does not exist because it does not have the attributes of arising and disintegrating, like the horn of an ass.üîΩMoreover,

original: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na //üîΩskye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: yang na / gal te phung po bdag yin na // skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: if the aggregates were the self,üîΩit would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni phung po rnams skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since the aggregates have the attributes of arising and disintegrating, the self would also have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: des na don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / @179b rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
analyzed: des na don dam par gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / @179b rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi phung po lnga po dag ni bdag ma yin par shes par byar nus te /
translated: Therefore, it is possible to understand that the five aggregates, which are characterized as capable of being physically manifest, as experience, as grasping an image, as being a formative factor, and as consciousness, are not the self,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because they have the nature of arising and passing away.

original: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu nyid dang / rgyu nyid dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang rjes su dpag pa rgyas par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should elaborate the inference by means of other reasons, such as being the effect, being the cause, being the cause of pleasure and pain, being the cause of doubtful knowledge and false knowledge, and so on.

original: bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba yin par brjod pa /
analyzed: bye brag pa dag ni bdag lus dang / dbang po dang / blo las gzhan pa bde ba la sogs pa'i gzhir gyur pa dang / byed pa po dang / sems pa med pa dang / rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba yin par brjod pa /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ikas say that the self is different from the body, the sense faculties, and the mind; it is the basis of pleasure and so on; it is the agent; it is not conscious; it is permanent; and it is all-pervading.üîΩThe SƒÅ·πÉkhyas say that the self is different from the effect and the cause; it is not an agent; it is an experiencer; it is pure; it is all-pervading; it is unchanging; and it is conscious.

original: grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa byed pa po ma yin pa dang / za ba po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang de bzhin pas de dag la sgrub pa 'di mi gnod do zhe na /
analyzed: grangs can dag ni bdag 'bras bu dang rgyu las gzhan pa byed pa po ma yin pa dang / za ba po dang / dag pa dang / thams cad du song ba dang / mi 'gyur ba dang / sems pa yod pa yin par brjod cing skyes bu rgyur 'dod pa dag kyang de bzhin pas de dag la sgrub pa 'di mi gnod do zhe na /
translated: Since the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas who assert puru·π£a as the cause also assert that, for them this proof is not harmful.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag bstan dka' ba nges par mdzad nas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyis phung po las gzhan pa'i bdag bstan dka' ba nges par mdzad nas de dag gi phyir bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, the master NƒÅgƒÅrjuna, having ascertained that it is difficult to teach a self that is different from the aggregates, explained for their sake:

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If it is different from the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med pa ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin te /
translated: The aggregates do not have the characteristics of the self, because the self does not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: de gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de gzugs su rung ba dang / myong ba dang / mtshan mar 'dzin pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa dang / rnam par shes par byed pa'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the self would not have the characteristics of form, feeling, conception, formations, or consciousness.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni brtags pa'i bdag gi chos ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni brtags pa'i bdag gi chos ni phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, this shows that the self imagined by the non-Buddhists does not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: dpe ni de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin no //
analyzed: dpe ni de'i dbang gis bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub pa'i chos gnyi ga la grags pa'i chos can mo gsham gyi bu la sogs pa dag yin no //
translated: The example is the commonly recognized subject, such as the son of a barren woman, in relation to which both the property to be established and the sign are established.

original: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su dpag pa ni don dam par bdag gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po las gzhan pa med de /
translated: Here, the inference is as follows: ultimately, the self does not exist as different from the aggregates of form and so on,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na mo gsham gyi bu bzhin no //
translated: because it does not have the characteristics of the aggregates, like the son of a barren woman.

original: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mya ngan las 'das pa phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that nirvana is not ascertained because it does not have the characteristics of a thing,üîΩthen that is not so, because it is not the case that there is no counterexample, as the treatise Attainment of Knowledge states:

original: de ni / mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
analyzed: de ni / mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //
translated: An entity without characteristics

original: 'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba der mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin /
analyzed: 'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin // zhes bya ba der mya ngan las 'das pa la sogs pa 'dus ma byas kyi dngos po bsal ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pas ma nges pa nyid ma yin /
translated: does not exist anywhere.

original: @180a * // no ;üîΩ/ gal te bstan bcos mdzad pas /
analyzed: @180a * // no ; / gal te bstan bcos mdzad pas /
translated: Thus, nirvana and so on are unconditioned entities.

original: dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma chang ba'i skyon yod do zhe na /
analyzed: dam bcas pa la sogs pa'i yan lag ma brjod pa'i phyir sgrub pa ma chang ba'i skyon yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the fault of incomplete proof exists because the author of the treatise does not state the parts of a proof,

original: don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir skyon med de /
analyzed: don gyi tshig yin pa'i phyir skyon med de /
translated: then there is no fault because this is a statement of the meaning.

original: 'di ltar slob dpon gyi tshig dag ni don gyi tshig dag yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar slob dpon gyi tshig dag ni don gyi tshig dag yin te /
translated: This is because the words of the master are words of meaning,

original: yi ge mdor bsdus pa dang / don rgya che ba dag yin pas don gyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag gi gzhi yin par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yi ge mdor bsdus pa dang / don rgya che ba dag yin pas don gyi dbang gis sbyor ba'i tshig du ma dag gi gzhi yin par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for he accepts that they are the basis of many statements of application that are concise in terms of syllables but extensive in meaning.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig la ni de skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig la ni de skyon du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But this is not a fault in the words of the syllogism.

original: yang na de la yang mi 'gyur te /üîΩrab tu byed pa'am /
analyzed: yang na de la yang mi 'gyur te / rab tu byed pa'am /
translated: Or, it is not a fault even in that.

original: lung las la la la yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na'o //
analyzed: lung las la la la yan lag 'ga' zhig grags pa yin na'o //
translated: For, in some cases, a part of the reason is well known from a treatise or from scripture.

original: kha cig na re phyogs la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re phyogs la sogs pa dag gis gtan tshigs snga ma ma nges pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: Some say that the previous reason is not established because of the directions, etc.

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /üîΩmtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni //üîΩ'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin //
