analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te / mtshan nyid med pa'i dngos po ni // 'ga' yang gang na yod ma yin //
translated: That is not good,

original: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bas lan btab zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been answered by the statement,üîΩThere is no entityüîΩWithout a characteristic.

original: rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i gzhi ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúall-pervading‚Äù is not a basis of pleasure, pain, etc.,

original: skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba can yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na gzugs la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: because of the reasons ‚Äúbecause of being a product,‚Äù etc., as in the case of form, etc.

original: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: bdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te //
analyzed: bdag ni khyab bdag ma yin te //
translated: The self is not the all-pervading lord,

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because of being a substance, as in the case of a pot.

original: gal te nam mkhas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nam mkhas ma nges pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the self is not ascertained because of space,

original: nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' rdzas su yod pa nyid bkag pa'i phyir dang / de'i khyab bdag nyid kyang bdag gi khyab bdag nyid bzhin du bkag pa'i phyir ma nges pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: we reply that space is not a substance, and the self is not the ruler of space, just as it is not the ruler of itself.

original: de bzhin du bdag ni byed pa po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ni byed pa po ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the self is not an agent,

original: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no /
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa'i phyir dper na las bzhin no /
translated: because it is not a body, like an action.

original: bdag ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rtag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The self is not permanent,

original: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rdzas yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a substance, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes bya nyid dang / brjod par bya ba nyid dang / dngos po nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, it is also said that the self is not an object of knowledge, not an object of expression, and not a thing, because of the reasons stated above.

original: bdag ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The self is not without a cause,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na bum pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a thing, like a pot.

original: de bzhin du tshig gi don nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig gi don nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir ro zhes kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, it should be said that the self is not a knower because it is the meaning of the term, and so on.

original: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam par bdag ni sems pa yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: So too, in the ultimate truth, the self is not a knower,

original: rtag pa yang ma yin thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin thams cad du song ba yang ma yin /
translated: it is not permanent, it does not pervade all,

original: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: and it is not causeless.

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag @180b pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' yang dag @180b pa'i shes pa dang / log pa'i shes pa dang / the tshom can gyi shes pa'i rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / lan 'ga' dga' ba dang / yongs su gdung ba'i rgyu nyid yin pa la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: Because it is a thing, because it is the cause of a correct consciousness, an incorrect consciousness, and a doubting consciousness, and because it is the cause of pleasure, pain, and so on, it is like a pillar.

original: yang grangs can gyi phyogs la brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: yang grangs can gyi phyogs la brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now we will discuss the SƒÅ·πÉkhya position.

original: don dam par bdag ni za ba po ma yin te /
analyzed: don dam par bdag ni za ba po ma yin te /
translated: In the ultimate truth, the self is not an enjoyer,

original: the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: the tshom can gyi shes pa la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is the cause of a doubting consciousness and so on.

original: dper na sdong dum dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na sdong dum dang / bum pa bzhin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: For example, it is like a stump or a pot.

original: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du dbu ma pas bdag tshig gi don nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa mi rigs te /
analyzed: ci ste yang la la 'di snyam du dbu ma pas bdag tshig gi don nyid du khas ma blangs pa'i phyir de'i khyad par bstan pa mi rigs te /
translated: But if someone thinks, ‚ÄúIt is not right to teach the attributes of the self because the MƒÅdhyamika does not accept the self as the referent of the term,‚Äù

original: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang / dkar sham nyid la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
analyzed: dper na mo gsham gyi bu'i sngo bsangs dang / dkar sham nyid la sogs pa bzhin no snyam du sems na /
translated: like the blueness or whiteness of the son of a barren woman,

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: that is not good.

original: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ste /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i srid pa len pa'i phyir bdag ces bya ste /
translated: Because it takes up the existence of rebirth, it is called the self.

original: rnam par shes pa'i yul la bdag tu tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la bdag tu brjod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i yul la bdag tu tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir rnam par shes pa la bdag tu brjod de /
translated: Because the object of consciousness is designated as the self, consciousness is called the self.

original: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Thus the Blessed One said:

original: sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
analyzed: sems dul ba ni dge ba ste //
translated: A tamed mind is virtuous.

original: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: dul ba'i sems kyis bde ba 'thob //
translated: With a tamed mind one attains happiness.

original: ces gsungs nas mdo sde gzhan las /
analyzed: ces gsungs nas mdo sde gzhan las /
translated: Having said that, in another s≈´tra he said:

original: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: bdag gi mgon ni bdag nyid yin //
translated: One‚Äôs own self is one‚Äôs own protector.

original: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni mgon du su zhig 'gyur //
translated: Who else could be one‚Äôs protector?

original: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas ;
analyzed: mkhas pa bdag nyid legs dul bas ;
translated: Because the wise one is well-disciplined himself,

original: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur //üîΩzhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: mtho ris dag kyang 'thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs pas /
translated: he will even attain the higher realms.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad du bdag spyir khas blangs pa'i khyad par ma grags pa sel ba'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad du bdag spyir khas blangs pa'i khyad par ma grags pa sel ba'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, because we eliminate the unknown particular of the self that is generally accepted conventionally, there is no fault.

original: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
analyzed: yang na sbyor ba'i lam gzhan bya ste /
translated: Or else, one should make another application:

original: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus ni rtag pa dang / thams cad du song ba'i tshig gi don gyi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: The body together with the sense faculties is not the uncommon cause of the object of the word ‚Äúpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúall-pervading,‚Äù

original: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no //
translated: because it is not an object of perception, like a pillar.

original: de bzhin du gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhal bya yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should state the reasons, ‚Äúbecause it is an object of knowledge,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dir bdag tu smra bdag phyir zlog par byed de /
analyzed: 'dir bdag tu smra bdag phyir zlog par byed de /
translated: Here, the proponents of the self are refuted:

original: phung po lnga dang lus la bdag med do zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
analyzed: phung po lnga dang lus la bdag med do zhes bya ba de'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of ‚Äúthe five aggregates and the body are without self‚Äù?

original: gal te de dag la bdag med do zhe na ni dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te de dag la bdag med do zhe na ni dpe med de /
translated: If you say that the self does not exist in them, then there is no example,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag la yang de yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pot, etc. also exist.

original: gal te de la dmigs par mi byed do zhe na ni de lta na yang dpe med de /
analyzed: gal te de la dmigs par mi byed do zhe na ni de lta na yang dpe med de /
translated: If you say that it is not perceived in them, then again there is no example,

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni yul dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir @181a * //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni yul dmigs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir @181a * //
translated: because the pot, etc. are the cause of the perception of the object.

original: ro ; / gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ro ; / gal te dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not the uncommon cause of the perception,

original: de lta na yang dpe med de /
analyzed: de lta na yang dpe med de /
translated: then again there is no example,

original: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa dag ni dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the pot, etc. are the uncommon cause of the perception.

original: de la 'dir phung po lnga dang / lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la 'dir phung po lnga dang / lus ni bdag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu thun mong ma yin pa nyid kyang ma yin no zhes dam bcas pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, the five aggregates and the body are not the uncommon cause of the perception of the self.

original: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa sun dbyung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no /
analyzed: ji skad smras pa'i sgrub pa sun dbyung bar nus pa'i lan ma yin no /
translated: Therefore, this is not an answer that can refute the proof as stated.

original: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu gsum pa /
analyzed: // / dbu ma rtsa ba'i 'grel pa shes rab sgron ma bam po bcu gsum pa /
translated: The thirteenth chapter of the Lamp of Wisdom, a commentary on the Root Verses on the Middle Way.

original: yang na rnal 'byor pas rang nyid kyis 'di brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na rnal 'byor pas rang nyid kyis 'di brtag par bya ste /
translated: Or, the yogi should investigate this himself:

original: 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la bdag ces bya ba gang yin pa de ci phung po rnams kyi mtshan nyid dam /
translated: What is called ‚Äúself‚Äù in this [world], is it the characteristic of the aggregates,

original: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te phung po rnams las gzhan zhig yin /
translated: or is it something other than the aggregates?

original: de la re zhig / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: de la re zhig / gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: First, if the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have the characteristics of arising and disintegrating.

original: des na de dag bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag bdag ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, they are not the self,

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa can yin pa'i phyir dper na ka ba bzhin no //
translated: because they have the characteristics of arising and disintegrating, like a pillar, for example.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If [the self] were other than the aggregates,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: it would not have the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: des na de ni med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: des na de ni med pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, it does not exist at all,

original: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
analyzed: phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin pa'i phyir dper na nam mkha'i me tog bzhin no //
translated: because it does not have the characteristics of the aggregates, like a sky flower, for example.

original: de bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma skyes pa nyid dang / rgyu med pa nyid la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gis kyang bdag med par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Likewise, one should understand selflessness through such reasons as ‚Äúnon-arisenness‚Äù and ‚Äúcauselessness.‚Äù

original: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag tu smra ba dag na re bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The proponents of a self say, ‚ÄúThe self definitely exists.

original: don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is seen.

original: 'di ltar lus la bdag med na dbang po sems med pa skar khung dang 'dra bas don mthong bar mi 'thad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar lus la bdag med na dbang po sems med pa skar khung dang 'dra bas don mthong bar mi 'thad kyi /
translated: Thus, if the body were without a self, the insentient sense faculties, like a window, would not be tenable as seeing the object.

original: bdag des ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan mthong bar rigs pas /
analyzed: bdag des ni de dang mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba gzhan mthong bar rigs pas /
translated: It is reasonable that the self, which is different from those, sees.

original: gang gis mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: gang gis mthong ba de ni bdag yin te /
translated: Therefore, the one who sees is the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Therefore, the self definitely exists.‚Äù

original: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni bzang po ma yin te /
translated: That is not good.

original: don mthong ba ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩlus 'di bdag dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: don mthong ba ni bdag gi chos nyid yin par ma grub pa'i phyir dang / rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // lus 'di bdag dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Because it is not established that seeing the object is the intrinsic nature of the self, and because there is no concomitance.üîΩIf one posits ‚ÄúThis body is with a self,‚Äù

original: zhes phyogs su byed na yang /
analyzed: zhes phyogs su byed na yang /
translated: then,

original: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs thun mong ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the unique reason.üîΩüîΩ

original: 'dis ni g-yas pas mthong ba /
analyzed: 'dis ni g-yas pas mthong ba /
translated: This is the unique reason.üîΩThis is the reply to the arguments of those who say that the body is the self, that the self is the seer,

original: g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
analyzed: g-yon pas ngo shes pa'i phyir dang / nyams su myong ba dran pa'i phyir dang / las dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gtan tshigs dag gi lan kyang btab pa yin no //
translated: that the self is the experiencer, that the self is the agent of all actions, that the self is the enjoyer of the fruits of actions, that the self is the experiencer of pleasure and pain, that the self is the one who abandons and attains, and that the self is the one who knows.

original: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gis smras pa /üîΩlus la bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos @181b su yod de /
analyzed: mkhas par rlom pa gzhan dag gis smras pa / lus la bdag go zhes bya ba'i sgra gang yin pa de ni yul gzhan la dngos @181b su yod de /
translated: Other philosophers, who are conceited with a false pride, say:üîΩThe word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in reference to the body, because it is the object of the idea of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù because it is the object of the notion of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù because it is the basis of the notion of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and because it is the object of the notion of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i seng ge ral pa dang / ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa'i phyir dper na bram ze'i khye'u la seng ge'i sgra nye bar btags pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa'i seng ge ral pa dang / ze ba spungs pa can la don ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúself‚Äù is used in reference to the body, because it is the object of the idea of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù because it is the object of the notion of ‚Äúmine,‚Äù because it is the basis of the notion of ‚ÄúI,‚Äù and because it is the object of the notion of ‚ÄúI am.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra lus dang dbang po dang / blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de yang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag ces bya ba'i sgra lus dang dbang po dang / blo tsam dag la nye bar btags pa de yang 'ga' zhig la nye bar btags pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, the term ‚Äúself‚Äù is applied to the body, the faculties, and mere awareness, but it is not applied to any of them individually.

original: de ni de las gzhan pa de la dngos su yod pas de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan pa de la dngos su yod pas de ni bdag yin te /
translated: Therefore, since it exists in reality as something other than them, it is the self.

original: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag ni yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, the self certainly exists.

original: yang na bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i yul can yin par nges par shes te /
analyzed: yang na bdag ces bya bar shes pa'i blo gang yin pa de ni don ji lta ba bzhin pa'i yul can yin par nges par shes te /
translated: Or, the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù is definitely a cognition that has a real object,

original: yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir dper na sdong dum la mir shes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is a mistaken cognition with respect to another object, like the cognition of a man with respect to a stump.

original: de bzhin du rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i yul la bdag tu shes pa de yang log par shes pa yin pas de ltar yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul gang la don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa de ni bdag yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i yul la bdag tu shes pa de yang log par shes pa yin pas de ltar yul gzhan la log par shes pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i yul gang la don ji lta ba bzhin yin pa de ni bdag yin te /
translated: Likewise, the cognition that thinks ‚ÄúI‚Äù with respect to the object, which is the cause and effect, is also a mistaken cognition. Thus, because it is a mistaken cognition with respect to another object, the object that is different from it and that is real is the self.
